loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of cooking fat, sugar, bread and other items

loans.name: Yeniba

texts.es:
La socia  Yeniba pertenece al banco comunal LIDERNADO LAS PALMERAS, la socia tiene 34 años de edad ,02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna a sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares ,amigos entre otros ,la socia vende perfumes, colonias, cremas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yeniba belongs to the communal bank LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, and is a single mother of two children.  She works daily  selling beauty products.  The business has been going well for her because she has worked hard at this every day for a long time.  Her customers are friends and relatives among others.  Yeniba sells perfume, cologne and creams among other products.  She wants to continue this work to support her family.  

Yeniba is asking for a loan to buy women's perfumes for her business.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy women's perfume for her sales business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, sigue atendiendo su sala de belleza y mejorando su situación económica, esto es posible por la buena administración del crédito anterior.
Para Rosa los créditos son una herramienta que le ayudan a prosperar por lo que opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de tintes, tratamientos, cremas, cosméticos, esmaltes, entre otros productos básicos para atender muy bien a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa continues looking after her beauty salon and improving her economic situation. This is possible due to the good administration of the previous loan. 

For Rosa, the loans are a tool that help her to prosper, and so she chooses to request a new loan in order to invest it in the purchase of dyes, treatments, creams, cosmetics and nail polish among other basic products in order to tend to her customers well.

loans.use: to buy dyes, treatments, creams, cosmetics, and nail polish.

loans.name: Ankabenkelekan 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Ankabenkelekan 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec Awa, assise au bout et à gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Ankabenkelekan 1 group are married women. On average, they are 40 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in Fonfona, a village in Koutiala, which is in the third administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their businesses through the rainy season. This is their ninth loan with the institution, and their previous loans were repaid. 

They plant rice and peanuts with Awa, who is seated in front at left. With her loan, she would like to pay for fertilizer, seeds, farming materials, and plowing to maintain 1.5 hectares of land. 

After the harvest, they sell their crops in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed clientele. She would like to earn an average profit of 95,000 FCFA by the end of the season. This profit will allow her to pay her loan and help her family with their household spending.

loans.use: pay for plowing, seeds, farm inputs, and other farming materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products, a generator, a refrigerator and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 36 years old and married. She has three children, who are in school. Amelita works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

In the future Amelita would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Gloria is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase an additional stock of vegetables to sell, at her vegetable-vending business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
Mylen is married and has four children, who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mylen is 33 years old. She has a business, buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in the business for one year.

Mylen requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF. The loan will enable her to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is twenty-five years old and married. She has three children, who are in school. Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business, and now she needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jenelyn has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF. This will enable her to rebuild her family's home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jenelyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to rebuild her family's home, which was destroyed by typhoon Haiyan.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is forty years old and has eight children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Lorena is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Lorena has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her food vending.

With your help, Lorena can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nicel

texts.en:
On November 8, 2013, Nicel's business and home were wiped out by super-typhoon Haiyan. She has rebuilt and restarted her business, and she is now looking to build a house for her family. 

She is requesting a PhP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house. With your help she will be more readily able to rebuild her devastated life.

Nicel works hard to support her family. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia, age 52, saw her business and home destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ofelia has rebuilt and restarted her business, and she now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Ofelia and her husband have three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia has requested a PhP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase materials with which to rebuild her family home. She will buy building materials and pay for construction labor.

She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so that she can rebuild the family home, which was destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 45 years old, married, and has six children. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. She is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Dolores has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. With your help, Dolores can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.en:
Eduarda is fifty years old and married with ten children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Eduarda's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Eduarda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Eduarda has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Eduarda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар родилась в 1985 году. Она добросовестная и жизнерадостная женщина. Нилуфар замужем и воспитывает дочь, которую зовут Дурдона. Нилуфар умеет шить женские платья и поэтому она решила организовать свой собственный бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Нилуфар с такой целью участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она получила много полезного для себя. Она нуждается финансовой поддержке, чтобы купить швейную машинку и ткани. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nilufar was born in 1985. She is a cheerful, conscientious woman who is married and has a daughter named Durdona. Nilufar can sew women's dresses and decided to start her own business. With this goal in mind, she took part in the course "Achieving Success," organized by the Association of Women in Business. She learned a lot of useful things. She needs financial support to buy a sewing machine and fabric. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric to start a new business

loans.name: Bebeline

texts.en:
Bebeline, age 36, and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out and her family home destroyed. She and her husband have three children. Her goal is to offer her family safe shelter.

Bebeline has requested a housing loan amounting to PhP 9,500. She will use her loan funds to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor in order to build a house for her family. 

Bebeline has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She is recovering her livelihood through the relaunch of her general store business.

With your help, Bebeline can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super-typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so that she can build a house for her family

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out and her family home destroyed.

She has restarted her business, and she is now looking to offer her family safe shelter. She is therefore requesting a PhP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Lucresia will be more readily able to rebuild her devastated life.

In the future, Lucresia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor in order to build a house for her family

loans.name: Saydali

texts.ru: Сайдали работает контролером в государственной энергетической компании. Ему 57 лет. Он проживает в районе Вахш со своей семьей. У Сайдали двое дочерей и сын. Его сын в настоящий момент является студентом. Он оканчивает 1-й курс Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции. Он учится по специальности "Банковское дело". Он в будущем хочет стать успешным банкиром и поэтому учится прилежно. Сайдали видит способности сына и хочет помочь ему финансово. За счет кредита Сайдали собирается оплатить ежегодное обучение сына в университете, а также купить ему ноутбук для учебы. Этот кредит действительно важен для продолжения учебы сына в ВУЗе.
texts.en: Saydali is an supervisor at the state energy company. He is 57 and lives in the Vakhsh district with his family. He has two daughters and one son. He son is currently a student who has finished his first year at the Tajik State University of Business. His speciality is banking and he is studying diligently to become a banker in the future. Saydali sees his son's potential and wants to help him financially. He will use the loan to pay for his son's tuition and buy him a laptop for his studies. This loan is very important so that his son can continue to study at the university.

loans.use: to pay his son's university tuition and to buy him a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Emeleta

texts.en:
Emeleta runs a fishing business to earn a living. She earns an additional income from fish vending and from raising pigs. She and her husband have seven children, and she works hard to support her family.

Emeleta has repaid her previous loan successfully. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 30,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat. The loan investment will allow her to further build her business.

Emeleta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to sufficiently build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and table.

loans.name: Ankabenkelekan 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Ankabenkelekan 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec Diarra, debout et  au bout  vers  la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 155.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Ankabenkelekan 2 group are married women. On average, they are 37 years old and have seven children. They all live in traditional families in Fonfona, a village in Koutiala, which is in the third administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their farming activities through the rainy season. This is their ninth loan with the institution, and their previous loans have been repaid. 

They grow peanuts with Diarra, who is standing toward the right of the photo. With her loan, she would like to buy farm inputs, seeds, farming materials, and hoeing to maintain one hectare. 

After the harvest, they sell their crops in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed clientele. They would like to earn an average profit of 155,000 FCFA by the end of the season. This profit will allow her to pay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: pay for plowing, seeds, farm inputs, farming materials, and hoeing.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
While working for a large accounting firm, Manuel noticed a problem. Many business owners could not afford the high cost of tax preparation. Manuel saw an opportunity and decided to go into business for himself.
 
Manuel started Manny’s Bookkeeping and Tax Services two years ago from his own home. He’s enjoyed working with clientele, educating them as well as providing accounting services. His approach has earned him popularity. With a growing client base, Manuel is ready to focus on the business full-time.  However, Manuel needs to bring in more small business clientele so that he has a stable demand during the off-season. 

With this loan, Manuel will be able to invest money into advertising to small business owners, growing his clientele and stabilizing his source of income.  Once stabilized, Manuel will look to opening a storefront for his business.

Help this dedicated entrepreneur get his business off the ground!

loans.use: to pay for advertising

loans.name: Koemsuor

texts.en:
Koemsuor, 29, lives with her husband and three children in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. Koemsuor is a farmer in her own farmland located near her house. The profit that she can earn from her farming business is about USD 3 per day.

Koemsuor wants to repair some parts of her house since it is very old and uncomfortable to live in. However, she doesn't have enough money to cover the construction supplies. She is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy construction supplies for repairing her house. She is very thankful and is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to repair some parts of her old house

loans.name: Hortenssia

texts.en:
For Hortenssia, baking is a spiritual act. She will tell you that baking channels the baker’s emotions into the pastry, so Hortenssia (center) makes a point of training all of her employees (pictured to her left and her right) to experience and exhibit joy when they are serving or baking at Love Cupcake Café.

“You can taste the difference,” she explains.

In starting Love Cupcake Café, Hortenssia drew on a love of cooking and baking that started when she was a child selling cookies and tamales on the side of the road in her hometown of Tijuana. After working in law enforcement and HR, the economic downturn found Hortenssia out of work and bored. 

She started baking merely to pass the time, with her husband Juan eventually bringing her cupcakes to his work, which greatly increased Juan’s popularity around the office. This experience led Hortenssia to turn her hobby into an online business. She also enrolled in a pastry decorating school to broaden her skill set.

One day, her uncle suggested that she open her own storefront bakery. When she explained that she had tried and failed to find financing for such an endeavor, her uncle offered to lend her money as seed capital. With the money from her uncle, Hortenssia quickly found herself behind the counter of her own bakery café.

Now that Love Cupcake Café has been operating for some time, Hortenssia has decided to supplement her considerable cupcake sales with some new sandwich offerings, hoping to appeal to the working lunch crowd while diversifying her revenue stream. She will use her Kiva loan to purchase several pieces of equipment to produce hot sandwiches and paninis.

Down the road, Hortenssia hopes to open additional locations, but for now, she is content seeing happy faces leaving her store in Chula Vista, the community that nurtured and supported her dream.

loans.use: to purchase several pieces of equipment to produce hot sandwiches and paninis at her cafe.

loans.name: Mydee

texts.en:
Mydee is 29 years old and married with three children who are in school, She works very hard to provide for them.

Mydee runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sacks of rice, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. Mydee has been in this business for four years.

In the future Mydee would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sacks of rice, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Bunthan

texts.en:
Bunthan, 45 years old, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He is a lovely father of three children who are enrolled in school. To make a living, he works as a farmer in a small rice field which is located near his house. Until now, Bunthan has been working as a farmer for more than twenty years and the average income that he can make is USD 5 per day.

Currently, Bunthan is lacking money to get farming supplies. Therefore, he is applying for a loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer, insecticide and other related materials. He would like to thank the lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide and other related materials

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra is 53 years old, widowed and has five children, three of whom are married. Isidra and her late spouse were farmers. Now, Isidra continuously plants and harvests rice with the help of laborers she pays. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to use in her farming business. She will buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay the labor costs in farming. In the future, she hopes to increase her crop output for the development of her income. She hopes to continuously harvest good crops and save funds for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay the labor costs in farming.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 35 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Maricris is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricris has been pig fattening for three years and earns additional income from her general store and farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vioeta

texts.en:
Vioeta is 53 years old and married with five children.

Vioeta earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

Vioeta has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish and ready to wear.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol, age 37, runs a poultry business to earn a living. She has been involved in this agricultural enterprise for the past two years, and she has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

She and her husband have five children, all of whom attend school.

Sol has requested a PhP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more feed and vitamins for her poultry.

In the future, Sol would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her poultry

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 42 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Liezel has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and earns an income from farming rice and coconuts and selling recycled materials.

Liezel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Lyne

texts.en:
Lyne is 28 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

Lyne has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling wood and raising pigs.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat, age 35, earns an income from farming a small rice field, located near his house. He has worked as a farmer for more than 10 years, earning an average of USD 4 per day. He has two children, both enrolled in school. The family lives in Prey Chhor District in Kampong Cham Province.

Nat and his family live in an old house in need of major repairs. Most urgent among these repairs is the stairway, which is so damaged that it is no longer usable. Nat is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to buy materials to build new stairs. 

He would like to thank his lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than the ones offered in its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy materials with which to build stairs to replace the damaged, unusable stairs in the family home

loans.name: Max

texts.en: Max is 49 years old, married and has three children. His spouse is a housewife. In order to gain income, Max plants and harvests corn and upon harvest, he sells it to the traders. He wants to improve his crop production and he needs additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming. These farm inputs will help sustain his crops and lead to a fruitful harvest someday. Max also promises to pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming

loans.name: Sithoeurn

texts.en:
Sithoeurn, 32 years old, lives in a remote area of Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of four children who are enrolled in school. To make a living, she works as a farmer with her husband in a small rice field, which is located near her house.  So far, it has been about 10 years since she has been involved in this farming business, which can earn a net profit of USD 5 per day.

Currently, she is lacking money to afford farming supplies. Therefore, she is applying for a loan from Kiva to​ buy fertilizers, insecticides and others related materials. She would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product

loans.use: to​ buy fertilizers, insecticides and others related materials

loans.name: Maria Rubiela

texts.es:
Maria tuvo un empleo en un restaurante donde preparaban distintos tipos de comidas, desde almuerzos hasta comidas rápidas.
Estuvo trabajando allí durante 5 años, luego decidió montar su propio puesto de comidas rápidas buscando obtener ingresos de manera independiente.
Fue así como consiguió un carrito de comidas e inicio con sus primeras ventas.
Hoy en día labora en un pequeño local ubicado en municipio de La Ceja, desea formalizarse y consolidar su negocio y por eso es que solicita un préstamo, para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para la adecuación de su negocio y adicional dese comprar un pequeña cocineta para el lavado de sus utensilios de trabajo.
Su mayor sueño es tener su propio restaurante con muchos clientes y poder generar empleo a las personas de la región que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Maria was employed in a restaurant where she prepared distinct types of dinners, from breakfasts to fast food. She worked there for 5 years, then decided to build her own fast food business, seeking to obtain income in an independent manner. Thus she acquired a food cart and began her first sales.

Today, Maria works in her own small stall located in the municipality of La Ceja, hoping to formalize and consolidate her business. That is why she is soliciting a loan, to invest in the purchase of materials to improve her business and, in addttion, she wishes to purchase a small dishwasher for washing her work utensils.

Her major dream is to have her own restaurant with many customers and to be able to generate employment for people of the region who need it.

loans.use: buy a small dishwasher and to make improvements on her small fast food business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 35 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Jennifer has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from buy and sell of nipa roofing.

Jennifer aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.en: Napoleon is a hardworking father of four. He gets his income through corn farming and is able to send three of his children to school. Now, Napoleon wants to improve his crop production and he needs additional capital to achieve this. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy insecticides and herbicides for sustenance. He will also pay laborers who help him in the farming business. He will use additional revenue for education purposes. Napoleon will be happy to see all his children successful in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and herbicides and pay labor costs

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Jean works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice, raising pigs and from her general store. Mary Jean is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mary Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa runs a fishing business to earn a living. She also buys and sells dried fish to earn an additional income. She and her husband have seven children, three of whom attend school. She works hard to support her family.

Nerissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now hopes to receive an additional loan to further build her business. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to to purchase a fishing net.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Teresa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling of fish. Teresa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like net, gasoline, etc for her fishing business.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like net and gasoline

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano is a farmer. He plants, harvests, and sells corn to earn an income. He is proud of his work. Even at the age of 63, he is still involved himself in the daily farming activity, with the help of laborers whom he pays.

He and his wife have raised two children, now grown.

Feliciano is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000, which he will use to maintain his crop through the purchase of fertilizers and insecticides. This investment will help his crops grow abundantly and will bring him a good profit.

He promises to repay his loan promptly and in full. With his increased earnings, he intends to grow his savings fund so that he can better cover future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his corn field

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is 59 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Bonifacia has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from farming rice.

Bonifacia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 33 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Flordeliza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Flordeliza has been farming vegetables for one year and also earns additional income from buying and selling cashews and bananas.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Liza has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from buying and selling rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Rodilyn

texts.en:
Rodilyn is 35 years old and married with three children who are in school, Rodilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell jewelry business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional jewelry to sell. Rodilyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future Rodilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional  jewelry to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Precil

texts.en:
Precil is 37 years old and married with seven children.  With five children in school, Precil works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Precil has been in this business for five years.

In the future Precil would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene runs a fishing business to earn an income. She has been involved in this work for 20 years. She is a hard-working entrepreneur and earns an additional income through buying and selling dried fish. 

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan and would like to request an additional loan with which to further build her business. She is borrowing PhP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing materials like bamboo, gasoline, and netting.

She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like bamboo, gasoline, and netting for her fishing business

loans.name: Abelardo De Jesus

texts.es:
Abelardo, desde que era un niño trabajaba con su padre en distintos negocios que el poseía tales como cafeterías, pasando por discotecas hasta tiendas.
Hoy en día, Abelardo es casado y tiene 4 hijos, vive con su esposa en una pequeña casa ubicada en zona rural del municipio de La Ceja; allí decidió iniciar con una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 9 años.
Afortunadamente ha tenido muy buen reconocimiento por parte de los habitantes de la región gracias a su buen servicio y atención.
Desea aumentar su oferta de productos y mejorar sus ventas de una manera efectiva, es por eso que dese un apoyo para compra surtido de productos de la canasta familiar y aumentar así su inventario.
Con este crédito el señor Abelardo tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar su oferta y continuar creciendo como empresario en una región que está muy abandonada por el comercio.
texts.en:
Throughout his childhood, Abelardo worked with his father in his various businesses, from coffee shops to night clubs to stores.

Today, Abelardo is married and has 4 children. He lives with his wife in a small house in the rural area of the township La Ceja. He decided to start a grocery store there 9 years ago. Fortunately, he has become well known in the area, thanks to his excellent customer service.

He would like to increase the range of products he offers to effectively improve his sales. He is requesting a loan to purchase various staple goods and therefore increase his inventory.

With this loan, Abelardo will have the opportunity to improve his offerings and continue growing his business in a region with a sparse commercial sector.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia  Margot pertenece al banco comunal LIDERNADO LAS PALMERAS, la socia tiene 37 años de edad ,02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna a sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de transporte de turismo, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia administra los ingresos de su negocio, como el transporte a los distintos tours de las agencias que solicitan los servicios de su carro, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la realizar el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Margot is a member of the communal bank Liderando Las Palmeras [Leading Las Palmeras]. She is 37 years old, has 2 children, and lives with her partner.

She alternates her daily activities with providing a tourism transport service. She has been working this job for a while, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.

She manages her business' income, for instance from transporting various tours from agencies that request use of her car. She wants to be able to continue working in this position to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to maintain her car, such as changing its oil. She is grateful for the loan and commits to paying it back on schedule.

loans.use: to maintain her car, such as paying for an oil change

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 69 years old and widowed with six children. She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Corazon is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Corazon has been farming coconuts for 30 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 47 years old, a married woman with four children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Teresita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nelson De Jesus

texts.es:
Nelson ha trabajado gran parte de su vida en el campo y conoce muy bien todos los procesos que allí se utilizan.
El trabaja como ganadero en diferentes fincas de la región de Guarne, Antioquia, pero desde hace un tiempo alterna esta actividad con la cría y venta de su propio ganado, que alberga en un potrero de su propiedad.
Su esposa le ayuda en estas actividades y esta criando sus hijos en el manejo de estos animales.
El inicio con esta actividad con el afán de tener ingresos extra para su familia y poder así mejorar su vida familiar y económica.
Solicita un auxilio económico para la compra de más ganado bovino aprovechando esta temporada en que los precios de estos animales rebajan.
Con este crédito podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo y tendrá la oportunidad de continuar creciendo como ganadero independiente.
texts.en:
Nelson has spent a large part of his life working on the farm, and he is very familiar with all the processes used there. He works as a cattle farmer on different farms throughout the region of Guarne, Antioquia. For some time now he has alternated this work with the raising and selling of his own cattle that he houses in a stable on his property. 

His wife helps him with these chores and is raising their children to be able to handle these animals. He began this activity with the desire to have extra income for his family, and in this way, improve his family life and finances. 

He is requesting financial assistance to buy more cattle, and take advantage of the season when the prices for these animals are lower. With this loan he will be able to increase his working capital and will have the opportunity to keep growing as an independent cattle farmer.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment and raw materials with which to run her tailoring enterprise as a completely new business with a new business model

loans.name: Ritchell

texts.en: Ritchell works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling rice grains in the Philippines. Ritchell requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her business. She has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Ritchell would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice grains to sell for her business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, a 43-year-old married mother of three children, is a vendor selling snacks to students from her stall in front of a school. Her income goes toward meals, bills, and revolving capital for her business. 

In order to increase sales capacity, Marivic needs to purchase more goods to sell and so has requested this loan of PHP 13,000 to buy items such as biscuits, juice drinks and breads. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can earn more funds for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell such as biscuits, juice drinks and breads

loans.name: Ankabenkelekan 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Ankabenkelekan 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec  Rokia Mamaly, assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Ankabenkelekan 3 group are married women. On average, they are 41 years old and have three children. They live in traditional families in Fonfona, a village in Koutiala, which is in the third administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their farming activities through the rainy season. This is their ninth loan with the institution, and their previous loans were repaid. 

They grow rice and peanuts with Rokia Mamaly, who is seated in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she would like to pay for farm inputs, seeds, farming supplies, and plowing to maintain 1.5 hectares of land.

After the harvest, their crops will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed clientele. They would like to earn an average profit of 105,000 FCFA before the end of the season. The profits will allow her to pay her loan and to help her family with the daily expenses.

loans.use: pay for plowing, seeds, farm inputs, and farming supplies.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es una mujer de 53 años de edad casada con 1 hijo
Su vida la pasó como ama de casa efectuando labores del hogar y cuidado a su hijo, su esposo trabaja como comerciante y logra mantener los gastos diarios de la casa, su hijo terminó la escuela secundaria y se prepara para ingresar a la universidad. Ella estuvo pendiente de su familia casi toda su vida ordenando la ropa y preparándoles la comida, administrando todo lo que sucede dentro de su hogar.
Hace 7 años que josefina tuvo un emprendimiento, encontró un espacio vacío dentro de un mercado lo financio e instaló su primer negocio; un puesto de venta de fruta, su familia se ocupó de ayudarle en todo lo que ella pusiese necesitar. Su puesto de venta es un espacio vacío sin muros y piso de tierra; “tuve suerte en encontrar un espacio vacío en el mercado y junto a mi familia pudimos comprarlo”, comenta Josefina.
Josefina es muy amable y todas las compañeras del mercado la aprecian, después de tanto tiempo vendiendo sobre el piso de tierra ella quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida construyendo un piso de cemento para que el lugar sea más limpio y mejor, ella desea ampliar su negocio y seguir teniendo la buena amistad que la caracteriza con sus compañeras.
Es por ese motivo que Josefina solicita un préstamo para construir un piso de cemento en su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Josefina is a 53-year-old woman. She is married and has one child.

She has spent her life as a stay-at-home mom, doing housework and caring for her son. Her husband works as a shopkeeper and is able to cover their daily household expenses. Her son has finished secondary school and is preparing to go to college. She has focused on her family for almost all her life, taking care of the clothing, preparing meals, and managing everything that happens in a home.

Seven years ago, Josefina undertook to find an available market stall, which she paid for and used to begin her first business: a fruit stand. Her family helped her with everything that she could have needed. Her fruit stand is an empty space with a dirt floor and without walls. "I was lucky to find an available space in the market, and with my family, we were able to buy it," Josefina says.

Josefina is very kind, and all her fellow merchants appreciate her. After so much time selling from a dirt floor, she wants to improve her level of living by constructing a cement floor, so that the space can be cleaner and better. She wants to grow her business and continue enjoying the good friendship that characterizes her relationship with her companions.

For this reason, Josefina is requesting a loan to build a cement floor at her place of work.

loans.use: to build a cement floor at her place of work

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 67 years old, widowed and a mother of seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Virginia has a general store business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like shampoo, soap, sardines and other groceries.

Virginia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, soap, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Letecia works hard to support her family.

She has a hardware business in the Philippines. Letecia is borrowing PHP 3,0000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of hardware to sell in her hardware business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of hardware to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Lucio

texts.es:
Carlos, cuenta con 35 años de edad, es soltero, vive junto a dos hermanos de 22 y 16 años de edad, su negocio consiste en la carpintería, en el que elabora diferentes tipos de muebles (como: mesas, sillas, roperos, entre otros) y ofrece el servicio de remodelación de locales, trabaja a tiempo completo, ya cuenta con 8 años de experiencia.
Con el capital de trabajo que está solicitando comprara madera de roble, pino y cedro al por mayor, con lo que incrementara la productividad de su negocio y trabajara por una larga temporada, espera recuperar lo invertido en la materia prima con buenas ganancias que utilizara para aportar a los gastos de su familia y cancelar su deuda.
Su sueño es tener un negocio con maquinaria semi- industrial para hacer un mejor trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 35 years old, single, and lives with two brothers aged 22 and 16. His business is a carpentry business, where he crafts different types of furniture (such as tables, chairs, wardrobes, among others) and offers local remodeling of premises. He works full time, and has 8 years of experience.

With the loan he is requesting, he will buy oak, pine and cedar wood, all in bulk, which will increase the productivity of his business and will give him work for a long time. He expects to recoup the investment on the raw materials with solid earnings, which he will in turn use to support family expenses and pay down the debt. 

His dream is to have a business with semi-industrial machinery to do a better job.

loans.use: to buy oak, pine and cedar woods.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is a 49-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are in school. A very hard working entrepreneur, she has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 17 years. 

Lorie has requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda previously accessed a 51,000 PHP loan that she used to buy meat, fish, grocery items and other products for her business. Her earnings were a big help in paying personal, household and business expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to pay for grocery products, fish, meat and processed foods for her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nilda hopes to be more successful in business, and dreams of giving her family a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship members* weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery products, fish, meat and processed foods for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda runs an auto and motorcycle repair shop business to earn an income. She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She has requested PhP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her motorcycle repair shop.

NWTF is re-listing the business profile of this hard-working entrepreneur in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her motorcycle repair shop

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has an ice candy business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. Socorro has successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Socorro's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy.

loans.name: Danis David

texts.es: No hay nada más gratificante para un padre que ver cómo crece sus hijos y es que es motivo de orgullo y felicidad para ellos y por eso trabajan incasablemente para que sus hijos durante ese crecimiento no les lleguen a faltar a nada. Denis es uno de tantos padres que dan sus vidas pro el hijo y trabajan a favor de ellos se dedica al oficio de la carpintería el cual aprendió gracias a que su familia han ejercido esta profesión durante muchos años, su gran deseo es tener salud para poder trabajar muchos años y darle a sus hijas los recursos necesarios para triunfar en la vida por esta razón siempre quiere mejorar y ampliar sus ingresos, solicita un crédito para la compra de una pulidora y materiales como madera y pinturas para realizar unas camas y otros muebles pues tiene un buen pedido y sacara provecho de estas ventas
texts.en: There is nothing more gratifying for a father than to see his children grow. This is a motive for pride and happiness for them and it's why they work tirelessly so their children, while they're growing up, won't lack for anything. Denis is one of the many fathers who give their lives to their children and work for their well being. He works in carpentry, which he learned thanks to the fact that his family has worked in this profession for many years. His greatest wish is to have good health so he can work for many years and give his daughters the resources they need to be sucessful in life. For this reason he always wants to improve and expand his income. He is requesting a loan to buy a sander and materials such as wood and paints to make some beds and other furniture items. He's got a good order and will take good advantage of his sales.

loans.use: to buy a sanding machine and materials such as wood and paint to make some beds and other furniture items.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Ram, 24 years old and a single lady, lives in Batheay District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is the owner of a small rice field which she got from her parents.  This farming business allows her to make around $3 a day.

Ram wants to promote convenience in her life by having a motorbike for daily use. Now she is borrowing a loan from HKL to buy a motorbike. Ram would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Melda

texts.en:
Melda is 47 years old, married and has five children. She and her husband operate a sewing service, sewing school uniforms, curtains and tablecloths. 

In order to keep satisfying her customers, Melda is requesting a loan of P6,000 to buy more fabric, threads, and oils for the sewing machine. These purchases will help improve their sales and income for the development of their business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, and oils for sewing machine

loans.name: Higinio

texts.en:
Higinio is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him, as he has been able to buy more of the ingredients needed for his food stall. His loan helped not just in his business, but also in the education of his children. His income from his business is assisting in their everyday household needs. He and his wife are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and other products needed in his business. The profits from the business will definitely help to sustain his daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Higinio dreams oof being more successful in his business, and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and other products needed in his business.

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is 58 years old and married to a tricycle driver. They had five grown-up children. 

To supplement her spouse's income, Leoncia uses her skill in hair-cutting services. Aside from her small business, she also raise hogs to sell. She is determined to gain good profits. 

To develop her business, she is now borrowing a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy scissors and dye and also hog feed. She hopes to achieve a stable income in her businesses and save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy scissors and dye and also hog feed

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of merchandise like dresses for kids, polo shirts for men and women, and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of merchandise like those she bought with the previous loan. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ester hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of merchandise like dresses for kids, polo shirts for men and women, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.en:
Deolinda is a coconut farmer. She earns an additional income from fattening pigs. She and her husband have five children, four of whom are enrolled in school. She works hard to support her family.

Deolinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PhP 18,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her coconut farm

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a pig fattening business in the Philippines for the past two years. She also earns income from a general store.

Having repaid her previous loan, Lilibeth is requesting a new one for PHP 100000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF, and dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Estanita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Estanita works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transportation business. Estanita is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. Estanita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married and she works hard to support her family. She sells ice candy (popsicles) in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling soft drinks.  Helen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice candy business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy (popsicles).

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell for her business. She has been in this business for 13 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell for her business

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 39 years old and married with nine children.  With seven children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, bread, soft-drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future Rosanna would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Diego Andres

texts.es:
Diego actualmente es el dueño de un deposito de madera en Puerto Boyacá, este negocio es una herencia que le dejo su padre y Diego desea darle un impulso para que este no decaiga y se pierda en el tiempo.
Es un negocio muy importante para él y tiene muchas expectativas en cuanto a su crecimiento económico.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima por lotes grandes, estos lotes le permitirán abastecer su negocio y continuar con su producción.
Sus principales clientes son fábricas de elaboración de muebles.
Al tener un buen inventario en madera podrá capitalizarse y ser mas fuerte económicamente cumpliendo así su sueño de ser una empresa líder en la industria maderera en la región.
Con sus ingresos ayuda a su familia brindándoles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diego is currently the owner of a lumber warehouse in Puerto Boyacá. He inherited this business from his father and Diego wants to give it a kick start so that it won't decline and be lost over time. 

This is a very important business for him and he has many expectations regarding its economic growth.

He is requesting a loan to buy raw material in large lots. These lots will allow him to stock his business and continue its production.

His main clients are furniture making factories.

When he has a better wood inventory, he will be able to capitalize and and be stronger economically, achieving his dream of being a business leader in the wood sales industry in the region. 

With his income he helps his family, providing them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy large lots of wood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase starting inventory and equipment for his new business

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 35 years old and married, and his family lives at Alcala. 

To support the needs of his family, he offers transport services in their village. He is patient enough to provide safe travel to all his passengers. He wants to keep providing better service--that is why he is borrowing a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and oil and to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle. It will help improve his business too. 

Someday, he hopes to achieve financial stability and give a better way of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and oil and to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 33 years old and single. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nerisa

texts.en:
Nerisa is 46 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been pig fattening  for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 52 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more biscuits, soft drinks, and other groceries. She has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Melba aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Carma

texts.en:
Carma is 34 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming trees in the Philippines. Carma is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers.

Carma has been farming trees for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia runs a clothing sales business to earn a living. She has successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan in the amount of PhP 30,000 to further build her business.

She will use her loan funds to buy more clothing items to sell to her customers.

NWTF is re-listing the business profile of this hard-working entrepreneur in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing items to offer for sale

loans.name: Baleriano

texts.es:
Baleriano de 40 años de edad,  estudio hasta cuarto grado, por la situación económica que vivían sus padres ya no pudo seguir estudiando, es casado  y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  y a cuidar de sus hijos es padre de 4 hijos de los cuales el primero estudia séptimo grado,  el segundo estudia séptimo grado, el tercero estudia quinto grado y el último que aún no estudia por su corta edad. Con él solo viven sus cuatro hijos y su esposa.

Baleriano se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, específicamente sembrando maíz y frijol. También es aserrador de madera. Trabajando  en la agricultura tiene 20 años y aserrando madera lleva 10 años.  A trabajar en la agricultura fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron como no tenían otra fuente de ingresos decidió dedicarse a ello, y a aserrar madera aprendió porque al principio trabajaba de ayudante y cuando aprendió hacer el trabajo ya decidió hacerlo solo,  porque era una actividad que si le genera ingresos. El lugar donde trabaja le queda a 2 minutos de su casa y se transporta fácilmente a pie. En el trabajo le ayuda su hijo mayor cuando llega de estudiar.


 El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar 2 quintales de fórmula, 4 quintales de sulfato y herbicidas para eliminar la maleza. El crédito ayudara a que tenga una mayor producción, mejorando así sus ingresos y que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida. 


   El sueño de Baleriano es repellar su casa,  ya que cada vez con las lluvias se deterioran  más y más las paredes, con el fin de  darles una mayor seguridad a sus hijos; porque por el momento corren peligro que puedan ser picados por algún insecto que pueda esconderse en las paredes.
texts.en:
Baleriano is 40 years old. He studied through fourth grade; due to his parents' economic situation, he wasn't able to continue studying. He's married and  his wife takes care of the home and cares for their children. He is the father of 4 children. The oldest one is in seventh grade, the second is in seventh grade, the third is in fifth grade, and the last one isn't in school yet becuase of his young age. Only his four children and his wife live with him.

Baleriano works in agriculture. Specifically, he plants corn and beans. He also mills wood. He has been working in agriculture for 20 years and has been milling wood for 10 years. His parents taught him agriculture. Since he didn't have another source of income, he decided to work in that. He learned to cut wood because he started out working as a helper; once he learned the job, he decided to do it for himself because it was a business that generates income. The place where he works is 2 minutes from his house and he can easily walk there. His oldest son helps him with his work when he returns from school.

The loan he is requesting is to buy two 100-pound sacks of fertilizer, and four 100-pound sacks of sulfate and herbicides to kill weeds. The loan will help him to have better production, improving his income so his family will have a better quality of life. 

Baleriano's dream is to stucco his house, because each time it rains his walls deteriorate more. The goal is to provide improved safety for his children; at the moment they are at risk of being bitten by a kind of insect that hides in the walls.

loans.use: to buy two 100-pound sacks of fertilizer, and four 100-pound sacks of sulfate and herbicides to kill weeds

loans.name: Melsa

texts.en:
Melsa previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed for her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melsa dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her children will finish their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase starting inventory and tools to build her own restaurant

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Armida works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. Armida is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional wood and equipment for her furniture business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional wood and equipment for her furniture business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for her business

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Lanie would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business. She will also use her loan in her variety store. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lanie dreams that her businesses will last longer and hopes that her children will finish their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
