*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Munhbat is a 29-year-old borrower from the Selenge province of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and son in a Ger, a traditional nomadic Mongolian house, on a plot of land. His wife is unemployed and stays at home taking care of their year old son.
 
Munhbat has been working as driver for a local taxi service company since 2013. He is careful driver and a hardworking man who has a good previous loan history at XacBank. He needs to work even harder to increase his income to support his family and new born baby.
 
He is requesting 1,000,000MNT to repair his taxi to ensure the safety of passengers and himself, in order to make stable money for his family.

loans.use: to repair his taxi to ensure the safety of passengers and himself.

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yessenia de 25 años de edad, curso estudios hasta su nivel medio,  quiso ingresar a la universidad, pero se le hizo muy difícil por su situación económica ella es acompañada su esposo trabaja en una tienda de teléfonos con la empresa claro. Es madre de una hija la cual cuida a su madre cuando ella está trabajando, la pequeñita aun no estudia por su edad, con ella viven sus hermanos, sus padres y su esposo.

Yessenia trabaja de recamarera en un hotel en la ciudad, desde hace 2 años realiza esta actividad, ella cuenta que cuando salió de estudiar el bachillerato se fue a la ciudad en busca de un trabajo por suerte que lo encontró cuando le llamaron que se presentara le dieron las indicaciones referente al trabajo, fue así como aprendió y decidió quedarse a trabajar ahí porque no es tan fácil encontrar un trabajo para cubrir  las necesidades del hogar. Antes únicamente ayuda a su familia en lo oficios del hogar, el lugar donde trabaja le queda a unos 55 km de su casa y viaja en bus cada 15 días, el horario de trabajo es de 6 de la mañana a 9 de la noche.


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar semilla, abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra para ayudarle a su padre para que realice sus cultivos. También invertirá otra parte en los productos alimenticios de su hogar y pagara una deuda que tiene su papá. El crédito ayudará a que gocen de una buena alimentación y ayudara a su padre para que este más tranquilo sin pensar en la deuda que tiene.
   

   El sueño de ella es ayudar en lo poco que pueda a sus padres,  ya que estos ya están un poco ancianos y necesitan su ayuda económica para poder sobrevivir, también quiere arreglar parte del techo de la casa, porque le filtra el agua cuando llueve fuerte, por otra parte pretende arreglar una puerta de sus casa para tener más seguridad.
texts.en:
Yessenia is 25 years old. She finished high school. She wanted to attend the university, but it was too dificult because of her economic situation. She is married. Her husband works in a telephone store with the company Claro. She is the mother of a daughter; her own mother cares for her while she is working. The little girl isn't in school yet because of her young age. Yessenia lives with her siblings, her parents, and her husband.

Yessenia works as a maid in a hotel in the city. She has been doing this for 2 years. She explains that when she finished high school, she went to the city to look for a job. Luckily she found one. When they called her and told her to come, they gave her the instructions about how to do the job. This is how she learned, and she decided to keep working there because it's not so easy to find a job to cover the household expenses. Before this, she only helped her family with the housework. The place where she works is 55 kilometers from her house and she travels by bus every 15 days. The work schedule is from 6:00 in the morning until 9:00 at night.

The loan she is requesting is to buy seed, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and to pay for labor to help her father plant his crops. She will also invest a part of the loan in food for her household and to pay a debt her father has. The loan will help them to eat better and it will help her father be more at ease by not having to think about the debt he has.

Her dream is to help out her parents with what little she can because they are getting old and need her economic help in order to survive. She also wants to fix part of the roof in her house because it leaks when it rains hard. She also hopes to fix a door in her house so it will be safer.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides and to pay for labor to help her father plant his crops. She will also invest a part of the loan in food for her household and to pay a debt her father has.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off the rest of the cost of a plot of land

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 49-year-old widow from Brgy. Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for seven years. She has kept her membership in good standing. Wilma's history and standing matters to her, as she wants to access financial assistance from the Cooperative. Recently she applied for a loan to purchase nails, plywood and sticks for house repairs. Wilma hopes to live comfortably with her children around.

loans.use: to purchase nails, plywood and sticks for house repairs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 31 years old, married and living in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is a business woman and owner of a fishpond. Jocelyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for four years. She borrowed money with a loan amount of 13,000 PHP for the purpose of buying crustacean fingerlings for production in her fishpond. She is hoping for a good harvest of crustaceans.

loans.use: to buy crustacean fingerlings for production in her fishpond.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with eleven children. She lives in Brgy. Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, and has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since 2008. 

Evelyn has borrowed a loan of PHP 14,900 to finance the plowing of the rice field in preparation for the first cropping of the annual rice production. She is hoping for the success of the rice plantation in order to have more rice products for the benefits of her family.

loans.use: to finance the plowing of the rice field.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 47 years old and is married with four children. 

Remedios works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Remedios has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 32 years old and is married with five children, three of whom are in school.

Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, spices, egg, noodles, etc. Rowena has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and bananas.

Rowena aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, spices, egg, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 42 years old, married and living in Brgy. Garang, Tangub City. She has a farm on which corn is the primary crop. Maricel has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five years. She borrowed money with a loan of PHP 7,000 for the purpose of buying fertilizers for her corn production. She is hoping for a good corn harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mario Esteban

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre soltero de 40 años de edad y padre de 2 hijos.
Él tuvo muchos oficios en su vida entre ellos el arte de la costura, recientemente logró comprar una máquina de coser, con la cual dio inicio a su emprendimiento, su negocio consiste en la confección de buzos deportivos para niños, compra la tela diseña los moldes y una vez terminadas los ofrece a la venta en lugares comerciales; “ el diseño y la costura es un trabajo sencillo, la venta ambulante es un poco difícil la gente te hecha de las puertas de sus negocios, también existen ladrones”, comenta Mario.
Mario trabaja junto a su hijo mayor (17) quién lo ayuda en la costura y así también gana dinero para pagar sus estudios secundarios. Mario necesita expandir su negocio a corto plazo y sueña algún día tener un lugar fijo de venta dónde pueda exponer todos sus artículos, también busca un futuro para sus hijos y esto podría ser un comienzo. Mario quiere comprar una máquina de costura overlock para incrementar su producción.
Es por esos motivos que Mario solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de costura overlock para incrementar sus productos y mercadería.
texts.en: Mario is a single, 40-year-old father of two. He has worked in many different areas during his life including art and tailoring. He recently managed to buy a sewing machine, which helped him start his business making sports tracksuits for children. He buys the fabric, designs the patterns and once the tracksuits are finished, he offers them for sale to businesses. The design and sewing are straightforward, but selling the tracksuits to businesses can be difficult, as there are people who don't want to know or who even steal from him. Mario works with his eldest son, aged 17, who helps him sew and in that way earns some money to pay for his schooling. Mario needs to grow his business in the short term and dreams of one day having his own store, where he can offer all of his items for sale. He also wants a better future for his children and this could be the start of it. Mario wants to buy an overlocking machine to increase his output, For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy the overlocking machine to increase his production and his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy an overlocking sewing machine

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is married with seven children. She is 29 years old and lives in Pagadian.

Ma. Theresa is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan to buy animal feed. Ma. Theresa has been a member of PMPC for five years. 

In the future, Ma.Theresa hopes to expand her business and be able to produce more pigs for the market.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

location.town: Pagadian - Lower Bagong Silang Pagadian City

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ninfa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Ninfa is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 36 years old and is married with three children who are in school. Noemi works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years. 

Noemi has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

In the future, Noemi would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits. Wilma is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail business where he makes bricks to sell. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy brick making tools. His business goal is to have a yard of bricks within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a house for his family. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy brick making tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more equipment, tables and other materials for her restaurant

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 57 years old and lives in Nazareth, Buenavista, Pagadian City. She is widowed with six children.

Thelma has a store that sells food products. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan to buy sugar, noodles, biscuits and coffee for her sari-sari store.

Thelma has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Thelma hopes to expand her business from a sari-sari store into a convenience store.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, biscuits and coffee for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Lorna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ma. Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Victoria is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Ma. Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.en:
Yvette works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a buy-and-sell frozen products business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen products to sell.

In the future, Yvette would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen products to sell.

loans.name: Plumita

texts.en:
Plumita is 40 years old and is married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

Plumita has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fishing.

Plumita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa is 38 years old and is married with four children, who are all in school. Milagrosa works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for eleven years. She sells a variety of items such as bread, candy, soft drinks and other groceries. 

Milagrosa has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

In the future, Milagrosa would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 31 years old and is married with three children who are in school. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for four years. Elsie works very hard to provide for her family.

Elsie has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 47 years old and married with one kid.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Juliet has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla is 56 years old and is widowed with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, such as chips, canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc.

Prescilla has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling chickens.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, such as chips, canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Concepción Marina

texts.es:
Concepción de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado.

trabaja de doméstica, es decir a lavar y planchar en diferentes lugares, cuenta que desde joven le gusto ser una mujer emprendedora y como sus padres no tenían una actividad que les generará ingresos decidió irse ella con el fin de ayudar económicamente a su familia. El trabajo que hasta hoy realiza lo aprendió por sus propios medios, cuenta que poco a poco se acostumbró a esa vida y que decidió seguir realizándolo pues es un oficio que le ha ayudado mucho y que con ello puede ayudar a muchas familias. Antes solo realizaba los oficios del hogar, sin esperanzas de ganar nada, el lugar a donde trabaja le queda a dos horas de camino y se transporta a en bus, trabaja de 7:00 a.m.  a 4:00 p.m.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una refrigeradora y el resto lo invertirá en una ropa de cama que pretende comprar. 
 El crédito mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia, ya que teniendo la refrigeradora podrá conservar más y mejor sus comidas, porque no podía comprar productos alimenticios,  porque se le arruinaban pero hoy todo será diferente el crédito ayudara a  mejorar su economía.

  El sueño de Concepción  es comprar los muebles como camas y ropa de cama para que sus padres vivan mejor, también pretende ayudar a su hijo a que estudie porque de lo contrario no podrá encontrar un trabajo que le garantice una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Concepción is 52 years old and studied up to fifth grade of elementary school. She works as a domestic employee, doing laundry and ironing in different places. She says that since she was young she has been an enterprising woman, and as her parents did not have a source of income, she decided to leave home to find a way to help her family financially. She learned how to be a domestic employee by herself, and little by little she got used to this kind of life and decided to continue because it has helped her a lot and she has been able to help many families. Before that, she just took care of her home and didn´t think she could find a way to earn money. The place where she works is two hours away and she gets there by bus. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. She is requesting the loan from CREDICAMPO to buy a refrigerator and also to buy some bed linen. The loan will improve her quality of life and that of her family because if she has a refrigerator, she will be able to store more food and make better meals. Right now she cannot buy many food items because they spoil, but everything will be different if she gets the loan. Concepción´s dream is to buy furniture, such as beds and bed linen, so that her parents can have a better life. She also wants to help her son with his studies because otherwise he will not be able to find a job that guarantees him a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and bed linen

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from one year to seven years old. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenges to be theft and insecurity. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will raise the living standards of his family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a dairy cow for his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a married man with eight children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a carpentry business where he makes chairs, tables, beds and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. 

Jacob's business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are walk-ins and permanent customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy timber, nails and other materials for making furniture. His business goal is to own a show room within five years. 

Jacob hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and take care of his family.

loans.use: buy timber, nails and other materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a single man. He describes himself as strong, determined and God fearing. 

He operates a retail business where he sells mandazi. He uses his bicycle to distribute the mandazi to different customers. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are shop owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a second hand motorcycle for transporting his products. 

His business goal is to own a big bakery within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable family. This is his second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy a second hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be business oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, sweets, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. 

Rahab's business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, sweets, flour and other items that she sells. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a sustainable business to provide for her family. 

This is Rahab's second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, sweets, flour and other items that she sells.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

Merlita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour and seasonings for her bakery business.

NWTF is presenting Merlita's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour and seasonings.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Jenipher works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Jenipher is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Jenipher has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a boarding house business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years and earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase repair materials for the maintenance of her boarding house business.

Cornelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase repair materials for the maintenance of her boarding house business.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 27 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Carina runs a buy and sell of charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

She has been in this business for four years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 65 years old and widowed with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fruits to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruits to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. Mary Jane is married, and has a business selling bamboo furniture in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo, paints, nails, etc.  Mary Jane has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo, paints, nails, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a work table, glass cabinet, kitchen utensils and broilers.

loans.name: Viviana Dariana

texts.es:
Viviana es una trabajadora mujer de 25 años de edad que se gana su vida vendiendo puerta a puerta calzado para hombre y dama llevando hacia la puerta de la casa de sus clientes variedad de calzado, ofertas y formas de pago para, pues sabe que su familia depende exclusivamente de ella y están  la deriva de los ingresos que ella genere para poder comer.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de calzado de hombre y dama, pues quiere brindarle mayor variedad de productos y estilos de calzado buscando mejorar sus ventas para que su familia nunca le falte la comida y el techo y mirar si puede llegar a montar un negocio de calzado para mejorar cada día más sus condiciones.
texts.en: Viviana is a hard-working, 25-year-old woman, who works selling women's and men's shoes door-to-door. She offers a variety of shoe styles to her customers in their homes and gives them discounts as well as different ways of payment. She knows that her family depend exclusively on her income to be able to eat. She is requesting a loan to buy women's and men's shoes, as she wishes to be able to offer a wider variety of shoes and styles. She wants to increase her sales so that her family have enough to eat and have shelter, and hopes that one day she will be able to have her own shoe store so that she can improve the family´s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shoes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a tailoring business where she makes dresses, sweaters, shirts, etc. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be financial problems. 

She will use the KES 98,000 loan to buy stock of tailoring materials. 

Her business goal is to become a better dressmaker within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a better businessperson. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Perly

texts.en:
Perly previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She dreams that her business will be more flourishing and hopes to have an abundant life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories to maintain her tricycle.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a pig fattening and food vending businesses. Melanie is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like rice, soft-drinks and other groceries for her general store business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Susana works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Susana is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy materials like fishing net, etc. for her fishing business.

Susana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina works hard to support her family. Merlina is married and has a buy and sell of ready to wear business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Merlina has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fish vending  business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her fish vending business.  Evangeline successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Evangeline's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad, who is married, has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 17 years now; she works hard to support her family. She has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

In the future, Soledad would like to save money to open another business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 56 years old and is married with six children who are in school. Angelita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has been in this business for six years. 

Angelita requested a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 55 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Rebecca has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

Rebecca has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Santos Cayetano

texts.es:
Santos, fortalecerá su negocio y sabe que con la ayuda de créditos lo hace de manera rápida, obteniendo buenos resultados, el préstamo que requiere lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y concentrado para alimentar el ganado que posee.
 Los efectos que tuvo del crédito anterior son muy positivos pues el comenta que actualmente tiene mayor productividad en sus cosechas y el número de cabezas de ganado es mayor, permitiéndole tener una economía estable para cancelar sus deudas y cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos will strengthen his business and knows that the help of loans will make this quicker and give him good results. Santos needs this loan in order to buy fertilisers, weed-killers, anti-disease treatments, anti-pest chemicals, and cattle feed.

Santos' previous loan had very positive efforts. He says that production at harvest was greater and that the number of cattle he has has increased. This is giving Santos a stable financial situation in order to pay off his debts and cover the costs of necessities for the families.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, weed-killers, anti-disease treatments, anti-pest chemicals, and cattle feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a chair and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta 2° año de bachillerato general, está acompañado desde hace un mes, su pareja también es empleada, ambos trabajan en la misma empresa desde hace ya unos 4 años. Después de haber estudiado 2° año, él sintió la necesidad de tener sus propios ingresos y busco un empleo y se le dio. Él viaja en bicicleta a su trabajo que le queda a unos 10 minutos. 

Él necesita el dinero para construir una pequeña habitación para traer a vivir a su madre con él, ya que siente que es mucha la distancia para ir a visitarla a menudo y por el trabajo no puede hacerlo. José quisiera junto a su pareja tener un negocio propio y genere sus propios ingresos o tener un puesto mejor en el lugar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jose is 24 years oil, studied until the 7th grade and has lived with his partner for about a month now. His partner is also employed -- both of them have worked in the same company for about 4 years. After finishing the 7th grade, he felt the need to have his own income and sought employment, which worked out for him. He goes to work by bicycle, which is about 10 minutes away.

He needs the money to build a small room so that his mother can live with him. He feels that the distance is too large to visit her often, especially because he works. Jose would like to have a business with his partner and generate his own income, or to have a better job with his current company.

loans.use: to build a small room so that his mother can live with him.

loans.name: Elmer Alexis

texts.es:
Elmer de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, esta acompañado desde hace tres meses, es comerciante, su esposa era empleada de una tienda y salió embarazada y ahora se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Elmer es ganadero y agricultor también tiene un pickup, en el cual hace viajes; la ganadería la realiza desde hace dos años y participa en una cooperativa de ganaderos.  Él camina unos 4 km para llegar a su lugar de trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar material (cemento y cerámica) para ponerle piso cerámico a su vivienda y pagar parte de la mano de obra ya que anteriormente ya había comenzado a ponerle piso a alguna parte de su casa.

 Él planea darle el estudio a su hijo y aunque no sabe aun si será niño o niña lo espera con muchas ganas de conocerlo y darle todo lo que puede ser para su bien.
texts.en:
Elmer is 33 years old and completed up to seventh grade at school. Elmer has been married for three months. His wife was working in a shop but left after falling pregnant and now looks after the household chores.

Elmer is a cattle raiser and farmer. He also has a pick-up truck which he uses for offering transport services. Elmer has been raising cattle for two years and is part of a cattle-raising cooperative. Elmer walks four kilometres to arrive at his work.

Elmer is applying for this loan in order to buy material (cement and ceramics) to put in a floor in his home, and to pay labourers who already started to lay floor in part of the house.

Elmer plans to give his child an education. He does not yet know if his baby is a boy or a girl but is very much looking forward to meeting the baby and giving him/her everything that he can to look after him/her.

loans.use: to buy material (cement and ceramics) to put in a floor in his home, and to pay labourers who already started to lay floor in part of the house.

loans.name: Nancy Guadalupe

texts.es:
La socia Nancy pertenece al banco comunal LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 50 años de edad es separada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de hospedaje, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solcito el crédito para la compra de sabanas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Nancy belongs to the LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS communal bank, which is located in the city of Cusco, region of Cusco. She is 50 years old, is separated and has 2 children. In addition to her daily activities, she has a with a lodging business. She has had this business for quite some time and does well thanks to the determination with which she runs it. She wishes to be able to continue working to support her family. 

She requests this loan to purchase sheets, among other items. She is thankful for the loan and promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: to buy sheets, among other things.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie previously accessed a 9,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan of 14,000 PHP to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Richie hopes that her business will last longer and dreams of giving a good education to her children.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 16 years to 32 years. She describes herself to be honest and hardworking. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps cows. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy farm inputs. 

Her business goal is to produce more maize within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 46 years old and with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, etc.  Annabelle has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food stall business in the Philippines. Jessica is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy more chicken to offer for sale.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more chicken to offer for sale.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 34 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Zenaida has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an overlocker sewing machine, table and sewing machine.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 58 years old and a widow with eight children, one of whom is in school.

Nida is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nida has been farming rice for eight years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia, invertirá nuevamente en materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas por lo que opta por solicitar más capital para comprar 10 qq de maíz, leña y gas propano, con dicha inversión ahorra al comprar por mayor y tendrá mejores ganancias.
Para ella el crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda para estabilizar su negocio y generar un cambio positivo en su economía, Yesenia sufrió una quemadura en su cuerpo por lo que en un periodo de corto tiempo el negocio bajo la productividad, pero no evito que ella mantuviera su responsabilidad en los pagos de la deuda.
texts.en: Yesenia will invest her loan again in basic supplies to be able to make and sell tortillas, and this is why she is requesting a loan to buy 10 quintals of corn, firewood, and propane gas. WIth this capital she will make a saving as she will be able to buy at wholesale and will gain a larger profit. The previous loan helped her business to become stable and also had a positive impact on her income. Yesenia suffered from a burn, and for a short time this decreased her productivity, but it did not stop her from keeping her pledge to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy 10 quintals of corn, firewood, and propane gas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a married woman and she has 4 children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a retail business where she sells rice. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital.

Violet will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of rice. Her business goal is to own a rice mill within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will buy a piece of land. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 64 years old and widowed. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Imelda has been raising pigs for nine years and also earns additional income from frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 30 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, soft drinks, noodle, and other groceries. 

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chhunheang

texts.en:
Chhunheang, a 32-year-old mother of two children, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she works as a farmer in a small rice field which was located a little bit far from her house.  So far, it is more than ten years that she has been involved in this farming business which can earn a net profit of $5 per day.

She wants to promote her convenience in her life by having a motorbike for daily use in her family. Now she is requesting a loan from HKL to buy a motorbike. 

Chhunheang would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a widowed woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a developing area and her primary customers are daily. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a big tailoring shop that will serve many customers within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, the business will be stable and will sustain her family. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy a stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dressed chicken in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Daisy is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stock of dressed chicken to sell in her food stall.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dressed chicken to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his education.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an electrical generator and an air cooler

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teodora hopes to have a car that she can use in her business and dreams to buy a house as well. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed on her farm. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a direct selling business for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed on her farm. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed for her farm.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo es un honesto respetuoso y soñador hombre de 57 años de edad que ha entregado toda su vida al campo disfrutando de esta profesión y ofreciendo su profesionalismo en beneficio de las personas que diariamente consumos sus sanos productos, el oficio lo aprendió gracias a sus padres quien también se desempeñaron como agricultores, en el especial se dedica al cultivo de maíz y gracias a estos campos ha podido sostener los gatos familiares y mantenerse en el tiempo, pero como persona emprendedora y llena de sueños quiere aspirar a una mejor estabilidad económica que le permita extender sus predios y poder levantarse una mañana y ver que sus campos se extienden más allá de donde llega la vista humana ese es su sueño. Por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de dos hectáreas que le permitirán ampliar sus campos y producción de maíz
texts.en:
Ricardo is an honest, respectful and ambitious man of 57 years who has given his entire life to the field, enjoying the profession and offering his professionalism to the benefit the people who consume his healthy products daily. He began this work thanks to his parents who also earned a living as farmers. 

His specialty is growing corn and, thanks the these fields, he has been able to cover the family expenses over time, but as an enterprising person full of dreams, he wants to aspire to a higher economic stability that will allow him to expand his property. To wake up in the morning and see that his fields stretch as far as the eye can see is his dream. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase two hectares that will allow him to increase his fields and corn production.

loans.use: to buy two hectares to increases his fields

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, age 28, raises pigs to earn an income. She has been involved in this agricultural business for the past eight years, and she has borrowed 14 times form NWTF to sustain it. 

She and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school.

Mary Jane has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 17,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa de 31 años de edad, no tiene ningún año de estudio por la situación económica.  Esta acompañada, su esposo trabaja de jornalero, tienen 3 hijos que viven con ella, no trabajan porque están pequeños pero tampoco estudian, solamente vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. 

Su negocio es la venta de ropa, cada 3 días por semana sale a vender, lo aprendió de su mamá, antes vendía pescado y por eso decidió hacer su propio negocio, la distancia que recorre a veces lo hace caminando o en bus, solamente ella y su familia se involucran en el negocio, el horario es de 7:00 am a 1:00 pm. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar blusas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior de hombre y de mujer. Con la finalidad de surtir más con ropa su negocio. 

La principal necesidad es que pueda mejorar su negocio. Planea abrir un pequeño local de venta de ropa, para su familia darles una mejor vida para sus hijos, espera mandarlos a la escuela y que sean unos profesionales, las ganancias las utilizara para mejorar su negocio y de esa forma ampliarlo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 31 years old and has not even one year of studies to help with her economic situation. She is married, her husband is a day laborer, and she has three children who live with her. They do not work because they are small, but they are not studying either. She lives only with her husband and three children. 

Her business is in clothing sales. Three days a week she goes out to sell. She learned this from her mother, before she sold fish and, for this reason, she decided to open her own business. She travels the distance sometimes on foot or bus. Only her and her family are involved in the business, from 7:00 am to 1:00 pm. 

The loan that she is requesting is to buy blouses, pants, skits and men's and women's underwear. Her aim is to increase her business's supply of clothing. 

The primary goal is to improve her business. She plans to open a small clothing store in order to provide a better life for her children. She hopes to send them to school so they can be professionals. She will use the earnings to improve her business and with this it will grow.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, skirts and men's and women's underwear in order to stock her clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, sewing machine and embroidery machine.

loans.name: Ceneza

texts.en:
Ceneza, age 58, runs a general store business to earn a living. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her store carries a variety of general use items, such as sugar, soap, and diapers.

She and her husband have three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ceneza has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy grocery items to offer for sale.

In the future, Ceneza would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be able to sell fashion wear for both men and women within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a quality life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a food stall business in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing 15,00 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more oyster to sell in her food stall.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her chldren to college.

loans.use: to buy more oysters to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee is 37 years old and has three children. Analee is married and all of her children are in school.

Analee is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Analee requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

Analee has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Analee would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 42 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Amy has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Amy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana Merrh

texts.en:
Ana Merrh is 25 years old, married and has one kid. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Ana Merrh requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ana Merrh has been farming rice for three years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Ana Merrh would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta 5° grado. Actualmente está acompañada, su pareja está en los Estados Unidos donde trabaja para mandarles dinero, el esposo de ella trabaja en construcción como ayudante, tiene un niño de 4 años que aún no asiste a la escuela y vive la mamá con ella; pero solo su hijo depende de ella. 

Reina se dedica a los oficios domésticos, principalmente solo se dedica al cuidado del niño, porque es el esposo el que aporta para todos los gastos. El préstamo le ayudara, ya que opero a su hijo y una de las principales necesidades será que con ese dinero lograra llevarlo a consulta y hacer los gastos principales para que su hijo se mejore pronto. Los sueños para su familia es el que el padre de su hijo regrese para estar juntos con su hijo y para su hijo que logre verlo convertido en una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Reina is 32 years old and studied up to Grade 5. She is married. Her husband is in the United States where he works works in construction as a helper so he can send them money. She has a 4 year old son who does not yet go to school. Her mother also lives with them, but only her son is dependent on her. Reina takes care of the house, principally raising her son. The money her husband sends covers all their expenses.

The loan will help her as her son was operated on and one of the principal needs is for this money to pay for doctor visits and to make the main payments so that her son recovers quickly. The dream for her family is for the father to return so he can be with his son and for the son to grow up to be a good person.

loans.use: to take her son to see the doctor and pay for expenses to speed the recovery from an operation.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina es una mujer de 43 años de edad casada y madre de un hijo.
Ella es muy aficionada a la naturaleza y su entorno sobre todo a las plantas ornamentales, desde muy niña le gustaba coleccionar pétalos de flores para luego clasificarlos por especie y archivarlos dentro de un álbum de fotos que guardaba con mucho récelo, el tiempo pasó pero sus gustos y aficiones no cambiaron.
Evangelina se casó y tuvo un hijo al cual dedicó enteramente todo su tiempo y su amor, al cabo de 3 años ella comenzó su emprendimiento creó un vivero de plantas y flores; “el comienzo fue difícil porque tenía que cuidar a mi bebe y ocuparme de mi trabajo, con el tiempo empecé a tener clientes y a ofrecer productos como; adornos florales, plantas de interiores y todo tipo de decoraciones florales” comenta Evangelina.
Ella necesita expandir su negocio y para eso necesita un capital de trabajo que la impulse a crear un negocio más estable y rentable para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Es por eso que Evangelina solicita un préstamo para la expansión de su vivero de plantas y flores.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a 43-year-old woman who is married and mother to one son. She is very fond of nature and the environment, but above all she likes ornamental plants. From a very young age she enjoyed collecting flower petals and later classifying them by species and archiving them in a photo album that she guarded jealously. Time passed but her passion did not change. 

Evangelina got married and had a son, to whom she has given all of her time and love. After three years, she her business, a plant and flower nursery. She says, "It was difficult in the beginning because I had to care for my baby and continue working, but over time I began to get regular clients and now I offer products like: floral arrangements, inside plants and all types of floral decor." She needs to expand her business and for this, she needs working capital that will enable her to create a more stable business to improve her her family's quality of life. It is for this reason that Evangelina is requesting a loan to expand her plant and flower nursery.

loans.use: to expand her plant and flower nursery.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva previously accessed a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000, which she used to buy spare parts and accessories for her jeepney, as well as to pay for its maintenance. The increase in her earnings were a big help in terms of paying for the education of her children as well as in other areas of the family's personal, household, and business expenditures.

Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. Jeeps were used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sufficiently sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, jeepneys are a phenomenon entirely unique to the Philippines.

In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.
 
Eva would like to apply for another PhP 15,000 loan so she can buy spare parts for the jeepney as well as to perform necessary maintenance. The increased profits from her business will significantly help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eva dreams of eventually owning a second jeepney. Her goal is to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the jeepney as well as to perform necessary maintenance

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be generous. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetic goods. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her shop.

Elizabeth has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her repair shop

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, age 53, is a rice farmer. Her rice field is located in Bangkal, Aguada, Ozamiz City. She and her husband have raised three children, now grown.

For this cropping season, she hopes to expand her farming activities. She has applied for a loan to enable her to pay for land and seed bed preparation.

loans.use: to pay for land and seed bed preparation

loans.name: Ma. Nerissa

texts.en:
Ma. Nerissa is 43 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, sugar, etc. 

Ma. Nerissa has been in this business for 15 years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, and sugar

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

Dolores successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Dolores' business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Dadash

texts.en:
Dadash, born in 1954, works in construction. He has repaired ceilings and performed other kinds of home repairs for the past 20 years. 

He and his wife have been married for 23 years and have three children. Their elder daughter is now married, and their son and younger daughter attend school. Dadash lives in the Baku region with his large and lovely family. 

Dadash has requested a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN. He will use his loan funds to buy materials to support his business. 

He is very grateful to his lenders and to Kiva for this help.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials to support his construction business

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo de 60 años de edad, solo estudio segundo grado, porque sus padres ya no pudieron ayudarle con sus estudios. Es casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, es padre de 2 hijos, el primero de ellos estudia primer año de bachillerato y tiene 16 años, la segunda tiene 15 años y estudia noveno grado.

Ricardo se dedica a trabajar en la siembra de granos básicos, pero también  cuida un ganado de un amigo. Las actividades que realiza es ordeñar, darle su comida a tiempo, apartar los terneros y limpiar los potreros, la agricultura es el patrimonio que tiene desde joven porque sus padres le enseñaron; ya que no hay otra fuente de ingresos y necesita para la alimentación de su familia, en cuanto a las actividades pecuarias su patrón fue quien lo instruyo para que pudiera hacer el trabajo por sí solo. Donde cultiva le queda a 5 minutos de sus casa y de dirige a pie el ganado que cuida está a 20 minutos y tiene que caminar más, su hijo mayor es el que le ayuda a trabajar cuando no estudia, las horas de trabajo son de 6:00 a.m.  a 1:00 p.m.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar herbicidas, insecticidas y fertilizantes, también pagara la mano de obra que le ayudaran a realizar dichas actividades agrícolas, considera que el crédito es de gran ayuda porque no es fácil que alguien le preste dinero en estos tiempos.


  El sueño de Ricardo es que sus hijos se preparen que sean profesionales que en un futuro les ayuden a ellos a que puedan tener un estilo de vida diferente, también manifiesta que pretende comprar sus animales  y darle los cuidos que requieren para no tener que comprar los productos lácteos, si no al contario poder vender de su producción.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 60 years old and could only study up to Grade 2 as his parents couldn't support his studies. He is married, his wife does the house work. He is the father of two children. The oldest is 16 and is in first year of Secondary school. The second is 15 and is studying in Grade 9.

Ricardo works growing basic grains but he is also taking care of cattle for a friend. His activities are to milk, feed the cows on time, separate the calves and clean the fields. Agriculture is his inheritance which his parents taught him when he was young. He has no other source of income and needs to feed his family. His landlord taught him that he could do this work himself. Where he grows his crops is 5 minutes away and he walks. The cattle are 20 minutes away so he has to walk more. His oldest son helps him when he is not studying. He works from 6 am until 1pm.

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer and also pay for labor to help him carry out his tasks. He believes that the loan is of great assistance as it is not easy to get a loan in these times. Ricardo's dream is to have his children study to become professionals. That would allow them to have a different lifestyle in the future. He also indicates that he would like to buy his own animals and care for them as needed so that he wouldn't have to buy dairy products, but rather sell them.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rossielle

texts.en:
Rossielle grinds coconuts to earn an income.  She has been in this business for 11 years now and works hard to support her family.

She has requested a PhP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of the coconut grinder.

In the future, Rossielle would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her coconut grinder

loans.name: Zarik

texts.en:
Zarik lives in the village of Varser in the Gegharkunik region. She has a vocational education specializing in accountancy, but she earns an income from farming and agriculture. She has been involved in this work from a very young age. Zarik lives with her husband, her retired mother, and a daughter who attends school. 

Zarik and her husband work very hard, since their farming activities provide the only income for the family. On her farm, Zarik has three cows, three calves, a bull, a piglet, seven lambs, seven sheep, and 30 chickens. She makes cheese from both cow's and sheep's milk, and she offers the cheese for sale along with milk, butter, and macun (a traditional Armenian dairy product). The sale of meat and potatoes (the main vegetable that they cultivate on their plot of land) is her husband’s duty, and he sells these at the city wholesale market. Zarik says that naturally their peasant life is full of hardships, but they are used to that way of life, and they are accustomed to working hard, day and night.
 
She is requesting this loan because would like to increase the number of her farm cattle. She will use her loan funds to buy a calf, as well as to buy fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a calf, as well as to buy fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, a freezer and supplies to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Juena

texts.en:
Junes is a fish vendor. She earns an additional income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She and her husband have five children, and she works hard to support her family.

Juena is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 21,500 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase fish to offer for sale.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela, age 34 and unmarried, runs a general store business to earn an income. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her store offers a variety of grocery items such as sugar, soft drinks, and noodles. 

Angela has requested a PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, age 48, buys and sells nipa roofing materials to earn a living. She has been involved in this business for three years. She and her husband have five children, two of whom are enrolled in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Elsa has requested a PhP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase nipa roofing materials to offer for sale.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase nipa roofing materials to offer for sale

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe previously accessed a loan in the amount of PhP 50,000, which she used to buy fruits and vegetables to offer for sale. Her increased earnings were a big help in the family's personal, household, and business expenditures. In addition to her store, she rents out an apartment for additional income. Her husband is a farmer, and they both generate income to support their family.
 
She would like to apply for another PhP 50,000 loan, which she will use to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will significantly help her to sustain her family's daily needs and support the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Guadalupe is hopeful that her business will last a long time, and her goal is to give her family a good future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
