*All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to offer for sale

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine, age 32, works in packing at a private company, but her primary occupation is farming, which she performs daily after she is released from work. She lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region.

Marine is an accountant by profession, but since she got married very early, she did not have the opportunity to obtain work in this area after her training. She is the mother of two sons, whom she describes as very cheerful and active boys. They are enrolled in school. 

On her farm, she has three cows, three calves, a heifer, a piglet, four sheep, and 20 chickens. With the help of her husband, Marine sells milk, cheese, meat, and eggs, all sourced from the farm. She is very skilled in these activities. She and her husband also cultivate a plot of land, and they harvest and sell potatoes, cucumbers, and tomatoes.
 
Marine is requesting a loan in the amount of 250,000 Armenian drams, because she would like to buy another cow. She hopes that this investment will allow her to sell more dairy products, thereby providing the family with more income.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, age 53, runs a general store business to earn an income. Her store offers such grocery items as sardines, noodles, and soft drinks. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

She and her husband have 12 children, four of whom are still in school. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more grocery items to sell in her store.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Kenia Luz

texts.es:
Kenia es una mujer emprendedora habitante del municipio de Tierra Alta Córdoba, es una persona trabajadora y tenaz con grandes aspiraciones y sueños para su vida.
Ha trabajado toda su vida en el campo y tiene gran experiencia en el manejo de cultivos y de animales.
Trabaja actualmente en la cosecha de plátano y yuca en un terreno de su propiedad, adicionalmente tiene un negocio de producción y venta de ganado porcino.
Estas actividades son la única fuente de ingresos para su familia, por eso le dedica tiempo y esfuerzo.
Pide una ayuda para capitalizar su negocio con la compra de fertilizantes para sus tierras y la compra de ganado porcino.
Con estos elementos tendrá la oportunidad de continuar evolucionando como empresaria agropecuaria.
texts.en:
Kenya is an enterprising woman living in the municipality of Tierra Alta Córdoba. She is a hardworking and tenacious person with great aspirations and dreams for her life. 

She has worked all her life in agriculture and has extensive experience in the management of both crops and animals.

Currently she is working on banana and cassava crops on property she owns, and also has a business raising and selling pigs. 

These activities are the sole source of income for her family, which is why she devotes all her time and effort to them.
 
She asks for help to raise capital for her businesses: to purchase fertilizers for her land and to buy pigs. 

With these acquisitions she will have the chance to continue developing as an agricultural entrepreneur.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies and pigs.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 42 years old, widowed, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, salted eggs, etc.

Hilda has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, salted eggs, etc. to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel her home (paint the walls).

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 54 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Emelita works very hard to provide for them. Emelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Emelita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Victorino works hard to support his family. He has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and he earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Victorino is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Victorino has been sustaining his business activities through his past 18 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help to attain his dream, to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn has a business selling Avon products in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items, such as body lotion, perfume, and shampoo.

Evelyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as body lotion, perfume, and shampoo.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik lives In the village of Zovaber (the Gegharkunik region) with her neice and small family. She has a daughter who is an economics student at the Yerevan State University. Knarik does not have a higher education. She worked for many years as a weaver but is now only busy with farming and agriculture. Knarik’s husband is an invalid because of a heart attack. Because of this he can only provide a little help to his wife and farm, as much as he is able.

Knarik manages nearly everything on the farm alone, taking care of two cows, two calves, four heifers, four lambs, four sheep, eighteen chickens and two geese. She has regular customers and resellers who buy her farm products, including milk, butter, cheese, curd, meat, and eggs. Potato cultivation is the main part of this family income, since this vegetable is suitable for the region's climate. Potato cultivation is a very hard, non-female activity, but Knarik has no choice. She is ready to face any hardship in order to have more income and to provide her family with good living conditions.

Knarik requests this loan in order to develop her potato cultivation. She will buy a new sort of potato seedling and fertilizer.

loans.use: to develop her potato cultivation by purchasing potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella is thankful for the financial assistance that was extended to her, as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her business income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. Aside from her variety store, she also has a canteen for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy inventory, including groceries, toiletries, and beverages. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s educational expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Estella dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is also where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital and to repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 39 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family by selling charcoal in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Fely has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her charcoal business for four years while earning additional income from a general store. Fely aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Henrylin

texts.en:
Henrylin is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Henrylin has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Henrylin has been in this business for six years. In the future, Henrylin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Succet

texts.en:
Joyce is 17 years old and is the first of three children in the family. Her mother, Succet, supports the family through her catering business in the Philippines. Joyce is studying for a BS in criminology and is currently in the first year of this 4-year course.

Joyce is borrowing 7,100 to pay for tuition fees of the 1st semester, 2014-2015. When she graduates, Joyce plans to work.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 40 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Joan works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Joan has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as sardines, eggs, snack foods, and other groceries. In the future, Joan would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ramón Mauricio

texts.es:
Ramón de 50 años de edad, por la situación económica de su familia no logro estudiar. Esta acompañado, su pareja trabaja como ama de casa, son padres dos hijos y viven en casa, los niños están en la escuela y solamente ellos viven con él. 

Ramón se dedica a la agricultura, siempre se ha dedicado a esto, se decidió a esto ya su padre le enseño, la distancia del trabajo está a unos 30 minutos y viaja caminando, solamente él trabaja, el horario es de 7:00 am a 1:00 pm. 

El crédito le ayudara a comprar lo principal para la agricultura, como semilla de maíz, abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra. El cultivo de maíz le ayudara a vender más maíz y obtener mejores ingresos. Los sueños de su familia son que sus hijos se superen, tener una mejor vida, además de la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Ramón, 50 years old, never went to school because of his family's economic situation. He is married; his wife works as a housewife. They are parents of two children who live with them. The kids are in school, and only they live with Ramon.

Ramon farms. He has always done this. He decided to farm because his father taught it to him. It is about 30 minutes' distance to work, and he walks. Only Ramon works; his schedule is 7 am to 1 pm.

The loan will help him purchase the main things for farming such as corn seeds, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, and to pay for a helping hand. The corn crop will help him sell more corn and earn better income. The family's dreams are for the children to succeed, to have a better life, and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, and to pay for a helping hand.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more groceries for her variety store. Her loan helped to support her business as well as the education of her child, who is now in college. Her business income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband, who works as a driver, work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s educational expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Benita dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. This is also where she draws strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 54 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive en su propia casa junto a sus hijas en el Distrito de Zaña, una comunidad muy conocida por las famosas Iglesias que fueron arrasadas por cauce del rio zaña hace muchos años, en este Distrito estuvieron enterrados los restos de San Agustín, su gente esta dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la elaboración de cajas de madera para dulces típicos de su distrito, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela fija que la conoce por la actividad que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de una motosierra que le permita cortar madera y de esta manera el mismo proveerse de la materia prima que emplea en su negocio.
texts.en:
Julio is 54 years old, married, and lives in his own house with his daughters in the Zana district. This is a community well-known for its famous churches that were destroyed by the Zana river many years ago. The remains of Saint Agustin were interred in this district. The people in the district work in business, farming, and ranching. The district is located in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Julio builds wooden boxes for the typical local sweets. He has been doing this for several years. His runs his business out of his home. He has a steady clientele that knows him for his work. He has requested a loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 nuevos soles to purchase a power saw that will allow him to cut wood, which will provide the primary material that he uses for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a power saw to cut wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad tiene 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos y hermana en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganaería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio, adicionalmente vende gelatinas y mazamorras que ella misma prepara, es conocida por la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de cerveza que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 48 years old. She lives in her own home with her children and sister in the Buenos Aires district. It is a community with a sweltering climate. The population works in farming, business, and ranching. The community is located in the Morropon province, which is in the Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells beer from her home. She also sells gelatin desserts and pudding that she makes. She is known for her work. She has requested this loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase a greater quantity of beer, which will allow her to have better income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase beer to stock up her business.

loans.name: Alesio Harold

texts.es:
El señor Alesio tiene 37 años de edad  vive en la  ciudad de Matagalpa al lado de su amada esposa e hijo, este señor se caracteriza por ser muy honrado y sobre todo trabajador que lucha con mucho esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia.

Alesio trabaja para una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado desde hace diez años, desempeñando el cargo de operador de planta. ante de trabajar en esta empresa se dedicaba a la agricultura pero devido que las cosechas han bajado sus ganancia porque los insumos han tenido gran alza en el mercado , decidio tomar este trabajo y me gusta porque es una nueva experiencia y mensual obtengo siempre mis ingresos.

El crédito financiado lo destinara para reparar su vivienda ya que desea construir un muro como cerca  y embaldosar su casa ya que en época de invierno es afectado por la cantidad de agua que se introduce en el solar de su vivienda.

El señor Alesio  agradece por otorgarle este préstamo porque ha sido de mucha importancia para él y su familia ya que así podrá darle una mejor condición a su familia.
texts.en:
Alesio is 37 years old. He lives in the city of Matagalpa along with his beloved wife and son. This man is characterized as being very honorable, and above all, hard working - a man who will fight with great effort to get his family ahead.

Alesio has worked for an aqueduct and sewage company for 10 years as a plant operator. Before working for this business, he farmed. However, his harvests were generating a lower profit because the cost of supplies from the market was increasing.  He decided to take this job and enjoys it because it is a new experience and always gives him an income each month.

This loan will be used to repair his home. He wants to build a fence and tile his home because in the winter season, it is affected by the amount of water that comes in.

Alesio is grateful that this loan has been authorized because it has been very important to him and his family since he will now be able to give his family better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, quarry stone, cement, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Ankabenkelekan 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Ankabenkelekan 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec Marta, 2 ème debout de  la gauche  vers  la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Ankabenkelekan 4 group are married women averaging 35 years of age, with five children. They all live in traditional families in Fonfona, a village in Koutiala, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their ninth loan with the institution, having duly repaid their prior loans.

The grow rice, which is what Marta does, for example. She is the second one standing from left to right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to purchase agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc], seeds, small agricultural tools and pay the cost of labor to work 1 ha [2.5 acres] of land.
After harvesting,  she will sell her produce in Koutiala, to a mixed clientele.
Marta plans to earn an average monthly income of 90,000 West African francs at the end of the agricultural cycle.
This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of labor, seeds, fertilizers, and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy irrigation supplies, compost, seeds and fertilizer to prepare and care for his crops.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2013, 10 women from a small village in the Jajpur district stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families. They formed a group named "Maa Santoshi Self Help Group". The members of Maa Santoshi Self Help Group are all women from the district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Mrs. Hemalata, who was selected as their president. The lady standing with her raised hand is Hemalata. 

Hemalata is 55 years old and is living with her husband and her two children. Her husband is a farmer who has been farming for a long time. She got the idea of growing vegetables from her husband. She gathered some other women from her neighborhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took on leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. Initially, she started growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes and onions, but later on she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumber, lady fingers and brinjal (eggplant). She has a very good relationship with her customers, as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. Now she has a new idea to rent some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a larger scale. For this, she has requested a loan to rent land and purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to rent land and purchase seeds and fertilizers for vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Akhandalamani Shg Group

texts.en:
Susama is a 38-year-old married woman who has three children. She lives in the village of Samia in the Jajpur district of Odisha, India. Susama is a housewife who is very happy and responsible. She alternates her household activities with work in her business. She has a business growing vegetables and paddy and selling them in the market in the Jajpur district of Odisha, India. She has had this business for six years and it is going very well. 

At this time, Susama is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and new and advanced tools for farming. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demands. This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the group "Akhandalamani Self Help Group". The members of the group have selected Susama as their president. The lady standing with her raised hand is Susama. The common goal of this group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, seeds and tools for farming.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosalina hopes to have other sources of income and dreams of having a peaceful and abundant life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jhon Jamer

texts.es:
Jhon decidió iniciar con la venta de mercancía tales como bolsos, lociones y accesorios con el objetivo de buscar recursos para el sostenimiento de sus estudios universitarios y poder colaborar con los gastos de su casa, este oficio se lo enseño su hermana quien actualmente ejerce esta misma actividad.
Desde siempre había mostrado cierto interés por las ventas pero nunca había concretado nada.
Hoy en día tiene algunos clientes establecidos y siempre trabaja con alegría, pues sabe que con este trabajo podrá conseguir muchas cosas en su vida.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de mercancía de bolsos y colonias, dándose la oportunidad de aumentar su inventario y tener un capital mucho más amplio.
El sueña con ser un profesional exitoso y continuar trabajando independiente.
texts.en: Jhon decided to start selling merchandise like bags, lotions and accessories with the goal of finding a way to pay for his university studies and help out with expenses at home. His sister taught him the trade, as she works in the same field. He has always been interested in sales but had never done anything concrete. Now he has established customers and is always happy to work, since he knows that it will allow him to obtain many things in life. He asks for a loan to buy a stock of merchandise such as bags and colognes, giving him the opportunity to increase his inventory and his business capital. His dream is to be a successful professional and to continue to work independently.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise like bags and colognes.

loans.name: Omm Sairam Shg Group

texts.en:
Omm Sairam Self Help Group consists of 15 women from a village in the Jajpur district in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and solve theirs problem among themselves. One of them is Naliniprava, who was selected as the President of Omm Sairam Self Help Group. The lady standing with her hand raised is Naliniprava. Naliniprava is 26 years old and is staying with her husband and three children. She hopes to educate her children in a good school. She has three acres of land in her village and she is using her land to grow sugarcane. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. She has requested this loan with her group members, a part of which will help her to purchase the required resources for sugarcane cultivation. She says a portion of the loan will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

Naliniprava, along with her group members, says, "Thank you Kiva for this kind help and support".

loans.use: to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Joelisa

texts.en:
As the married mother of seven children, Joelisa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Joelisa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Joelisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
As the married mother of five children, Loreta works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Loreta is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Loreta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support of the previous loan which helped her to boost her business of selling food consumables. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Devi Shg Group

texts.en:
Bakani is a 47-year-old lady. She has two children, both of whom are in school. Her family lives in a village in the Jajpur District in Odisha, India. She and her husband earn a living through working as farmers and cultivating rice and vegetables. Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn approximately 3,000 INR per month to meet her family’s needs. 

Bakani is leading a group named Devi Self Help Group. Its eight members are applying for a loan with Peoples' Forum. The members of Devi Self Help Group are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, a general store, a dairy farm, and a wood business. Bakani is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and some irrigation tools for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to raise more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and some irrigation tools for her farmland.

loans.name: Basulei Shg Group

texts.en:
Asanti is a 42-year-old lady who has two children. The lady standing with her hand raised is Asanti. She lives in a village in the Jajpur district of Odisha, India, with her husband and her children. A few years back, she started a business making and selling flour, such as wheat flour, maize flour, gram flour, lentil flour, rice flour, etc. She makes these flours with the help of grinders. She makes a variety of flours depending on the demand for flour in the market. 

Asanti, along with her group, is requesting this loan and she will use her portion to buy more supplies such as wheat, maize, grains, etc. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is in a group of 11 members, all women who live in the same community. They named their group "Basulei Self Help Group". They are situated in the Jajpur district of Odisha, India.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, maize, grains, and lentils to make flour.

loans.name: Jay Hanuman Shg Group

texts.en:
The responsible Jay Hanuman Self Help Group is made up of eight members. The members of this group are all women from the district of Jajpur in Odisha, India. One of them is Anita, who was selected as their president. The lady standing with her hand raised is Anita. Anita is a 32-year-old woman living with her husband and two children. She makes leaf plates and bowls woven out of dry leaves and sells them in the nearby market. These plates are used for different purposes, mainly for serving food. She makes different types and sizes of plates depending upon the demands of her customers. She will use her part of the loan to purchase machinery so she can weave the plates more frequently and quickly and to purchase raw materials like leaves, thread, glue and plastic. She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time.

The other members of this group are engaged in different activities like milk selling, vegetable cultivation etc.

All of the group members are very happy and thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like dry leaves, thread, glue and plastic and a machine for weaving leaf plates.

loans.name: Maylene

texts.en:
Maylene is 44 years old and married with three children. All of them are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maylene has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

Maylene has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Maylene would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build other rooms and another bathroom.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José Miguel tiene 26 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive en el Distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona rural, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicad en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de carga contando con una motocarguera desde hace varios años, cuenta con clientela conocida, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 500 nuevos soles para mejoramiento de su infraestructura que le permita seguir brindando a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en: José Miguel is a 26-year-old married man with two children. He lives in the district of Nueva Arica, a rural zone in the province of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque on the north coast of Peru. The local people earn their living through agriculture, livestock and commerce. For several years has had a business delivering cargo by motorcycle, and he has a solid client base. He is seeking a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 3,500 nuevos soles in order to to make improvements to his infrastructure so he can continue to improve his services.

loans.use: to make improvements to his infrastructure so he can continue to improve his services.

loans.name: Marnie

texts.en:
Marnie is 38 years old and married. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marnie has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like shampoo, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries.

Marnie has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, soft drinks, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Francis Elvis is 18 years old and is the fourth of four children in the family. His mother, Elma, supports the family through her gardening business in the Philippines.

Francis Elvis is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Tourism Management and is currently in the 2nd year of his 4-year course.

Elma is borrowing PHP 7,665 to pay for Francis Elvis's tuition fees for the 1st semester of 2014/2015.

When he graduates, Francis Elvis plans to find employment in order to help his family.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna’s first Kiva loan was a great help to her. With the money, she bought a computer and reading materials for the private lessons she gives on Armenian language and literature. She is sure this second loan will also be useful. 

Anna has a higher education and a high qualification as a psychologist-pedagogue. She continues to work at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical University as a lecturer. She still has a lot of pupils who attend her private courses on Armenian Language and Literature, which prepares them for their entrance examinations.

Anna is married and has a 6-year-old daughter. Her husband works as an engineer at the Vanadzor chemical factory.

Anna needs this loan to furnish a room which she separated off in her flat for her courses. She wants to buy comfortable chairs and a big table.

loans.use: to furnish a room which she separated off in her flat for her private courses

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 23-year-old married woman who lives in Madaba, Jordan with her two daughters and her husband.

She has been working as a hairdresser for one year at her home in order to help support her daughters financially. 

Now she is seeking another youth loan to help her to open her own salon in order to expand her work and increase the family income.

loans.use: To open an independent beauty salon

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable is 32 years old and married to Gabriel, and together they are blessed with two children aged 10 and 3. She has been selling assorted cereals for the last seven years and earns an income of 5,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	
She is now requesting her second loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy more stock of cereals like dry maize, beans and peas to sell to her customers. The profit she earns will be used to pay the school fees for her children. 

She hopes for growth in her business and to open a wholesale cereal shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals like dry maize, beans and peas

loans.name: Ankabenkelekan 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Ankabenkelekan 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec Sirantou, 2 ème assise de  la gauche  vers  la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1/2 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Ankabenkelekan 5 group are married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional families in Fonfona, one of the villages in Koutialla, in the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. The group is on their ninth loan, and their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Sirantou, who is seated second from the left, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs, seeds, and agricultural materials, and to pay the cost of labor to farm a half hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed group of customers.

Sirantou hopes to earn an average profit of 60,000 francs CFA at the end of the harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back the loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay the cost of labor and to buy seeds, farm inputs, and materials

loans.name: Ankabenkelekan 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Ankabenkelekan 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec Tata Solo, debout à gauche et au bout  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Ankabenkelekan 6 group are married women who, on average, are 32 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional families in Fonfona, one of the villages of Koutiala, in the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. The group is on their ninth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Tata Solo, who is standing on the far left in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs, seeds, and agricultural materials, and to pay the cost of labor to farm one hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed group of customers.

Tata Solo hopes to earn an average profit of 85,000 francs CFA after the harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay the cost of labor, and to buy seeds, farm inputs, and materials

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: María como muchas mujeres del campo que se revelaron en busca de una independencia económica con respecto a sus parejas que la veían casi siempre como mujer que debían dedicarse al hogar, pues este pensamiento ellas mismas lo han venido cambiando y demostrando que tiene las mismas habilidades del hombre para realizar trabajos del campo y ser productivas para su hogar sin descuidar sus propios gastos personales que son muy merecidos debido al trabajo duro que realizan cada día. María como trabajadora del campo tiene su cría de aves, con las que ha podido convertirse en una fuente de ingresos para su hogar y ayudar ellos tiempos de crisis del campo. Solicita un crédito para la compra de aves para engordar y vender buscando aumentar su flujo e ventas y tener ingresos mensuales más elevados para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María is like many rural women who stand up for their economic independence from their partners who think they should only do housework.  They have been trying to change this mindset and demonstrate that they have the same skills as men regarding farm work; and they can also be productive at home and cover their own personal expenses that they deserve because of the hard work they do daily.

María raises chickens and has been able to turn the business into a source of income for her household and also help out in agricultural times of crisis.  She is requesting a loan to buy chickens so she can increase sales and income.  This will give her family more monthly income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy chickens to improve sales and her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Ankabenkelekan 9 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe Ankabenkelekan 9 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fonfona, un des villages de Koutiala, 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec Kodoubacho, 2 ème personne assise de  la droite  vers  la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à Koutiala, après la récolte, à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Ankabenkelekan 9 group are married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional families in Fonfona, one of the villages in Koutiala, in the third administrative region of Mali. The group is collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Kodoubacho, who is seated second from the right in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs, seeds, and agricultural materials. She will also pay the cost of labor and tillage to farm one hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and in Koutiala to a mixed group of customers.

Kodoubacho hopes to earn an average profit of 95,000 francs CFA at the end of the harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay the cost of labor and tillage, and to buy seeds, farm inputs, and materials

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano tiene 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto con su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios como obrero de construcción civil como (encofrados, columnas, pisos, etc), desempeñándose en este rubro desde hace varios años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas que le permitan mejorar sus servicios y de esa manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Adriano is 56 years old and lives in his own rustic house in the district of Pucará with his wife and children.  It is a community characterized by its warm climate. The local people work mostly in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming. This community is located in the province of Jáen, which is in the region of Cajamarca in the mountains of northern Peru. 

Adriano has a construction business and builds structural framework, columns, flooring, etc. He has several years of experience in this trade. He is seeking a loan of 500 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa in order to purchase tools so that he can improve his customer service and increase income for the family.

loans.use: To buy tools to improve customer service.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.fr:
Monsieur Alphonse âgé de 70 ans s’active dans le domaine du commerce depuis plus de 37 ans. Il est marié à 3 femmes et père de 15 enfants dont son ainé âgé de 35 ans.
Monsieur Alphonce a arrêté ses études en 1974 pour se lancer dans le commerce de fruits de la période (mangue, pomme de liane, pastèques, orange...). Il a d’abord travaillé pendant deux ans dans le champ d’un tiers qui le rémunérait. Au début de la troisième année, il a démarré en achetant des mangues pour revendre. Au fil des années, il a développé son commerce et diversifié les produits. Chaque matin, il se lève à 6h du matin et commence sa journée ; et vers 19h-20h, il rentre chez lui. Alphonce travaille avec ceux qui possèdent des champs et qui cultivent, il achète directement la marchandise chez eux ; il a un étalage dans le marché et revend aux petits commerçants qui vont revendre. Depuis des années, il a entretenu sa famille grâce aux revenus de cette activité. Il gère la dépense quotidienne, mais dès fois, il reçoit l’appui de ses grands enfants qui se débrouillent.
Alphonse souhaite avoir un fond plus consistant pour pouvoir acheter la quantité voulue et devenir un jour auto-suffisant.
texts.en:
Alphonce is 70 years old and has been active in commerce for more than 37 years. He is married to three women and is a father of 15 children, of whom the eldest is 35 years old. Alphonce stopped school in 1974 to start his business selling seasonal fruits (mango, passion fruit, watermelons, oranges, etc.). He first worked for someone else in the fields. Then in the third year, he started buying mangos to resell. Over the years, he developed his business and diversified his products.

Each morning Alphonce wakes up at 6 a.m. to start his day, and he returns home at around 7 or 8 p.m. He works with those who own and farm their own fields and buys his products directly from them.

Alphonce has a stall in the market and resells his products to small-scale merchants who work in resale. During the years, he has been able to take care of his family thanks to the earnings from this work. He manages the daily expenses, but sometimes he [also] receives support from his grand children who are getting by.

Alphonce wishes to have more consistent funds so that he can buy the quantities he needs and become self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: improve the electricity in her home, purchase hardware and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: renovate his taxi by re-painting and changing the motor

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 44 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, en el Distrito de Zaña, en su propia casa, ella se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicad en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores (patos, gallinas y pavos)desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales que le permitan engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Rosario, 44, lives in her own home with her husband in the district of Zaña.  She works in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque Region along the northern mountain range of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals (ducks, chickens and turkeys) and has been in business for several years, working out of her backyard.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals to raise and sell at a higher price.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Vicenta es comerciante, vende zapatos y ropa al detalle, los cuales vende desde su casa a los vecinos y algunos encargados, Vicenta actualmente está apoyando a uno de sus hijos quien aun no ha terminado la universidad y se encuentra desempleado, para ella es muy importante la educación de sus hijos, para continuar manteniendo sus gastos básicos solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio comprando ropa variada, calzados de damas y caballeros, esperando así ir creciendo en productos.
texts.en:
Vicenta is a merchant who sells retail shoes and clothing from home to neighbors and on an order basis.  She is supporting one of her sons who has still not finished the university and is unemployed.  It is important to her that her children get an education.

In order to continue covering her basic expenses, she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of clothing and men's and women's shoes.  Her aim is to expand her inventory of products.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing and men's and women's shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric to resell

loans.name: Augustina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Agustina del Carmen tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto con su madre en su propia casa que cuenta con servicios básicos de agua y luz, vive en el distrito de Morropon que pertenece a la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza helada y bebidas refrescantes en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela considerable por ser una zona de clima calurosos hay una alta demanda, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra mayor cantidad de cerveza para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Agustina del Carmen is 23 years old and lives with her mother in her own house that has the basic services of water and power. She lives in the district of Morropon, which belongs to the province of the same name, which belongs to the Piura Region, on the north coast of Peru.

She sells cold beer and refreshing drinks at her house and has a considerable clientele; since it is an hot climate area, there is high demand. She requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy a greater quantity of beer to offer her customers.

loans.use: buy beer to supply her business.

loans.name: Lucio Arnoldo

texts.es:
El joven Lucio de 22 años de edad, es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo de campo, siendo su nivel de educación hasta tercer grado en la escuela, ya que su mayor tiempo lo ha pasado cultivando la tierra, con su padre y sus hermanos.  Además, los fines de semana los dedica a la  venta de medicinas naturales para así tener ingreso para su familia, la cual está compuesta por sus hermanos y sus padres, quienes le han apoyado en el negocio de la medicina natural. 

También se dedica a la albañilería y realizando esta actividad tiene 4 años de experiencia,  actividad que aprendió en un curso de formación que fue impartido por programas solidarios por la alcaldía de su municipio  y también en el tiempo que no hay demanda de trabajos de construcción se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que aprendió de su padres y su abuelo y a la venta de medicinas naturales.  

El dinero será utilizado en compra de mercadería y productos medicinales para la venta,  ya que se ha vuelto su  principal fuente de ingresos, de los cuales aporta a su casa para satisfacer las necesidades básicas. 

Los planes a futuro del joven es seguir cultivando granos básicos, mejorar sus servicios de albañilería y ampliar su negocio de venta de medicina natural.
texts.en:
Young Lucio is 22 years old and is a very dedicated to his work in the fields, his education level being until up to third grade in school because he has spent most of his time cultivating the land with his father and his siblings. Additionally, on the weekends he sells natural medicine to have income for his family, which is made up of his siblings and his parents, who have supported him in the natural medicine business. 

He also works in bricklaying and has 4 years of experience in this occupation, which he learned in a training course given by solidarity programs of the city hall of his town. Also, in the time when there is no demand for construction work, he works in agriculture, an occupation he learned from his parents and his grandfather, and in sales of natural medicine. 

The money will be used for the purchase of merchandise and medicinal products to sell, as this has become his principal source of income, with which he contributes to his household to satisfy the basic necessities. 

The young man's plans for the future are to continue cultivating basic grains, improve his bricklaying services and to expand his natural medicine sales business.

loans.use: buy merchandise and medicinal product to sell, now that this has become his principal source of income, which he contribute to his household to satisfy basic needs.

loans.name: Jose Jacobo

texts.es:
José Jacobo tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge, en el Caserío de Cuyca, una zona rural del distrito de Choros, que está ubicada en la carretera Jaén – Olmos que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante el comercio, agricultura y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al comercio de víveres y pollo, cuenta con considerable clientela que ofrece a sus clientes que son moradores de su caserío y transportistas que transitan por esa ruta, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alterntiva de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José Jacobo is 59 years old and lives with his spouse in the Hamlet of Cuyca, a rural region of the district of Choros. It is located on the Jaen - Olmos highway, which had allowed it to develop through commerce, agriculture and livestock. It is located in the Cutervo Province which in part of the Cajamarca Region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He works in the trade of provisions and chicken and has a considerable clientele of customers who are residents of the hamlet and carriers that travel that route. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2,500 nuevos soles to buy a greater quantity of products to offer his customers and thereby generate greater income for his family.

loans.use: buy staple goods to supply his business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre soltero de 41 años de edad sin hijos
Él vive en Isla Sicuya, la población de este lugar se dedica a la pesca y a la artesanía en totora (tallo de una planta existente sólo en área). Su infancia la pasó aprendiendo el arte ancestral de su comunidad y también viajaba en bote a su escuela primaria para adquirir conocimientos generales de escritura y lectura, su lengua primaria es el Aymara saliendo de su comunidad y sobre todo para el comercio en la ciudad se habla español.
Hace 20 años que dejó la artesanía y se dedicó exclusivamente a la pesca; “cambié la artesanía por la pesca porque mis manos son grandes y mis brazos fuertes y me sentí mejor pescando” comenta Juan.
Además de la pesca también se ocupa de la venta de pescado y para eso recorre varias horas de viajes para llegar a la ciudad ó a la feria más cercana.
Juan cuenta con necesidades en su trabajo constantemente debe renovar sus redes de pesca y dar mantenimiento a su bote, muchas veces acude a sus vecinos y amigos para alquilar sus botes y redes eso afecta en gran medida sus ingresos.
Es por esos motivos que juan solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca y mantenimiento de su bote.
texts.en: Juan is a single 41 year old man, who has no children. He lives on the Island Sicuya. The inhabitants of this place work as fishermen and in handcrafts made of totora (the stem of a plant that exists only in this area). In his childhood he learned about the ancestral art of his community, and he also traveled by boat to his elementary school to learn basic knowledge of writing and reading. His native language is Aymara. Outside his community and specially for commerce, Spanish is spoken. 20 years ago he left the handicraft work and started working exclusively as a fisherman; "I changed handicraft for fishing because my hands are big and my arms are strong, and I felt better fishing", Juan declares. Besides fishing he also works selling fish. For this he travels many hours to get to the city or to the closest market. Juan has many needs in his job. He constantly needs to renew his fishing nets and to give upkeep to his boat. Many times he has to ask neighbors and friends to rent out their boats and nets, and this strongly affects his income. This is why Juan is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets and to pay for the upkeep of his boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and for the upkeep of his boat

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin, age 48, buys and sells rice to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She and her husband have five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 11,000 amount through NWTF.

In the future, Melvin would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Babek

texts.en:
Babek, age 32, provides taxi transportation services to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for 10 years. 

He is from the city of Agdam city, but today he is living as an Internally Displaced Person in the Baku region with his wife, son, and daughter. His wife is a homemaker and both children attend school. 

Currently, the tires on his vehicle are in need of replacement. He is therefore requesting a loan in amount of 600 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

He says he is thankful to Kiva and all his lenders for their help.

loans.use: change the tires on his taxi

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, desde que tuvo a su pequeña bebe, decidió iniciar con un negocio que le permitiera ser independiente y al mismo tiempo estar pendiente de su hija.
Fue así como monto un negocio de fabricación de artesanías como pulseras, aretes, entres otros. Al ver que esto no le generaba muchas ganancias, decidió alternarlo con la venta de mercancía a través de catálogos.
Ella pide un apoyo para la compra de una estantería y de surtido como ropa y accesorios, de esta forma podrá exhibir sus productos de una forma mejor y atraerá un mayor número de clientes.
Su objetivo es poder montar un almacén y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, since she had her little baby, decided to start a business that would allow her to be independent and at the same time be close to her daughter.

So, she opened a business making crafts such as bracelets and earrings among others. When she saw this didn't generate much income, she decided to mix it with the sale of catalog merchandise.

She asks for a loan to purchase shelving and an assortment of clothing and accessories, in this way to be able to show her products in a better way and attract more customers. 

Her goal is to be able to open a shop and have more stable income.

loans.use: to purchase shelving and an assortment of products.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer. She grows and harvests crops on her farmland, and she also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a favorable location, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the fluctuation of prices. She and her husband have six children. She describes herself as industrious. 

Esther has repaid her previous loan successfully. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use her Kes 70,000 loan funds to buy fertilizer, seeds, and animal feed. 

Her goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, seeds, and animal feed

loans.name: Maryory

texts.es: Una vivienda propia es el objetivo que se ha trazado Maryory una joven de tan solo 20 años de edad que cuenta con una Productora de huevos conocida en el sector, Madre de un hijo de 5 años de edad por el cual abandono su hogar buscando una estabilidad con su pareja y velando por que su hijo crezca con el ejemplo de padre, madre y un caluroso hogar que es lo que falta para completar su familia esa casa a la cual llegar día tras día y tener la tranquilidad de que sea propia. Maryory es muy emprendedora, trabajadora y honrada y siguiendo su sueño insaciable de conseguir su propio hogar junto con su esposo solicita un crédito para la compra de gallinas ponedoras, con los que aumentara la producción de huevos y por ende sus ventas, este crédito le traerá grandes beneficios puesto que lograra abarcar pedidos más grandes que para ella representan buen rentabilidad y estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Her own home is the goal that Maryory, a young woman only 20 years old, has set for herself. She has an egg business known in the area. She is the mother of a 5-year-old child for whom she left her home looking for stability with her partner and hoping that her child would grow up with a model of a father, mother, and warm home.  What she lacks to complete the family is this house to which she could arrive day after day and have the assurance that is her own.  Maryory is very enterprising, a hard-worker, and honest, and following her insatiable dream to getting her own home with her husband. She asks for this loan to purchase laying hens, with which she will increase the egg production and, in turn, her sales. This loan will bring her great benefits since she will be able to fill larger orders that, for her, represent good profitability and economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase hens to increase her egg production, seeking to get better contracts

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.es:
Ruperta es una mujer casada de 43 años de edad sin hijos.
Su vida la dedica al comercio y manufactura de queso, también a la cría de ganado vacuno. Desde muy niña aprendió la cría y cuidado del ganado vacuno, se movilizaba grandes distancias hasta encontrar pasto para sus animales, también aprendió la técnica de producción de afrecho que consiste básicamente en juntar juncos de totora y prepararlos con sal; “El cuidado de ganado es parte de toda mi vida hay que alimentarlos, abrigarlos darles un buen cuidado para tener una buena producción lechera”, comenta Ruperta.
Un tiempo después conoció la manufactura del Queso, ahora eso es parte de su vida cotidiana y reparte su día en ambas actividades. Las necesidades de su negocio se resumen en la adquisición de leche fresca de vaca para la elaboración de queso y también en menor cantidad de yogurt.
Ruperta está en la búsqueda constante de crecimiento para mejorar su calidad de vida y sus ingresos, ella quiere invertir en ganado lechero para aumentar su producción y dejar de comprar leche a otros productores.
Es por ese motivo que Ruperta solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno lechero.
texts.en:
Ruperta, 43, is a married woman with no children.

She works making and selling cheese, and also raising dairy cows.  Since she was a child, she learned how to raise and care for dairy cows. She traveled great distances to find pasture for her animals, and also learned the production technique to make bran, which basically consists of gathering specific reeds and preparing them with salt. "Caring for cattle has been a part of my whole life. I have to feed them, keep them warm, and care for them well, in order to have good milk production," Ruperta says.   

A while later, she learned cheese manufacturing, which is now part of her daily life and she divides her day between the two jobs. The necessities of her business can be summarized as acquiring fresh cow's milk to make cheese, and also to make a small amount of yogurt. 

Ruperta is constantly looking for growth to improve her quality of life and income. She wants to invest in dairy cows to increase her production and stop buying milk from other producers.

For this reason, Ruperta asks for a loan to purchase dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 67 años de edad, de estado civil casado tiene 2 hijos que viven en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona rural, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, pavos, desde hace varios años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales para engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Antonio is 67 years old, married with 2 children, who lives in the district of Nueva Arica, a rural area whose population works in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry, located in Chiclayo province, which belongs to Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú. 

He has worked raising and selling animals such as ducks, roosters, hens, chicks, and turkeys for a number of years.  His business in located in the back part of his home. He has asked Edypme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase more animals to fatten them and offer them for a better price.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to offer them to his customers

loans.name: Douglas Mauricio

texts.es: Douglas, es casado con 2 hijos a su cargo, a los que le está brindando la ayuda necesaria para su desarrollo académico, actualmente tiene la necesidad de un financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de pacas de pantalones de hombre, niño, blusas, short, sabanas, camisas, chaquetas, buzos  por tal motivo visito las oficinas de ceprodel para ser beneficiado y poder lograr el objetivo percibido y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar, agradeciéndole a  ceprodel y a los inversionistas por lo oportuno de crédito y por el apoyo que le bridan a estos sectores que tanto necesitan para poderse desarrollar.
texts.en: Douglas is married with two children in his care, to whom his is offering the necessary help for their schooling. At the moment he needs a loan to use it to purchase bundles of men's and children's pants, blouses, shorts, sheets, shirts, jackets, and track suits.  This motivated him to visit CEPRODEL's offices to have the benefit and be able to achieve the objective he sees, and in this way improve his family's quality of life. He thanks CEPRODEL and the lenders for the timely loan and for the help they offer to those areas that need is so much to be able to develop themselves.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of men's and children's pants, blouses, shorts, sheets, shirts, jackets, and track suits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata, une dame de 33 ans, s’active dans le commerce et la coiffure depuis des années. Elle a démarré d’abord avec la coiffure il y a 10 ans de cela avec un capital de 75 000f qui lui a été donné par son époux. Elle a développé son capital et 7 ans après a pu démarrer un commerce de tissus et divers. Elle a bénéficié une fois d’un crédit à l’IMCEC et ce renouvellement lui permettra d’acheter des tissus teints, de l’encens, du savon, pour revendre. Aminata est active de 8h à 13h et l’après-midi, elle se consacre à sa famille. Car elle est mariée, mère de 2 enfants dont l’ainé, un garçon, est âgé de 6 ans et va à l’école maternelle et le plus petit, âgé de 3 ans. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et appui son époux dans les autres charges de la maison.
Aminata désire avoir sa propre maison et un magasin de vente de tissus pour maximiser son profit.
texts.en: Aminata, who is 33 years old, has been a retailer and a hairdresser for years. She started her hairdressing business 10 years ago with 75 000 francs given to her by her husband. She built up her working capital and was able to start a business selling fabrics and other items 7 years later. She has benefited from one loan from UIMCEC and this new loan will enable her to buy dyed fabrics, incense and soap for resale. Aminata works from 8 in the morning to 1 in the afternoon and spends the rest of her afternoons taking care of her family. She is married and the mother of two children, the eldest of whom, a boy, is 6 years old and goes to primary school, and the youngest of whom is 3 years old. She contributes towards the daily expenses and supports her husband with the other household expenses. Aminata would like to have her own house and a shop in which to sell fabrics so that she can maximise her profits.

loans.use: to buy buy dyed fabrics, incense and soap for resale.

loans.name: Mericia

texts.es:
Mericia es una señora de 35 años, madre soltera que ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos que viven con ella actualmente, habitan en un pequeño recinto llamado San José de las Juntas, perteneciente a Santo Domingo de los Colorados, un sector muy cálido y caracterizado porque en esta zona se produce mucho plátano para exportación.
Mericia es una madre ejemplar, ha trabajado mucho para sacar a sus pequeños adelante, realiza cualquier trabajo digno por llevar el alimento a su hogar; actualmente tiene un bar escolar, donde prepara comida y vende confites a los niños del establecimiento, además de esto ella realiza la limpieza en la escuela y los padres de familia la han contratado para que prepare el desayuno escolar porque tiene una buena sazón y también por poder ayudarle a la señora con sus ingresos, ya que es una madre de bajos recursos.
Mericia tiene una pequeña casa propia, donde también cría pocos chanchitos, esta es otra fuente de ingreso ya que lo del bar no le alcanza, ella ve la forma de salir adelante por eso trabaja muy duro; ya que Mericia se separó de su conyugue hace varios años por la irresponsabilidad.
Mericia acudió a la institución por referencias de un hermano que es excelente cliente en Fundación Alternativa, Mericia con el crédito que recibió podrá comprar confitería y comida para el bar además le alcanzará para comprará unos lechones y poder criarlos para venderlos.
Se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que la ha dado la institución para su crecimiento en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mericia is a 35 year old woman, a single mother who has gotten ahead with her three children who currently live with her. They live in a small neighborhood called San José de las Juntas, which is part of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a very warm area and characterized by this area which produces many bananas for export. 

Mericia is a model mother, she has worked a lot to get her little ones ahead.  She does whatever decent work she can in order to bring food to the home. At the moment she has a food stall at a school, where she prepares food and sells candies to the children at the school, in addition she does the cleaning in the school and parents of the children have contracted her to prepare school breakfast because it is very good and also to be able to help her with the income, since she is a low-income mother. 

Mericia has a small house of her own where she also raises pigs. This is another source of income since the food stall is not enough. She sees the way to get ahead through very hard work, since Mericia separated from her partner several years ago for irresponsibility.

Mericia turned to the institution on the referral of her brother who is an excellent client of Fundación Alternativa. Mericia, with the loan that she received, will be able to purchase cstandandies and food for the stall and in addition she will purchase some piglets to raise them for sale.

She is very grateful for the support that the institution has given her to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase candies and foods

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, age 54, sells dried fish to earn a living. She has been engaged in this enterprise for 15 years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She and her husband have seven children, one of whom is still in school. 

Marivic has requested a PhP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy dried fish to offer for sale.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Cristóbal Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Cristóbal  vive en la linda ciudad de Matagalpa con su amada familia, Cristóbal tiene 49 años de edad, dos hijos en edad escolar se caracteriza por ser trabajador y de muy buenos principios cristianos.

Cristóbal se desempeña como soldador en una empresa de agua potable desde hace tres años. Anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de ropa variada pero luego se le presento la oportunidad laboral en esta empresa y fue ahí donde aprendió a  ejercer este oficio de soldador metalúrgico, el cual se siente motivado y comprometido con su trabajo ya que con los ingresos obtenidos provee para el sustento diario de su familia.

El préstamo financiado lo utilizara para mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que lo destinara para comprar piso cerámica para darle mejor condición a su vivienda. El señor agradece por haberle otorgado este préstamo ya que es el segundo y con el anterior fue de mucha importancia porque mejoro parte de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cristóbal lives in the lovely city of Matagalpa with his beloved family. Cristóbal is 49 years old, has two school-aged children, and can be characterized as being hard working and having very good Christian principles.

Cristóbal has worked as a welder at a drinking water company for the past three years. Previously he worked selling a variety of clothing, but later the opportunity arose to work at this business and he went there to learn this job of metal welding. He feels motivated by and dedicated to his work since the income he gets provides his family's daily sustenance.

The financed loan will be used to improve his house since it will purchase a tile floor to improve the condition of his house. He is grateful to have been offered this loan since it is his second and the previous one was very important because he improved part of his house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a tile floor

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa, mariée et mère de 2 enfants évolue dans le domaine du commerce depuis 2005. Awa a démarré avec un capital de 75 000f en vendant du jus de fruit à cette période. Quelques temps après, elle est entrée dans la vente et la transformation de céréales locales : mil, maïs. Elle est active de 10h du matin au soir, tout le temps de préparer les produits et d’aller le revendre dans l’après-midi.
Awa est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Ils sont pris en charge par son époux. Elle n’a aucune dépense sinon ses propres besoins. Grâce aux crédits antérieurs, obtenus à l’IMCEC, elle a pu effectuer des travaux de réfection dans sa maison. Madame désire diversifier son activité en faisant de la vente de bois de chauffe.
