texts.en: Awa is married and the mother of 2 children. She has been a retailer since 2005. Awa started her business, at the time selling fruit juice, with 75 000 francs worth of working capital. A bit later, she started growing and selling local cereals (millet and maize). She works from 10 in the morning until the evening, preparing her produce in the morning and selling it in the afternoon. Awa is married and the mother of two children who are financially supported by her husband. She has no expenses other than her own. Thanks to previous loans obtained from UIMCEC, she has been able to get some repair work done on her house. Awa would like to diversify her business and also sell firewood.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser with which to cultivate millet and groundnuts.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient finances to buy farm inputs. She is the single mother of one child. She describes herself as truthful and honest. 

This is Jane's third loan through SMEP Microfinance Bank. She has successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use her current Kes 110,000 loan funds to buy farm inputs. This will enable her to increase her farm production. 

She hopes that in the future, her business will be an increasingly stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a widowed woman. She has two children, and describes herself as being determined. She operates a retail business where she sells groceries, and has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of groceries. She hopes that she can buy a pickup in the future. This is her 12th loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the needed spare parts of her vehicle for rent. She also used it in her tailoring business and in making peanut butter. Her loan was useful not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income is assisting her family's everyday household expenditures, and she and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

Elizabeth would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her tailoring business. She will also use the loan for the maintenance of her van and in buying peanut butter ingredients. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old and married to Griffin; they are blessed with three children ages 18, 13 years and ten months. She has been selling fish in this business for the last 17 years and earns an income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	
She is now servicing her first loan of 15,000 KES from ‘VisionFund Kenya' and intends to use this amount to buy more stock of fish to sell to her customers.

The profit she earns will be used to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and own a fish farm.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Necia

texts.en:
Necia is 48 years old and married with one child.

Necia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Necia has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Necia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Talaye

texts.en:
Talaye is a 57-year-old widow. She has three sons and one of them is married.

Talaye has been planting and selling decorative plants and trees at her house for four years to help her children cover their needs. She even bought a number of pots to plant different types of plants.

Now Talaye has applied for this loan in order to buy new saplings to plant in hanging pots in order to raise her profits.

loans.use: to buy new saplings and flower seeds for planting hanging plants

loans.name: Germán Coronado

texts.es:
El señor Germán vive en la hermosa ciudad de Matagalpa, está casado  tiene 48 años de edad, este señor es muy trabajador que lucha para sacar a sus dos hijos adelantes y darles una buena educación.

Germán trabaja para una empresa  una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado se desempeña como fontanero desde hace cuatro años. Su trabajo consiste en instalar sistema de potable y servicio sanitario, este  oficio lo aprendió con unos amigos que lo capacitaron ya hora es de gran importancia ya que obtuvo la oportunidad de trabajo en este empresa de acueducto.

El crédito que se le otorgo  lo utilizara para comprar materiales de construcción tales como cemento y ladrillos, ya que cuenta con otra parte de materiales  para ampliar y mejorar su vivienda. El señor Germán agradece a kiva por brindarle este crédito que es de mucha importancia para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que con este podrá darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Germán lives in the lovely city of Matagalpa, is married and 48 years old. He is very hard working and fights to get his two children ahead and give them a good education. 

Germán has worked at an aqueduct and sewer business as a plumber for the past four years.  His work consists of installing systems of clean water and sanitary systems.  He learned this line of work from his friends who trained him and it is very important since he got the opportunity to work at this aqueduct business.

The loan that was offered him will be used to purchase construction material such as cement and bricks, since he has some other materials to expand and improve his house. Germán thanks Kiva for offering him this loan that is very important for the improvement of his house since, with it, he will be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and brick.

loans.name: Marvin Ignacio

texts.es:
Marvin es un joven de 24 años de edad  vive en la linda ciudad de Matagalpa está acompañado tiene un hermoso hijo que está a cargo de él, Marvin es un joven que lucha por sacar adelante con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo a su bella familia.

El joven Marvin trabaja como fontanero en una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado, desde hace seis años. Desde muy pequeño aprendió este oficio con su familia el cual ha sido de mucha importancia ya que con este trabajo provee para el sustento de su familia.

El monto que se le otorgo lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción  tales como piedra cantera cemento y madera para mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que tiene planeado ampliar un cuarto de habitación, a la misma vez agradece a kiva por el financiamiento brindado ya que podrá dar mejor condición a su familia.
texts.en:
Marvin is a 24-year-old young man who lives in the lovely city of Matagalpa. He is partnered and has a beautiful son in his care. Marvin is a young man who fights to get his beautiful family ahead with a lot of work and effort. 

Young Marvin has worked as a plumber in an aqueduct and sewer company for the past six years. Since he was very young, he learned this line of work from his family which has been very important because the work provides his family's sustenance.

The amount that he was given will be used to purchase construction materials such as quarry stone, cement and wood to improve his house since he has a plan to expand the living room and also he is grateful to Kiva for the offered funding since he will be able to provide better conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as quarry stone, wood and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her degree title in industrial engineering.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Ibrahima est boulanger de profession et exerce le métier depuis 1996. Il travaille de 21h à 2h du matin pour la préparation du pain. En plus de cela, il possède un champ au village natal qu’il exploite chaque année. Il est à sa première expérience de crédit ; un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des semences d’arachide et de mil et de l’engrais.
Ibrahima est marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’ainé, âgé de 6 ans est une fille et le plus petit n’a que 1 an. Il paie sa location et nourrit sa famille grâce à son revenu salarial. 
En temps que jeune, Ibrahima aimerait avancer dans sa vie, voire voyager à l’extérieur pour » faire fortune «.
texts.en: Ibrahima has been working as a baker since 1996.  He works from 9 in the evening until 2 in the morning baking bread. As well as his baking job, he owns a field in the village which he uses to cultivate produce every year. This is his first loan, a loan which will enable him to buy groundnut and millet seeds and fertiliser. Ibrahima is married and the father of 3 children, the eldest of whom is a 6-year-old girl and the youngest, a one-year-old boy. He pays his rent and feeds his family thanks to his income. A young man, Ibrahima would like to move forward in life by going abroad to "make his fortune."

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru: Эту девушку зовут Мукадас. Она предоставляет услуги парикмахера и работает в салоне красоты более 3 лет. Мукадас молодая и еще незамужняя девушка в возрасте 20 лет, проживающая вместе с матерью в городе Душанбе. После того, как Мукадас окончила школу, она начала свою профессиональную деятельность в области парикмахерского дела. Она научилась этому делу у своей тети. Несмотря на молодой возраст Мукадас очень опытный парикмахер. Клиентки всегда остаются довольными ее услугами. Сейчас Мукадас решила расширить свое дело. Она нуждается в кредите для купли необходимых рабочих инструментов в салон. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: This young woman is named Mukadas. She is a hairdresser and has worked in a beauty salon for over three years. She is 20 years old, unmarried, and lives with her mother in the city of Dushanbe. After she graduated from high school, she began a career as a hairdresser, which she learned from her aunt. In spite of her young age, Mukadas is a very experienced hairdresser. Her clients are always happy with her services. Mukadas decided to expand her business and needs a loan to purchase necessary supplies for the salon. She hopes for support.

loans.use: to purchase necessary supplies for a salon

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself as being determined. She operates a retail business where she sells vitenge (African garment), and has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of vitenge. She hopes that in the future, she will own a piece of land. This is her seventh loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vitenge (African garment).

loans.name: Sheillah

texts.en:
Sheillah is a 26-year-old married woman who supports a family of three children and her husband adds an additional income to cater and look out for the well-being of his family. Sheillah has been operating a transportation business and selling ready-made clothes for five years now, earning an income of KES 4,000.

Sheillah is now servicing her second loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya, and she intends to use this amount to to add to her savings to buy an additional taxi to facilitate her business. 

She plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and build a permanent house for their family. She hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy an additional taxi

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro está casado, tiene 53 años de edad,vive  en la ciudad de Estelí con su amada esposa y 4 hijos que están a su cargo, es un señor muy humilde y de buenos principios.

El señor Teodoro trabaja para una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado se desempeña como fontanero desde hace ocho años, su función es instalar el sistema de agua potable brindándole mantenimiento y reparación a la tubería potable.

Este es su cuarto crédito y manifiesta que los anteriores han sido de gran importancia ya que ha comprado algunos electrodomésticos para su hogar y ha mejorado parte de su vivienda
El monto otorgado lo ha destinado para comprar materiales de construcción como zinc, perlin y cemento.

Teodoro le da las gracias a Kiva por darle este préstamo y su ayuda en otras ocasiones ya que es su cuarto crédito que le ha servido para ampliar y mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en:
Teodoro is married, 53 years old, and lives in the city of Estelí with his beloved wife and 4 children who are in his care.  He is a very humble man and has good principles. 

Teodoro has worked for an aqueduct and sewer company as a plumber for the past eight years. His job is to install the drinking water system offering maintenance and repair for the clean water plumbing. 

This is his fourth loan and he says that the previous ones have been very important since he has bought some household appliances for his home and has improved part of his house. The granted amount will be used to purchase construction materials such as zinc, purlins, and cement. 

Teodoro thanks Kiva for giving him this loan and for its help in other occasions since this is his fourth of loans that have served to expand and improve his home's condition.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as zinc, cement, and purlins

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan está casado  tiene 45 años de edad  vive en la  ciudad de Matagalpa, ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua una zona productiva de café. Juan se caracteriza por ser un hombre honrado, honesto y responsable con su familia.

Este es su cuarto crédito manifiesta que los anteriores han sido de gran impacto en su familia por que ha mejorado su vivienda.

Actualmente  Juan se desempeña como fontanero en una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado desde hace seis años su trabajo consiste en instalar sistema potable y sanitario, anteriormente se dedicaba a la producción de café pero dada la situación que su familia emigro a la ciudad  tubo que cambiar de actividad económica.
Con el nuevo financiamiento lo va destinar para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, piedrín y arena para realizar mejora en su vivienda. Juan agradece a Kiva por este apoyo que le brinda ya que esta manera están aportando al desarrollo de la familia más pobre de Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Juan is married. He is 45 years old and lives in the city of Matagalpa, in the north of Nicaragua, in the coffee producing region. Juan is an honest man, and responsible with his family.

This is Juan's fourth loan. Juan tells us that previous loan have had a great impact on his family and he has been able to make improvements to his home.

Juan has been working as a plumber for at a sewage company for six years. This work consists of installing running water and lavatories. Previously Juan worked growing coffee but, due to family circumstances, Juan and his family moved to the city and had to change job.

This new loan will be used to buy building materials (small stones and sand) in order to make improvements to his home. Juan is grateful to Kiva for this support. With this loan Juan can continue to help his poor Nicaraguan family to progress.

loans.use: to buy building materials (small stones and sand).

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en:
Kamran, age 30, operates a store where he sells cleaning products. He is from the city of Khodjavand, but he is an Internally Displaced Person and lives with his wife and two small children in the Baku region. Both of the children are enrolled in school. 

Today Kamran has applied to Komak for a loan in the amount of 1,000 AZN in order to buy more products to offer for sale in his store. 

He is thankful to Kiva and his lenders for the aid and support.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials, such as bricks, sand and cement, to build a wastewater sump.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 63 years old and is married with three children. For the past nine years, she has been running a fishing business in the Philippines. Jesusa is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Jesusa is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a laptop

loans.name: Cicily

texts.en:
Cicily is a married woman with three children. She works as a farmer growing crops. Cicily describes herself as honest and states that her biggest business challenge is the lack of finances to buy farm inputs. 

Cicily is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. This will be her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Cicily repaid her previous loans successfully. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Santos Ángel

texts.es:
Santos de 32 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes principios que lo hacen  una persona muy respetada  en su comunidad, además trabaja en el campo como agricultor,  los fines de semana se dedica al comercio a la venta de helados en la cancha de su comunidad; ya que los fines de semana se realizan encuentros deportivos y es donde aprovecha para vender helados a la afición de ambos equipos.

Santos se creció junto a sus padres quienes fueron personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que le formaron y enseñaron a cultivar la tierra, su familia formada por sus padres y sus 3 hermanos siendo él el mayor de todos a quien le tocaba  ayudar en los trabajos del campo junto a sus padres,  para ayudar  a satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. 

Su nivel de estudio es de tercer grado, asistía por las tardes porque en la mañana la tarde ayudaba a sus padres en el campo, al transcurrir el tiempo, cuando ya era un joven conoció a su querida esposa, con cual se acompañó desde entonces él se dedica a la agricultura y venta de helados los fines de semana.


El dinero será utilizado para la compra de una vaca en estado de gestación la cual comenzara a cuidar hasta que tenga la cría,  de esta forma aprovechara la leche que producirá y su esposa se dedicara a la venta de lácteos, de esta manera tendrán un mejor ingreso y una mejor nutrición para su familia.

Las proyecciones que el cliente tiene a futuro son las de tener un negocio más fuerte que le permita dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes,  y apoyar en la educación de su hijo hasta que sea un profesional,  tener una casa con todas las comodidades  y que le garantice una vivienda digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 32 years old and a person with excellent principles. These principles make Santos very well-respected in his community. Santos works as a farmer. At the weekend he also has a business selling ice creams at the local sport fields. He does this at the weekend as then people do sports; Santos takes advantage to sell ice cream to fans of both teams.

Santos grew up with his parents, who were very poor and hard-working. They taught him to work the land. Santos' family consists of his parents and three siblings. Santos is the eldest child and so he had to help his parents with the work in the fields. He did this in order to help look after household necessities.

Santos completed up to third grade at school. He went to school in the afternoons because he worked with his parents in the morning. As a young man, Santos met his dear wife. Since then the couple has worked together in farming and selling ice creams.

This loan will be used to buy a pregnant cow which he will look after until the birth. By doing this, Santos can milk the cow, which his wife will use for making diary products. This will give the couple a higher income and better nutrition for the family.

In the future, Santos wants to to have a stronger business so that he can offer his customers better service. He wants to support his son's education so that he may have a profession. Santos also wants to have a comfortable house and to guarantee his family a decent place to live.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow which he will look after until the birth.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 27 years old and she lives with her retired grandparents in an unbelievably nice city, Dilijan, which is rich with nature. This beautiful and stylish lady has a specialty in psychology and since 2011, she has worked at a social organization as a psychologist. Inga’s parents and brother live and work in Ukraine and from time to time Inga visits them there. 

As she says, the house where she lives with her grandparents needed repairing (which they did already), and also furnishing. Inga wants to start with her sleeping room. Inga asks for a loan in an amount of 500,000 Armenian Drams to buy nice furniture for her sleeping room.

loans.use: to buy nice furniture for her sleeping room.

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en:
Tahani is 29-year-old married woman who lives in Zarqa, Jordan. She is a mother of one son and one daughter.

A year agp, Tahani started tailoring clothes in her home, depending on her customers' demands, in order to help with the family income and to cover her children's needs. Now she is seeking a youth loan to buy materials such as fabric and thread for her project in order to work more and raise her profits.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Larena

texts.en:
Larena is 27 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. For the past three years, she has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. Larena is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Larena is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Sheila is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as capable. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics . She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy stock of cosmetics. Her business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Delia would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better, and more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Delia hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams to have a comfortable life. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi sells fish to earn an income. She sells from her home to restaurant operators and to passers-by. Her primary business challenge is seasonality.

Mwanamisi is divorced and has been blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. The family lives in a house with neither electricity nor piped water.

With her Kshs 20,000 loan funds, she intends to purchase bundles of fish to offer for sale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a married woman with eight children. She is 45 years old and three of her children are in school. 

Magdalena is a very hardworking entrepreneur, and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Magdalena requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for four years. In the future, Magdalena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gathoni

texts.en:
Gathoni is a married woman with seven children. She operates a farm and grows crops. Gathoni describes herself as determined and states that her biggest business challenge is the lack of finances to buy farm inputs. 

Gathoni is requesting an 80,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs to enable her increase farm production. This will be her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid her previous loans successfully. Gathoni hopes that her life will improve in the future.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Concepcion works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vulcanizing. Concepcion is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anadela

texts.en:
Anadela is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anadela is 30 years old and both of her children are in school.

Anadela has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Anadela requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Anadela has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Anadela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of two and lives in Msambweni. She sells green groceries, and is helped by her family. Mwanakombo is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

Mwanakombo always struggles to improve her grocery stall by trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has operated a tailoring business to earn a living and support her family. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Fatuma dreams of establishing a tailoring school in the near future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima, age 30, operates a mini-market business out of her home to earn a living. She has been engaged in her business for three years. She lives with her husband and family in Salt-Jordan. The family consists of five members.
 
She is currently seeking a youth loan to improve her home mini-market by adding new and different merchandise. 

She seeks to open an independent mini-market in the future.

loans.use: to add new and different merchandise to her home mini-market

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es: Dina Es una laboriosa mujer que a partir de sus ventas de quesos ha logrado tener una independencia económica de su esposo y ya no depende tanto de los recursos que este genere en el hogar por el contrario el ayuda aportando capital para las deudas y le queda dinero para sus propios gastos y mejora del negocio por eso Dina siempre busca alternativas y maneras de hacer de su empresa más productiva y beneficiosa para ella buscando un horizonte de poder empelar personas y ayudar a tantas familias de pocos recursos de su sector, en su producción de quesos se ha encontrado con inconvenientes en la producción y es que le toca realizarlos de forma empírica lo que demora mucho sus procesos, pro ello quiere solicita un crédito para la compra de implementos de trabajo buscando recortar los periodos de producción lo que harán más productiva su empresa
texts.en: Dina is a hard-working woman who from her cheese sales has managed to have economic independence from her husband and now doesn't depend so much on the resources that he generates in the home, on the contrary she helps him giving capital for the debts and there is money left for her own expenses and to improve her business. For this, Dina always looks for alternatives and ways to make her business more productive and beneficial for her, looking in the future to be able to employ people and help the many families with limited resources in her area. In her cheese production, she has encountered inconveniences in the production in that she has to to it in an empirical way, which slows the process down a lot. So, she wants to ask for a loan to purchase tools for her work to cut the production time which will, in turn, make her business more productive.

loans.use: to purchase implements and tools with which she can cut production times.

loans.name: Rene Alberto

texts.es: Rene tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 10 años y 5 años de edad. Rene es un hombre trabajador quien se trabaja como albañil y además presta servicios de albañilería. Rene dese construir dos cuartos dormitorios para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, lámina galvanizada, madera, etc.
texts.en: Rene is 30 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their two children, 10 and 5 years old. Rene is a hard-working man who works as a construction assistant and in addition, hires out as a construction worker. Rene wants to build two bedrooms, for which he asks FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of cement, sand, bricks, galvanized metal sheeting, wood, etc.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, galvanized metal sheeting, wood, etc. to construct two bedrooms.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables for her kids.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business and there is competition as well. 

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino es una persona de 50 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura.
 

Anteriormente él solicito un crédito para adquirir un caballo, hoy lo esta haciendo para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y demás  insumos para completar sus trabajos agrícolas, de esta forma tendrá una mejor producción, podrá dar a su familia el sustento diario y podrá vender parte de su cosecha para cumplir con sus compromisos crediticios con la institución.  
   
Las proyecciones de Saturnino son las de diversificar sus cultivos y adquirir otro préstamo para comenzar a trabajar con hortalizas; ya que ha estado recibiendo una serie de capacitaciones enfocadas en ente tipo de cultivos y pretende para este siguiente año comenzar a trabajar en hortalizas de esta manera tendrá un mejor ingreso económico el cual le ayudara a solventar responsablemente sus compromisos crediticios con la institución.
texts.en:
Saturnino is 50 years old and works in agriculture.
 
Previously, he asked for a loan to get a horse. Today he is doing it to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other supplies to complete his agricultural work, in this way he will have a better production, give his family daily sustenance, and sell part of his harvest to meet his loan commitments with the institution. 

Saturnino's projects are to diversify his crops and get another loan to begin to work with vegetables, since he has been getting a series of training sessions focused on this kind of crop and plans this coming year to work with vegetables. In this way he will have more income which will help him to responsibly pay is loan commitments with the institution.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other supplies to complete his agricultural work.

loans.name: Kafedha

texts.en:
Kafedha is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 10 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer to help him in completing his work

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widow who lost her husband after he suffered from illness for a longtime. She is a mother of four children, one school-aged and the rest  grown. She is in her late 50s and lives with her children. She depends on her mama lishe (a small restaurant or cafe) business to raise income for her family life. Fatuma has ten years experience with her business and is able to make a good profit each month. She works from 7:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second credit request. With her previous loan, Fatuma replenished her store of food cooking ingredients (especially rice, beans, sugar, maize and baking flour). She has paid back successfully her loan. She had a fridge but it is now broken, so she can't sell cold drinks to her food customers. She plans to use part of this credit to buy a freezer. She will also use part of it to buy food ingredients like rice, maize and baking flour, vegetables, sugar, and other items. Her ambition is to greatly expand her business and make a better life for her family. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Muheza," which consist of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and  food ingredients such as rice, maize and baking flour, vegetables, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en:
To pay for the college tuition fee of her daughter, Pascuala wants to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 15,000. 

Pascuala is married to a farmer. While her husband is busy managing their farm, Pascuala is taking care of her hogs. The couple is working hard to provide for the needs of their two children, especially with regard to their education. 

Joyce, Pascuala’s daughter, will be enrolling to her first year in college. Since college education is costly, Pascuala will be very happy if her requested loan is granted. Joyce is taking a BS in Business Administration in Isabela State University. She believes that poverty is not a hindrance to achieving her dreams.

loans.use: To pay for the college tuition fee of her daughter.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Carmen works hard to support her family.

She has a soft drinks retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Carmen is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of soft drinks to sell to customers.

Carmen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mario De Jesús

texts.es:
Mario de 33 años de edad, nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar fertilizantes y otros insumos agrícolas ya que  la época de  invierno ya empezó, y las personas aprovechan para cultivar la tierra y de esta forma almacenar las cosechas para el consumo. De esta manera, podrá dar una mejor seguridad alimentaria y nutricional a su familia. 


Las proyecciones de Mario son las de inculcar buenos principios morales a sus hijos, servir en su comunidad como miembro de la asociación de desarrollo comunal e impulsar el desarrollo en su comunidad mediante la organización de los miembros, apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mario, 33 years old, again asks for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other agricultural supplies since winter has already begun, and people take advantage of this to plant the fields and in this way accumulate their harvests for consumption. In this way, he will be able to provide more food and nutritional security for his family. 

Mario's plans are to teach good moral principles to his children, serve in the community as a member of the communal development association and boost the development of his community through organizing its members, and to support his children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other agricultural supplies since winter has already begun.

loans.name: Simon Edilson

texts.es: Con el sueño de tener una granja el señor se Simón se levanta cada día a observar y alimentar sus aves pues en ellas deposita su fe de progreso, aprovecho un terreno que tenía en su casa e inicio empíricamente con el negocio, demostrando tener actitudes de emprendedor y de vendedor, buscando progresar y consolidad sus animales en el mercado Simón solicita una ayuda crediticia la cual usara para la construcción de un criadero de pollos con sus respectivos animales aumentando su inventario y generando mayores ventas pues tendrá más aves que ofertar, buscando siempre una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia
texts.en: With the dream of having a farm, Simón gets up every day to watch and feed his birds, since in them he puts his faith in progressing. He took advantage of the land that he had in his house and began experimentally with the business, demonstrating the attitudes of entrepreneur and salesperson, seeking progress and strengthening his animals in the market. Simón asks for a loan which he will use to build a chicken coop with is respective animals, increasing his inventory and generating more sales, since he will have more birds to offer, always looking for a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to build a chicken coop and purchase animals to fill it, improving his offerings to his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, stones and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is engaged in farming and animal husbandry to earn an income. She lives in the village of Gandzaqar in the Tavush region with her husband, her mother, two sons, and two daughters. Another son of Roza lives in Russian Federation and tries hard to support his family financially. Moreover, two of their children are teenagers, and Roza's mother is an 86-year-old pensioner, so only three family members are fully engaged in agricultural activities. 

Roza and her husband have been engaged in farming and animal husbandry for many years. They cultivate potatoes and corn, breed cattle and hens, and keep 30 bee colonies. 

With a very good credit history, Roza has now applied for a loan of USD 1,300. The requested amount will be used to purchase a UAZ vehicle, which will be used to improve the farm's overall effectiveness. 

This large family tries really hard to make ends meet. Let's support them in sustaining their agribusiness and growing it further. They heartily appreciate any kind of help their lenders may offer.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural machinery in the form of a UAZ vehicle

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has three children who are in school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and fees for her children.

For over four years she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Mwanamisi dreams of establishing a boutique in the near future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira lives with her family in the village Vahagni in the Lori region. Naira is a student of Vanadzor State University at the faculty of Management. She is 31 yaers old and she is on her fourth year of distance learning. Simultaneously she works at the village municipality as chief of staff. Naira is an active, hardworking woman who also does farming. In her farm she has two cows, three heifers, two calves and beehives. With her all workload, she manages all and everything, even the care of her two pretty daughters.

She is married and she lives with her husband, children and parents-in-law. Her husband works at the stone workshop.
 
Naira needs this loan, since she needs to mow hay from their hay fields, to rent a truck for its transfer and also to rent a place for its storage, since farmers always store large amount of hay for their cattle beforehand, no matter that winter cold season is still so far.

loans.use: to mow hay from their hay fields, to rent a truck for its transfer and also to rent a place for its storage.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a conservative lady, so her husband is in the picture instead of her. 

Nelly is a 59-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in Madaba, Jordan.

She and her husband have an accessories and cosmetics shop that her husband is managing. Nelly is seeking a loan to help in improving their shop by adding new products and paying the rental fees for the shop.

loans.use: To improve the shop by adding new products to resell and paying the rental fee for the shop.

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a 31-year-old-married woman who lives with her family in Madaba, Jordan.

She has an eggs incubator that helps her to produce chickens and sell them. This business helps her support her husband in paying their household fees. 

Now she is seeking a loan to buy a bigger incubator machine to increase the production and so the family income.

loans.use: To buy a bigger incubator for her business.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгуль 33 года,замужем, имеет 3 детей. Все дети несовершеннолетнего возраста. У Назгуль среднее образование, животноводством занимается с 1997 года. Стартовав с 6,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день в её хозяйстве есть 1 лошадь, 3 коровы, 4 теленка и 25 овец. Также Назгуль занимается полеводством, выращивая клевер и кукурузу. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец для увеличения поголовья скота и получаемой прибыли от бизнеса. Доходы от кредита Назгуль планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства, намерена приобрести автомобиль, а также начать строительство дома для сына.
texts.en: Nazgul is 33 years old and the mother of three children who are still minors.  Nazgul has a secondary education and she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1997.  She started in this business with an initial capital of 6,000 som (KGS) and now owns one horse, three cows, four calves and 25 head of sheep.  Nazgul also cultivates crops, growing clover and corn.  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the Bai Tushum and Partners bank and requested a loan of 135,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy some calves and sheep in order to increase her cattle headcount and to make her business more profitable.  Nazgul is planning to use the earnings from her loan to develop her farming business.  She would also like to buy a car and to start building a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy young bulls and sheep.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy additional merchandise products for her direct selling business. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rebecca hopes to be successful in her business and dreams to have a peaceful life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: José Fidel

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, es una persona muy conocida y respetada en la comunidad por su  alta voluntad de servicio a los demás,  es una persona con buenos principios morales, él se creció con sus padres y sus abuelos quienes se encargaron de inculcarle los buenos valores que son los que hoy en día lo han llevado a salir adelante y a ser una persona de bien y de éxito.

 El señor realizo sus estudios de educación básica en la escuela de la comunidad,  él estudiaba todos los días por la tarde,  ya que por las mañanas se dedicaba ayudar en las actividades agrícolas de su padre y su abuelo,  ya que en esa época fue su principal fuente de ingresos, y de esa forma podían satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar, con el paso del tiempo el señor José adquirió conocimiento y experiencia el manejo de granos básicos y fue de esa manera que se fue independizando y fue cuando conoció a  su esposa con quien decidió formar su hogar y concretar su vida  y son padres de 3 hijos de los que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.

El señor se dedica a la prestación de servicios de motorista e un autobús de trasporte público,  esta actividad la aprendió de su mejor amigo quien trabajaba en una unidad de transporte público y los fines de semana él lo acompañaba al viaje de la mañana y fue de esa manera que fue aprendiendo a conducir vehículos hasta que se convirtió en un profesional,  para realizar este trabajo y llevando a cabo esta actividad tiene 15 años que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado adquirir su propio vehículo y comenzó a prestar servicio de transporte de carga pesada, también posee una tienda en su casa administrada por su esposa.

El dinero será utilizado en mejoramiento y ampliación de su negocio de venta de granos básicos y gas propano y compra de 2 llantas traseras para su camión, de esta manera mejoraran sus ingresos y calidad de vida a su familia, y prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes de trasporte y tienda.

Las proyecciones que él tiene para su futuro son las de tener un camión moderno, de volteo para tener más facilidad de descarga, tener un negocio surtido el cual le permita extenderse hasta otra comunidad, ya que pretende implementar el servicio a domicilio para clientes.
texts.en:
José, 45 years old, is a person well-known and respected in his community for the his high level of good will and service to others. He is a person with good moral principles. He grew up with his parents and grandparents who took it on themselves to teach him good morals that are what today have carried him to get ahead and be a good and successful person.

He completed his basic education in the community school; he studied every afternoon, since in the mornings he worked helping his father and grandfather with the agricultural tasks, because at that time it was their primary source of income, and in this way they could meet the basic needs of the household. With the passing of time, José acquired knowledge and experience in managing basic grains and it was in this way that he became independent and when he met his wife, he decided to build a home and establish his life. They are the parents of three children who are students in the local school.

He works offering his services as a driver of a public transport bus. He learned this line of work from his best friend who worked in a public transport business and on the weekends he accompanied him on the morning trip and it was in this way that he learned to drive vehicles until he became a professional to do this job and he has carried it out for 15 years. With much effort and sacrifice he has managed to get his own vehicle and began to offer his services carrying cargo, and he also has a shop in his house, run by his wife. 

The money will be used to improve and expand the business of selling basic grains and propane gas and to purchase 2 rear tires for his truck, and in this way improve the family's income and quality of life, and to offer better service to the transport and shop customers. 

His plans for the future are to have a modern dump truck, to have a better means of unloading, to have a varied business which will allow him to extend himself to another community, since he plans to implement home delivery service to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains and propane gas to sell in his sotre and to purchase 2 rear tires for his truck

loans.name: Yudis Maritza

texts.es:
Yudis de 20 años de edad, es una joven muy dinámica, a ella le gusta participar en todos los eventos de la comunidad,  ya piensa en un futuro hogar. Es una persona muy respetuosa con las demás, eso la ha llevado a que las personas le guarden ese carisma y aprecio, ella aun  vive con sus padres,  además es muy reconocida por su forma de relacionarse con los demás. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos de cosmetología.

Estudio hasta octavo grado en una escuela del lugar de residencia,  siempre fue muy reconocida por sus aspiraciones de sobresalir y ser alguien en la vida con el dinero que saca de las ganancias ayuda a sus padres en la compra de medicamentos,  así como en el sostén de la comida y otras necesidades de su familia. 

Yudis tiene un negocio de venta de productos de cosmetología, trabajo que lo aprendió con una de sus amigas quien le enseño como distribuir los productos por orden de catálogo. De esta forma, continuo trabajando y motivada por los ingresos económicos. 

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de productos para la cosmetología,como tientes, pinta uñas, cremas, acondicionadores, aclarantes, etc.manifiesta que cada día la demanda crece  y las personas le encargan nuevos productos, esto le permitiría que venda otros productos, esto traerá mejores ingresos para ella y la de su familia, también su negocio que está ubicado en su casa pueda ir creciendo, esto suplirá la necesidad básicas.  


Los sueño son que su negocio crezca  día con día y ofrecerle el producto que las personas necesitan, ella manifiesta que cuando se case tener una familia muy organizada con muy buenos ingreso económicos.  Con el dinero que le presten lograra ampliar más su negocio, esto permitirá que su negocio se expanda con mayor eficiencia de acuerdo a las necesidades del cliente.
texts.en:
Yudis, 20 years old, is a very dynamic young woman. She likes to participate in all the community events, and already thinks about her future home. She is very respectful person, this has brought her to the point where other people appreciate this charisma.  She still lives with her parents, in addition she is very noted for her way of interacting with other people.  At the moment she works selling beauty products. 

She went to school up to the eighth grade at a school near where she lives. She was always known for her aspirations to improve herself and as someone who with the money that she earns helps her parents purchase medications, as well as being the support for the food and other family necessities.  

Yudia has a business selling beauty products, work that she learned from a friend who taught her how to distribute the catalog products. In this way, she continued working and was motivated by the income. 

The loan will be used to purchase beauty products such as dyes, nail polish, creams, conditioners, lightening creams, etc.  She says that the demand increases daily and that people ask for new products. This will permit her to sell other products and this will bring more income for herself and her family. Also, her business, which is located in her house, could continue growing. This will supply the basic needs. 

Her dreams are that her business grows daily, offering products that people need. She says that when she marries she wants to have a very organized family with very good income. With the money that is lent to her, she will be able to expand her business more, which will let her business grow with better efficiency according to the customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as dyes, nail polish, creams, conditioners, lightening creams, etc.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 40 years old. She is a widow left with two children of 14 years and 17 years. She sells clothes and tents, a business she has been doing for the last two years.

This is Fridah's first loan with VisionFund Kenya and is for KES 15,000, which she will use to purchase more tents and clothes for resale. Her current income is KES 24,000 per month.

With the profits from the loan, Fridah looks forward to expanding her business further as well as educating her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes and tents for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, sand, metal sheeting, etc. to build a latrine.

loans.name: Rosejean

texts.en:
Rosejean is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her through her previous loan, as she was able to buy the spare parts needed for her tricycle vehicle. Her loan helped her, not just in her business, but also in the education of her child. Her income is helping to sustain their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another PhP 25,000 loan so that she may buy spare parts and perform maintenance on the tricycle unit. Her increased profits  will significantly help her to meet her family's needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosejean dreams of owning more tricycle vehicles, and she hopes to give her child a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and perform maintenance on her tricycle vehicle

loans.name: Karima

texts.ru: Кариме 37 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 дочерей. Карима в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается торговлей трикотажных вещей на местном рынке, стартовав в 2010 году с суммы 50,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду, Карима на сегодняшний день имеет товар в обороте на сумму 380,000 сомов (KGS) и ежемесячную прибыль в размере 19,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Карима обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота, а именно покупку трикотажных изделий. Карима является лидером группы "Асылзат", всего в группе 4 участника. Карима уважаемый в группе человек, целеустремленна и имеет большой опыт в торговой деятельности. Доходы от кредита Карима планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы иметь возможность построить дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Karima is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three daughters.   She sells clothes at the market, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income.  She started in this business in 2010 with an initial capital of 50,000 som.  Thanks to Karima's very hard work, her total merchandise's turnover is worth 380,000 som (KGS) and she makes a monthly profit of 19,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to the Bai Tushum and Partners bank and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to increase her turnover through the purchase of more clothes.  Karima is the leader of a group named "Acylzat", which gathers four members.  Karima is a respected member of the group.  She is dedicated to her work and has a great experience in her business.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business, so that she can build a house for her family.

loans.use: to increase her turnover of clothes in her shop.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a single woman. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a grocery and vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000, Mejumaa wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman whose children all attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Saumu dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and cooking oil for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 41-year-old married man who lives with his family in Irbid, Jordan.

He is taking care of his two sons and two daughters. He started selling hot drinks two years ago. Then he started to sell traditional Arabic food (Humus and falafel).

And now Ahmad is seeking a loan to buy a big refrigerator to display the drinks and food in it and also he wants to add some decorations to the restaurant to make it more attractive. This will raise his profit that will help him cover his children's needs.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator where he can display cold drinks

loans.name: Luis Gabriel

texts.es:
Luis es un honesto respetuoso y soñador joven de 25 años de edad que ha entregado toda su vida al campo, disfrutando de esta profesión y ofreciendo su profesionalismo en beneficio de las personas que diariamente consumen sus animales, el oficio lo aprendió gracias a sus padres quien también se desempeñaron como agricultores y criadores de cerdos. El en especial se dedica a la cría de cerdos de engorde y gracias a estos animales ha podido sostener los gatos familiares y mantenerse en el tiempo.
Pero como persona emprendedora y llena de sueños quiere aspirar a una mejor estabilidad económica que le permita extender su actividad y poder mejorar sus ingresos, por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cerdos y alimento para los mismos.
Con este préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is an honest, respectful, and visionary 25-year-old young man who has given his whole life to the countryside, enjoying this profession and offering his professionalism to benefit the people who daily consume his animals. He learned this job thanks to his parents who also worked as farmers and raised pigs. He specifically works raising pigs for fattening and these animals have been able to sustain the family expenses and maintain them over time.

But, as an enterprising person, and full of dreams, he wants to aspire to better economic stability with permits him to expand his business and be able to increase his income. For this reason, he has asked for a loan to purchase pigs and feed for them.

With this loan he will have the opportunity to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Batma

texts.ru: Батма, 37 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. Батма в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается торговлей одеждой. Стартовав в 2013 году с суммы 30,000 сом, на сегодняшний день Батма имеет товар в обороте на сумму 150,000 сомов (KGS) и ежемесячную прибыль в размере 16,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Батма обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) для увеличение товарооборота, а именно покупку одежды. Батма является участником группы "Асылзат", всего в группе 4 участника. Доходы от кредита Батма планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, а также сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Batma is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She sells clothes and this activity constitutes her family's main source of income.  She started in this business in 2013 with an initial capital of 30,000 som.  Today, her merchandise's turnover is worth 150,000 som (KGS) and she makes a monthly profit of 16,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Batma has turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners bank and requested a loan of 40,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to increase her turnover through the purchase of clothes.  Batma is a member of a group named "Acylzat", which consists of four members.  She plans to reinvest the earnings from her loan and use them to further develop her business and to repair her house.

loans.use: to resell clothes.

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.es:
Melquiades es un hombre de 58 años de edad soltero y sin hijos.
Cuando fue niño terminó la escuela primaria, por razones económicas no pudo continuar la escuela secundaria y se dedicó a trabajar como ayudante de albañil; “el ayudante de albañil se ocupa de acarrear las piedras, la tierra, el cemento, etc., es el burro de carga de la construcción, yo realice esa labor por más de diez años y me gustaba la labor, el dinero me alcanzaba para todas mis necesidades”, comenta Melquiades.
Con el paso del tiempo se convirtió en albañil, construía muros, medía superficies, calculaba el material y tenía su ayudante que lo colaboraba en todo. No formó una familia porque viajaba mucho a nuevas construcciones y eso le impedía continuar una relación seria.
Melquiades es ahora contratista de obra se encarga de la contratación de personal para construcciones de todo tipo, albañiles, pintores, carpinteros, etc. Hace un par de años realizó la compra de un pequeño terreno donde construyó un par de cuartos que ahora son su hogar, el lugar por razones económicas no cuenta con conexión de agua potable, esto es un gran inconveniente para la salud y la vida diaria.
Es por ese motivo que Melquiades solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua para su vivienda y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Melquiades is a 58-year-old man who is single with no children.

When he was a child, he finished primary school and for economic reasons he couldn't continue into secondary school; he started working as a bricklaying assistant. "The bricklaying assistant works hauling the stones, the dirt, the cement, etc.  He is the workhorse of construction. I did this work for more than ten years and I liked the work, the money was sufficient for all my needs," said Melquiades.

With the passing of time, he became a bricklayer, built walls, half surfaces, calculated the material and needed an assistant to work with him in everything.  He didn't have a family because he traveled a lot to new construction sites and this prevented him from continuing a serious relationship.

Melquiades is now a contractor in charge of contracting the workers for all types of construction - bricklayers, painters, carpenters, etc.

A few years ago, he bought a small plot of land where he build a couple rooms that are now his home. For economic reasons, the place does not have a connection to clean water, which is a big inconvenience for health and daily life.

For this reason, Melquiades asks for a loan to install a water connection for his home and, in turn, to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to install a water connection to his house and, in turn, to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Mesalim is a single woman without kids, . She owns a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mesalim operates a vegetable stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 



With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is  married to Martin and together they are blessed with two children,17 and 14 years respectively.  Martin helps provide additional income for his family.

Isabella runs an Early Childhood Education School, a business she has done for the last six months.  She has requested a loan of KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase different school materials and equipment in order to facilitate a good environment for children's learning.

With the profits from the loan, Isabella wishes to expand her school further into becoming a private primary school.  This is a desire she looks forward to achieving in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase school materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand her chicken coop and bring it electrical energy to light it at night and to make sure they don't die from the cold.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 61 años de edad, ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos, y al comercio ya que es propietaria de una mini tienda en la comunidad y también se dedica al cuidado de su familia. Ella se creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban al comercio todos los días,  ya que tenían en su propia casa instalada una mini tienda
y también se dedicaba a los trabajos agrícolas y al cuido de ganado.  Ella realizo sus estudios de educación básica hasta 4 grado en la escuela de su comunidad, y no pudo continuar sus estudios porque su familia es de escasos recursos económicos, ella tenía que dedicarse a realizar las tareas domésticas de su casa, con el paso del tiempo decidió poner su propio negocio en el cual comenzó con venta de productos de primera necesidad y en la actualidad comercializa con productos de medicina natural y formo su propio hogar , es padre de una hija y un hijo quienes ya son mayores de edad y se dedican a trabajos agrícolas. 

Juana se dedica al comercio venta de productos de primera necesidad y productos medicinales naturales, expresa que tiene un experiencia de 15 años realizando esta actividad que fue producto de la enseñanza de sus padres los cuales dedicaron  mucho tiempo a realizarse en este negocio, y es el que en la actualidad ella realiza y se encuentra en mucha disposición ya que le motivan las ganancias que este mismo negocio le deja,  aparte de que no tiene que movilizarse a ningún lugar de trabajo ya que el negocio está montado en su casa, y de esta manera tiene tiempo para cuidar a sus familiares ya que sin lo más preciado que ella tiene.

El préstamo otorgado, será utilizado para invertirlo en ampliación y mejoramiento de su negocio ya que con el préstamo comprara un molino nixtamal para prestar servicio a las personas de la comunidad y otra parte será invertida  para surtir su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad y medicina natural. 

Las proyecciones que ella tiene para un futuro, son las de fortalecer su negocio de manera que le genere los ingresos suficientes para contratar a personas para facilitar el servicio a su clientes  y tener un local más amplio que le permita montar una venta de pupusas los días de semana por la tarde, con el beneficio que le brinda el préstamo utilizara las ganancias para invertir y mejorar su casa ampliar y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana is 61 years old, takes care of the household chores, and also works in business since she is the owner of a small store in the community and also works caring for her family. She grew up with her parents who worked as merchants every day, since they had a small store in their own house, and also worked in agriculture and animal husbandry.  She completed her basic education up to fourth grade in the local school and couldn't continue her education because her family had very limited economic resources. She had to work doing the household tasks. With the passing of time, she decide to open her own business which began with the sale of basic supplies and now sells natural medicines and made her own home. She is the parent of a daughter and a son who are now adults and work in agriculture.

Juana works selling basic supplies and natural medicines. She says that she has 15 years of experience in this field, which was taught to her by her parents who spent a long time in this business, and it is what she currently does and she finds she has a lot of willingness for this since the earnings from this business motivate her, apart from not having to go to another workplace since the business is in her house, and in this way she has time to care for her family since they are her most valued possession.

The granted loan will be used to invest in expanding and improving her business since the loan will purchase a corn (nixtamal) mill to serve the people in the community and another part will be invested in stocking the business with pantry products and natural medicines.

Her plans for the future are to strengthen her business in a way that generates sufficient income to hire people to serve the customers and to have a larger retail space which will allow her to sell pupusas on weekday afternoons.  With the benefit that this loan offers, she will use the earnings to invest and stock her business.

loans.use: to purchase a corn (nixtamal) mill and the other part will be invested to stock a business selling pantry supplies and natural medicine.

loans.name: Al Asdikaa1 Group

texts.en:
Amal is the featured representative of the Al Asdikaa1 group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been loyal friends, and they decided to put hands together to develop their family's living.

Amal is a 51-year-married mother of five, she works selling used clothes since four years ago, but she established her own business a year ago. Her husband works selling clothes too, but his business is mobile since he moves from one place to another to sell his merchandise.

Amal is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her current inventory of merchandise with a special summer collection, which will provide her growth and expansion in the future. Amal is the lady sitting in the middle, Najah is at the left side of the picture and Layla is at the right side of the picture.

loans.use: To increase her current inventory of merchandise with a special summer collection

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is 36-years-old. She supports six people in her family. She is married to Fabian who provides additional income for the family. Together they are blessed with four children who are between the ages of 16 years and 8 years.

Maurine sells fish, a business she has done for the past 16 years earning a monthly income of KES 18,000.  She has requested a loan of KES 15,000 which she will use to purchase more fish for resale.

With the profits from the loan Maurine will be able to buy a sheep as she has always desired to own one.

Maurine's future dream is that all her children will be educated for life. To add on to that, she desires to own a fish firm and rear her own fish.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Josina

texts.en:
Josina is 42 years old, married to Wycliffe, and blessed with three children, ages 17, 13, and three years old. She sells fish and she has been in this business for the last 10 years and earns an income of 18,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	

She is now servicing her first loan of 15,000 KES from ‘VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy more stock of fish to sell to her customers.

The profit she earns will be used to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business and own a fish farm.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Editha dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Shorouq

texts.en:
Shorouq is a 20-year-old married woman who lives with her husband who works as a truck driver in Rsaifeh-Jordan.

Shorouq started to sell blankets at her home to help her husband in paying their household expenses.

She is now seeking a youth loan to buy clothes and more blankets to sell in the summer season.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes and blankets for her business

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José es una persona humilde y sencilla, con un corazón libre de cualquier pretensión de lujuria, afirma que vive feliz de esta forma y nada puede quebrantar su convicción.
El se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde, es una actividad aprendida desde que era un niño al lado de su familia que siempre han ejercido actividades de campo.
El es un hombre muy trabajador y Verraco, tiene en sus manos la fuerza para salir adelante y hacerle frente a todas las adversidades.
Desea darle un impulso a su negocio y es por esto que solicita un crédito para la compra de alimento para sus animales y comprar un lote de animales mayor.
Con el crédito podrá tener unos cerdos mucho más grandes y sanos, haciéndolos más atractivos para sus clientes y generando unos mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José is a humble and simple person, with a heart free from any pretension of self-indulgence. He states that he lives happily in this way and nothing can shatter his conviction.

He works raising pigs for fattening, it is a job learned from when he was a boy at the side of his family who always has worked in rural jobs.
