He is a very hard-working and fantastic man; he has in his hands the force to get ahead and do it in the face of all adversity.

He wants to boost his business and this is why he asks for a loan to purchase for the animals and purchase a larger batch of animals. 

With the loan, he will be able to have much bigger and healthier pigs, making them more attractive for his customers and generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carpets, shoes and clothes to resell

loans.name: Gemayze Group

texts.en:
Estela is the featured borrower of Gemayze group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometowns in the  Philippines to work as housekeepers and support their beloved families in the Philippines.

Estela is a 49-year-old mother of five, who works as a housekeeper to support her family and especially cover their education tuition fees. Estela is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees. 

Estela is the second lady from the left. As for the other group members, Modeline is the second from the right, Agatha is the first from the far left, and Nenita is the first from the right.

loans.use: To pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and make improvements to the site to serve the visitors who come to the local festivals.

loans.name: Silvia Esther

texts.es:
Silvia una mujer de admirar pues a sus 58 años de edad tiene un deseo y un espíritu por trabajar incansable y es que por dificultades de la vida se vio en la necesidad de realizar hazañas para poder alimentar sus hijos, puesto que se separó de su marido y la dejo con 4 niños pero como madre responsable siempre estuvo pendiente de ellos y nunca les hizo falta un padre pues tenían a Silvia quien ejercía los dos papeles. Gracias a una pequeña tienda que logro montar genero los recursos para su familia y la trabaja hoy en día, debido a que sus ventas son buenas y es muy reconocida en el sector pro el tiempo que lleva operando en la zona quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de una carpa con la que podrá tener silletería y mesas para una mejor atención a sus clientes también quiere comprar surtido en grano y abarrotes para tener mayores existencias. 
Aspira en un futuro poder ser la dueña de un mini-mercado con lo cual pueda retribuirle en servicio a sus vecinos que le compraron y de alguna manera la ayudaron en sus peores días.
texts.en:
Silvia is an admirable woman as at 58 years old she has the desire and spirit to work non-stop. With the difficulties of life she had to perform great feats to be able to feed her children as she separated with her husband and had 4 children. As would any responsible mother she always took care of them and they never missed the father as Silvia fulfilled both roles. Thanks to a small store she manged to open she generated resources for her family, which she still runs today. Her sales are good and she is well-known in the area for the amount of time she has been operating her business.

She wants a loan to buy a canopy where she can put tables and chairs to provide better service for her customers. She also wants to buy a variety of grains and groceries to have more stock. She hopes for a future where she is the owner of a mini-supermarket where she could repay her neighbors in service who bought from her and in some way helped her in her worst days.

loans.use: to buy a canopy to be able to have her clients seated in chairs and tables under a roof and stock her business with grains and groceries.

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en: Mukhtaran is a mother of 2 children, living happily with her husband. To provide financial support to her husband, she started a cloth-selling business. She has become popular in her town for providing good quality fabric. Now Mukhtaran has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors so that she can provide a greater variety to her customers. She has full support of her husband. Mukhtaran believes that the income generated from this business can play a vital role in providing better education and health facilities to her children. She has great dreams of giving a better future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth in different colors.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es:
Mauricio es un joven de tan solo 24 años que a su corta edad le toco hacerse con el negocio de la familia una hermosa plantación de Ñame.
Sus conocimientos los aprendió desde muy chico mostrando grandes aptitudes en el manejo y mantenimiento del campo.
Debido a las fuertes lluvias y repentinos cambios climáticos, sus cultivos no dieron la producción esperada provocando  pérdidas y viéndose muy afectado su capital y esperanzas, amenazando futuras plantaciones de ñame que en ese momento estaban germinando, por este motivo Mauricio solicita un préstamos para la compra de insumos como riegos, abonos, fertilizantes y unas mejoras para soportar el invierno buscando tener una productiva cosecha que le deje buena ganancia, mejorando su empresa y buscando siempre salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a young man, only 24 years old, who at his young age has taken on the family business which is a beautiful yam plantation. 

He learned his skills from a very young age, showing great aptitude in managing and maintaining the fields.

Due to the strong rains and sudden climate changes, his crops did not have the expected production, causing losses. Seeing his capital and hope affected, threatening the future plantings of yams that in this moment are germinating, Mauricio asks for a loan to purchase supplies such as irrigation, manure, fertilizer and some improvements to get through the winter, looking to have a productive harvest which gives him good earnings, improving his business and always looking to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Khloud

texts.en: Khloud is a 24-year-old single lady who lives with her family in Salt, Jordan. She started selling clothes at her home for one year to help her family in improving their living conditions. Now she is seeking a youth loan to help her improve her work and buy more blankets and clothes in order to raise her income.

loans.use: To buy more blankets and clothes for her business

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana una persona de 32 años de edad,  que se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su casa. Lo más importante para ella son su familia,  ella se creció con su abuela quien dedicó toda su vida a realizarse como comerciante,  ella era propietaria de una tienda que atendían todos los días por estar instalada en su casa de habitación,  su abuela era una persona muy humilde y trabajadora y fue ella quien le enseño el trabajo de comerciante. De esta forma poniendo en práctica todo la aprendido de su abuela ha podido salir adelante, hoy en día Ana es madre de un hijo que se encuentra estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.


Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su comunidad, también se dedica a los oficios domésticos como madre y esposa se preocupa por mantener su hogar lo más higiénico posible.


El dinero será utilizado para surtir su negocio de productos básicos, como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, canela, café, pan, golosinas, bebidas, etc.  ya que manifiesta que la tienda que estaba más cerca de la suya fue cerrada y la demanda de productos ha aumentado significativamente. Lo cual vendrá a mejorar sus ingresos y dará una mejor ganancia la cual invertirá en el mejoramiento de su casa.   


Las planes que ella tiene para un futuro son los de invertir el mayor tiempo que fuera posible en hacer crecer su negocio,  ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y sus metas son las de ampliar más y más su negocio de manera que le permita generar un empleo para personas en su comunidad  y apoyar en la formación académica de su hijo hasta que sea un profesional de éxito y de bien para su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old, and takes care of the household chores of her home. The most important thing for her is her family.  She grew up with a grandmother who spent her whole life working as a merchant. She was the owner of a store that she served every day because it was in a room of her house. Her grandmother was a very humble and hard-working person and it was she who taught her the work of a merchant.  In this way, putting into practice everything she learned from her grandmother, she has been able to get ahead.  Today, Ana is the mother of a child who is a student in the local school.

She works selling pantry products in the community.  She also takes care of the household chores; as a mother and wife, she is concerned with keeping the house as clean as possible. 

The money will be used to stock her business with basic products such as rice, beans, sugar, salt, cinnamon, coffee, bread, candies, drinks, etc. since she states that the store which was the closest to hers has closed and the demand for products has risen significantly. She will sell these to increase her income and to produce more earnings which will be invested in improving her house.

Her future plans are to invest as much time as possible so that her her business grows, since it has become her primary source of income and her goals are to expand it more and more in a way that will allow her to create employment for people in her community and support the academic formation of her child until he is a successful professional and does good for the community.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, salt, cinnamon, coffee, bread, candies, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Cielo Adriana

texts.es:
Desde hace 10 años la señora cielo se ha dedicado a la venta de camas y maderas, es un negocio heredado por su padre quien se dedico a esto toda su vida. Ella ha decidido no dejar caer el negocio y por el contrario convertirlo en su principal fuente de ingresos familiar.
Trabaja de lunes a sábado y tiene gran voluntad para realizar sus trabajos.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera, elementos que le permitirán seguir fabricando camas para la venta.
Su mayor sueño es que su negocio sea muy reconocido en el sector y tenga unos ingresos muy estables.
texts.en:
For ten years, Cielo has made a living selling beds and wood, a business she inherited from her father who made his living this way all his life. She has decided not to drop the business but rather to convert it into her family’s main source of income. She works Monday through Saturday and is very committed to carrying out her work. 

She requests a loan to purchase wood, elements that allow her to continue making beds to sell. 

Her greatest dream is for her business to be recognized in the area and to have a very stable income.

loans.use: to buy wood lots.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en: Six years ago Naheed, at the age of 41, began the work of stitching at her house. She used the stitching machine which she received in her dowry. She provides stitching services to the nearby people and uses the income to support her family, which consists of 4 children and a husband. However, due to low funds she faces difficulty and was unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her fifth loan cycle and has requested 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zippers, etc. Naheed hopes that this business will generate her a healthy income which she wants to utilize for the better future of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Forty-six years old, Khursheed is involved in agriculture work and has experience of 30 years. She and her husband grow various vegetables and sell them in the local market. They have 3 children; one of their children also supports them at their work. 

Khursheed is in her 7th loan cycle and Kashf Foundation has helped her in improving and growing her business over the years. Khursheed has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase packs of seeds, insecticides and pesticides. She hopes that this loan will help her to grow more crops and generate extra cash for her family.

loans.use: to purchase packs of seeds, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Smina

texts.en: Forty-one year old Smina has been running a beauty parlor business for the past four years. Her business has become quite successful and in order to meet with the growing customer base she wants to purchase more products like lightening kits, curlers, hair styling products, better quality facial tools and add another wash basin to the parlor. For this purpose she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She is in her fourth loan cycle. The parlor business has helped Smina to provided a better quality life for her family. She hopes that the growth in this business can help her to provide a good education to her three children.

loans.use: to purchase more products like lightening kits, curlers, hair styling products, better quality facial tools and add another wash basin to the parlor

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran lives in the village Syunik in Syunik region. He has higher education and a specialty of veterinary medicine. Now he works at the municipality. Seyran’s wife works at the school as a teacher. They have two children. Seyran is seriously engaged in agricultural activities. On his plot of land he cultivates potatoes, beans, corn and he also has a nice orchard with apple, plum and pear trees. All this harvest he sells at the city wholesale market through re-sellers. 

Seyran also has beehives, but the number of his bee families is only three. The honey they give is only enough for his family use, but as he says, such healing and tasty honey can bring him in a decent income if he adds to the number of his beehives. 

Seyran is asking for a loan of 250.000 Armenian drams in order to buy several beehives, also seedlings of emmer wheat, and diesel fuel which he needs for his land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy several beehives, seedlings of emmer wheat, and diesel fuel  for his land cultivation

loans.name: Rosember

texts.es:
El joven Rosember se dedica a una actividad muy popular en el departamento de Córdoba, Colombia. El tiene una compra y venta de maderas las cuales vende a grandes industrias y talleres de muebles.
Es un joven bastante dedicado a su trabajo y con gran energía.
Siempre ha preferido ser independiente y obtener sus propios ingresos, por eso decidió continuar con este trabajo que le enseño su padre.
El pide un apoyo económico para la compra de lotes de madera al por mayor, de esta forma tendrá una mayor cantidad de inventario para vender y cubrirá algunos pedidos que tiene en este momento y no ha podido suplir.
Sus ingresos son invertidos en el mantenimiento de su negocio y en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Rosember works in a very common activity if the Department of Córdoba, Colombia. He buys and sells wood which he sells to big industries and furniture workshops. He is a youth who is quite dedicated to his work and who applies great energy to his endeavors. He has always wanted to work for himself and make his own money so he decided to continue the work that his father taught him. He is requesting economic support to buy parcels of wood wholesale and in this way have a greater quantity of inventory for sale. He can also fill some orders that he has and has not been able to deliver. His profits are invested in the maintenance of his business and the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy wood for his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a bar offering services such as pool and alcoholic drinks.

loans.name: Dalba Narciza

texts.es: A sus 33 años de edad Dalba es una chica muy trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante con su trabajo, ella se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde hace 3 años,  Dalva vive con sus padres y es su madre  la que le enseña la manera de cuidar los chanchos, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y de este negocio espera mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y de ser posible ayudar a sus padresy tener un  futuro mejor
texts.en:
At 33 years old, Dalba is a very hardworking woman with the desire to come out ahead with her work. As of three years ago she is dedicated to raising pigs. 

Dalva lives with her parents, and it is her mother who teaches her how to care for the pigs. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs and from this business she hopes to improve her income in order to cover her costs, to be possible to help her parents and to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a washing machine to improve his business and with the rest buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tachy Neira

texts.es:
Tachy tiene 25 años, es una mujer tenaz y capaz de salir adelante con su empuje verraquera.
Desea ser independiente y tener unos ingresos estables para el sostenimiento de su pequeño hijo, por eso tiene la idea de montar una sala de internet en el municipio de Montería motivada por sus cuñada quien tiene un negocio similar en otro municipio, Tachy quiere aprovechar la oportunidad ya que en el sector donde vive no hay de este tipo de servicios y las personas deben recorrer largos trayectos para conseguirlos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de equipos de computo, equipos que le permitirán soñar e ilusionar se con un futuro mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en: Tachy is 25 years old. She is a very tenacious and capable of getting ahead with her fiery energy. She wants to be independent and have a stable income to support her young son. So she has the idea of opening an internet cafe in the Municipality of Montería, motivated by the fact that her in-law has a similar business in another municipality. Tachy wants to take advantage of the opportunity as there is no service similar to this in the area where she lives and people have to travel a long distance to access this service. She is requesting a loan to buy computers, equipment that will permit her to hope and dream for a future that is better for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Mirna Betsayda

texts.es:
Mirna es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad y vive en Jayanca junto a su familia.
Tiene un hijo quien es su mayor orgullo y por quien lucha día a día para poder brindarle un futuro mejor.
Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de limones y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y con muchos deseos de superación.
Mirna está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para poder implementar su negocio y de esta manera pueda tener mayores ingresos. Con estos ingresos adicionales podrá ir remodelando su casa para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna is an entrepreneur woman. She is 21 years old and lives in Jayanca along with her family.

She has a son, who is her biggest pride and for who she fights everyday to give him a better future.

For several years she has sold lemons, and she has done a good job since she is a responsible, hardworking, honest woman, with a lot of desire of self-fulfillment.

Mirna is thankful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to the support they have given her, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business, and increase her incomes. With these extra earnings she will remodel her house to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (lemons) for her business.

loans.name: Nury

texts.es:
Nury es una amable y muy humilde mujer que junto con su hijo salen al rio a buscar minerales los cuales venden en depósitos y este es el único medio de sostenimiento de su familia conformado por su pareja y otros dos hijos más. 
Nury es una persona de muy escasos recursos por lo que se le dificulta comprar activos para mejorar su condiciones por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito y el apoyo para comprar una canoa para sacar mayor número de minerales y sobretodo tener mayor seguridad al navegar la rio pues diariamente se exponen con su hijo a innumerables peligros que habitan en el rio. Su principal sueño es construir su casa con material pues está hecha de tablas.
texts.en:
Nury is a very kind and humble woman that together with her son goes out to the river to look for minerals, which they sell in deposits. This is the only manner of support for her family, made up of her partner and two additional children. 

Nury is a person of very few resources, therefore it is difficult to buy assets to improve her conditions. For this reason she wants to request a loan and the support to buy a canoe in order to remove a greater number of minerals, and above all to have greater security in navigating the river as she and her son are exposed daily to numerous dangers that live in the river. 

Her greatest dream is to build her house with better materials as it is made of panels.

loans.use: to buy a canoe in order to remove minerals in order to support her family, and to have more security in navigating the river.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 50-year-old married woman. She is pictured with her husband. 

Five years ago, Naseem and her husband started a small business manufacturing and selling wedding garlands. The business helps them support their seven children.  

Naseem is in her fourth loan cycle. She is now requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase raw materials needed to make the garlands, including tissue paper, fabric, glue, and thread. The loan will help Naseem expand her manufacturing business and generate more income, which will allow her to provide her children with better living standards. 

Naseem is happy with her achievement and encourages all women to work hard and take charge of their lives.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make wedding garlands

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Mr. Ganzorig, 28 years old, lives with his wife and mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a dance teacher since 2004. His wife also teaches acrobatics to children. His mother is an experienced hairdresser. He is currently living on his mother's land, and he wants to improve the surrounding environment such as the house, fences, and garden. He is requesting a loan of 2,600,000 MNT to buy paints, seedlings, and building materials. After renovating his house, repairing fences, and growing trees in the garden, his family will live in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to improve his house and yard

loans.name: Madiene's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 10 Décembre 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe, elles viennent d’entamer leur quatrième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce et la transformation de produits locaux.

Madame Madiène  (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est divorcée, âgée de 38 ans et mère de trois enfants dont un garçon et deux filles. Elle est vendeuse de fruits dans la commune. Elle tient son étale  près du marché central et s’approvisionne auprès de grossiste pour la plupart des autres régions. Elle mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années et jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce commerce.

   Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter au moins cinq casiers d’orange en provenance du Maroc, des cartons de poire et de pomme pour la revente au détail par pièce pour par kilo.

 Les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux assister ses enfants dans leur scolarité et prise en charge sanitaire d’une part et d’autre part de développer son épargne.
texts.en:
Created on 10th December 2012, this banc villageois is made up of women who want their money-generating businesses to prosper. A strong spirit of cooperation exists between the members of this group. They have just started their fourth loan cycle with the banc villageois lending scheme. They all live within the same neighbourhood and principally work in retail and transforming local produce.

Madiène, the woman sat on the far right with her hand raised, is the group's star lender. She is 38 years old, divorced, and a mother to three children, one boy and two girls. She sells fruit in her local area. She works near the central market and gets her supplies from a wholesaler. She has been doing this for many years and has a lot of experience in this business.

With this new loan, she plans on purchasing at least five crates of Moroccan oranges and boxes of pears and apples, which will be resold individually or by the kilo. The profits will allow her to better support her children with their school fees and to pay for sanitary living conditions. Some of the profits will also go into her savings.

loans.use: to purchase at least five crates of Moroccan oranges and boxes of pears and apples, which will be resold individually or by the kilo

loans.name: Nayfa

texts.en:
Nayfa is a 41-year-old lady. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Nayfa has been selling clothes for two years. She originally stared a tailoring business in her home, which was profitable.  Later, she started buying clothes and blankets to resell, and was able to increase her profit. Nayfa is now seeking a loan to buy a more clothes. The profit will help her improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a more clothes and blankets to sell

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia, a 32-year-old married woman, opened a beauty parlor in her house about four years ago. This parlor has helped her to support her family. 

Sobia is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more cosmetics, such as makeup kits, lipsticks, foundations, and cleansers for the parlor. She believes that this loan can help her to better fulfill the her clients' needs. She is a very hard-working lady and hopes to provide her family with a healthier lifestyle with the income she generates from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, such as makeup kits, lipsticks, foundations, and cleansers

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat has been running a small successful general store which she began with a loan from Kashf Foundation a few years ago. The general store has helped her in providing good quality food, clothing and healthcare for her family. She wants to grow her business; therefore she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, beverages etc. She also wants to use this loan to grow by adding other products like spools of thread, buttons, etc. to cope with the needs of her expanding customer list. She is now in her 8th loan cycle. In the future she is hoping to increase her clientele.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, beverages and other products like spools of thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Baigalmaa, 47 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been helping her husband's business by working as a conductor for a microvan service since 2006. Her husband is a very experienced driver and before self-employment, he worked at a private company as a driver. Their son goes to high school and next year he will sit university entrance exams. 

Mrs. Baigalmaa is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, and planks for house renovation. Her house has  deteriorated over the years and during wintertime, her family burns lots of coal in order not to freeze. Also, burning coal is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia according to the clean air institution.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 23-year-old single man from Gaza City. Three years ago, Yousef opened his own business, which is a store for selling mobile phones and accessories. He also has good experience in maintenance.

Yousef would like to improve his business and expand it in the future. Yousef took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more mobiles and repair parts for his mobile store. By taking this loan, Yousef will be able to increase his sales and also his productivity. 

Yousef appears in the photo in his mobile phone store.

loans.use: to buy more mobiles and repair parts for his mobile phone store

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 21-year-old single young man from Deir El Balah. He lives with his parents and younger brothers and sisters in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely covering all the family's needs. Imad would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the stuff they need.

Imad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. By taking this loan, Imad will be able to provide hot water for the family house without using electricity.

Imad is photographed in the store where he will buy the solar system.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 54 years old and lives in Stepanavan city in Lori region. She is not married and she lives alone. 

She graduated Yerevan Polytechnic Institute and she has a specialty of engineering. For many years, she worked at the Stepanavan Municipality; now she works at the Stepanavan Regional Employment Center as a social worker-chief specialist. Aida helps the unemployed and needy families to find jobs, and to find a way of providing, at least, minimum living conditions for their families. She is a very popular and respected person in her city. She has already helped many families raise and improve their living standards, and these families are very thankful and pleased with Aida’s kind and compassionate attitude toward their families.

Aida asks a loan to buy a computer, which gives great and important information connected with her work.  

This will enable her to do work from her house; she also can find vacancies for the citizens who impatiently wait for Aida’s call in order to have a job offer.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Deeb

texts.en:
Deeb is a 27-year-old married man from Khan Younis. He lives with his wife in a small house. 

Deeb works transferring goods using a rental rickshaw. He buys the goods from wholesalers, and resells them to local traders. He would like to improve his business and also his income. 

Deeb took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead renting one. 

By taking this loan, Deeb will be able to improve his business and also his income. Deeb was photographed while he was working

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old single young man from Khan Younis. He lives with his parents and brothers in a humble house. Ahmad's father is an employee in a local firm, where he gets a limited and low income. 

The family has a grocery store where Ahmad works. It is a good business, and demand for consumable products is high.

Ahmad is seeking for a loan from FATEN; this loan will help buy a new refrigerator for the grocery store. 

By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to increase the inventory in his store, and also his sales. Ahmad appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for the grocery store

loans.name: Xalfali

texts.en:
Xalfali is married with three children. The family members are living in Baku region. Xalfali is a farmer, he has a greenhouse where he grows seasonal vegetables: cucumber, tomatoes, etc. His wife actively helps Xalfali on his business. All of their children are going to secondary school. 

To support the family business Xalfali needs a loan in the amount of 1100 Azerbaijan New Manat-AZN. With this loan Xalfali is planning to fertilize his sown area. Xalfali says great thanks to Kiva organization for everything: support and improving business.

loans.use: to pay to fertilize sown area

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 21-year-old single young man from Gaza city; he lives with his family in a humble house. The family has a grocery store where Yousef works. It is a good business, and the demand for consumable products is high.

Yousef is seeking a loan from FATEN; this loan will help to buy more grocery products for the grocery store to sell. 

By taking this loan, Yousef will be able to increase the inventory in his store, and also his sales. 

Yousef appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell in the grocery store.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin is 50 years old. He has been married for 24 years and has three children. His elder daughter is studying at her third year of college, the other daughter goes to tenth class and his son is preparing for university. They are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land, Fuzuli city, and now live in Abseron region. Elchin has been in the business of selling electrical goods for two years. This business is new and to increase his business Elchin needs a loan in the amount of 1200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to construct security cameras for his store.

loans.use: to construct security cameras for his store

loans.name: Hakob

texts.en:
Hakob is 28 years old and he lives in the city of Vedi. He is not married, and he lives with his parents and brother. All his family members are employed, and each one in its turn tries to sustain their family needs. 

Hakob has a higher education, and now he works at a private company as a worker. 

Hakob, as well as the whole family, are worried and impatient to get this loan, since Hakob’s mother has some problems connected with her health.

Hakob asks this loan since his mother needs an urgent operation, and after she must have a course of treatment. 

Hakob hopes that this loan will help his mother to get rid of her health problems, and that his next deal with Kiva will have another reason, for example, it can be his marriage!

loans.use: to be pay for his mother's surgery and course of treatment.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man from a small village called Attel near Tulkarem City. 

A few years ago Mohammad opened his own business, which is a store for selling mobile phones and accessories. He also has good experience in maintenance. Mohammad would like to improve his business and expand it in the future.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more mobiles and repair parts for his mobile phone store. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his sales and also his productivity.  Mohammad appears in the photo in his mobile phone store.

loans.use: to buy more mobiles and repair parts for his mobile phone store

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 22 years old. He lives in Irbid, Jordan with six siblings. He is currently working at "Save the Children" association and at the same time studying genetics engineering, and he is in his third year of study to get his bachelor's. Mohammad is planning to get his bachelor's degree. He is currently facing a personal financial crisis, and is requesting a loan to pay for his school fees.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine lives in the village of Lori-Berd in Lori region. Hermine has a higher education in teaching and she is a teacher of elementary classes.

She started her first steps in teaching in the village school and it is over 30 years that she has worked there already.  She is devoted to her work and to her pupils, whom she likes very much, and she says parting from them is really hard for her since during her teaching period she treats them like her own children. She is happy for them for each of their achievements and helps to overcome any difficulty in the teaching process.

She asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer and learn computer skills, which are very important nowadays in education.

loans.use: to buy a computer and learn computer skills

loans.name: Concilia

texts.en:
Concilia is a mother aged 38 years. She is married to Pius and together they are blessed with two children aged 15 and 9 years. She also takes care of two orphans, a boy and a girl of 14 and 11 years, respectively.

Concilia makes and sells bricks, a business she has done for the last two years, earning a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

Concilia has requested a loan of 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase trees and sand for making bricks. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her first.

Concilia desires to provide employment opportunities to others in her business permanently as well as educating her children for life.

loans.use: to purchase trees and sand for making bricks

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
This nice and charming lady’s name is Melanya. She lives with her parents and brother in Yerevan city. Melanya is 25 years old. 

She graduated from Yerevan State Linguistic University, where she learned her translating skills, and she is a specialist of English and French languages. For three years Melanya worked at the tour agency as a tour manager. Now she works at the Linguistic Center as an English Language teacher. Melanya’s father works for a construction company and her mother works at the watch factory.

Melanya requests this loan since she wants to buy a new computer; for this purchase, she has two important reasons. First of all her computer at home has broken down and it cannot be repaired anymore, and secondly, to conduct her teaching activities, she cannot work without a computer.

loans.use: to buy a new computer which will help her in her teaching activities

loans.name: Terguunbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Terguunbayar, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2011. Her husband runs a jacket sales business for a living. Their children both go to school. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to install vacuum-insulated windows in her house so that dust and debris won't come into the house and pollute the family's living space. Also it will be good protection against heat loss as their former windows tend to lose heat quickly.

loans.use: to install vacuum-insulated windows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Neziha

texts.en:
Neziha is married and has two children. 

She contributes to her family’s income by doing handiwork and selling cosmetics. First she knitted for herself and her family. When people liked her work, she began selling it. She began multi-level marketing as well. She has experienced some slow periods in this sector but continued anyway. 

With the loan from Maya, she’ll buy cosmetic products. Her biggest dream is to open a notions shop.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Neziha Kırkaya evli ve 2 çocuk annesi.elişi yaparak ve ersağ satarak ailesinin geçimini sağlıyor.Önce kendisine ve ailesine örgü örüyor.Ördükleri beğenilince çevresindekilere satmaya başlıyor.Elişinin yanı sıra network işine giriyor. Ama bu sektörde bazı dönemler duraklamalar yaşamış ama hala devam ediyor.Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile kozmetik ürünleri alacak.En büyük hayali tuhafiye açmak.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Punjik

texts.en:
Punjik is 54 years old and she lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. She has no higher education and since she graduated from school she has worked at different workshops and factories as a worker. Punjik is married and has two sons; the elder son is married and lives separately with his family, and her younger son lives with his parents and works at the combine. Punjik has her own shop where she sells food (bread, dairy products, sweets, candies, sausages, juice, etc.), household items and a great range of vegetables and fruits. Punjik’s husband is an invalid and he can help his wife very little in this business. This shop brings the main income for this family and Punjik does her best to gain more customers with her polite attitude and cheap prices.

She is asking for this loan in order to refresh and enlarge her shop’s assortment and to buy some new products that she didn’t have for sale in her shop before.

loans.use: to refresh and enlarge her shop’s assortment and to buy some new products that she didn’t have for sale in her shop before.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is a 50-year-old married lady. Her son is a university student majoring in Translation, and he is in his second year. He is planning to get his bachelor's so that he will support his family financially. 

Mervat has been making decorated soaps and selling them to her neighbors to support her family. Her income was the source of income for her son's studies. But she is currently facing financial issues, as she currently doesn't have enough money to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan to support him.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
This pretty lady is 46 years old. Her name is Marine, and she lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Marine’s husband died many years ago during the Nagorno Karabakh war conflict. She has two children whom she brought up alone. She is proud of them because they are good and honest people. Both her son and daughter (she is already married) live in the Russian Federation. Marine worked many years at the library. Now she works at the city municipality. As she says, living alone, far from her beloved children and missing them, is very hard for a mother. She dreams of the day that her son finally will be back. When he gets married, he will have his family in his motherland and they will all live together happily.
 
Marine asks for this loan to buy a computer, which will help her to contact her children more often so that she will not miss her children and grandchildren quite as much.

loans.use: to buy a computer, which will help her to contact her children more often

loans.name: Gulchichek

texts.en: Gulchichek is living in the Abseron region. She is 57 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are married and her youngest child studies at technical college. Gulchichek has been in the animal breeding business for 20 years. She learned this profession from her mother-in-law and today she teaches this profession to brides. Gulchichek produces dairy products: yogurt, cheese, cottage cheese, etc. Then she sells these products and earns money. Now Gulchichek needs a loan in the amount of 2100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more lambs to increase her business. Gulchichek hopes that this loan will stimulate her business. She says great thankful for everything to Kiva organization.

loans.use: to buy more lambs

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline is married to Samson and they are blessed with two children. Samson also provides income for the family. Everline sells clothes, a business she has run for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES10,000. She has requested a loan of KES10,000 from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to buy bales of clothes for resale. With the profits from the loan, Everline will be able to educate her children for life as well as purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salon hair products.

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon, with his wife and son, lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Levon graduated from the Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of theoretical subjects, then from the State Conservatory, the department of accordion. Now and it has already been 30 years, and he works at the Kapan city State Art College as a lecturer.  

Levon’s family likes art very much, and all his family members are connected with this field. His wife works at the Children’s Art School as a choreographer and also as a lecturer of dance history. 

Now Levon’s son goes in follow his father, and he studies at the State Conservatory at the branch of the city Gyumri, in the theoretical subjects’ departments. He studies at the paid division.

Levon asks for this loan since he needs to pay for his son’s tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 19-year-old university student majoring in Sport Training, and he is in his third year. He lives with his 5 siblings and his parents in Baqaa-Jordan. 

Farah's goal is to get his bachelor's degree so that he can support his family financially. Because he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is self-employed, from Spandarian village of the Syunik region. She lives with her husband and one-year-old daughter. Susanna has already been engaged in farming and animal husbandry for 20 years. Jointly with her husband, she cultivates barley, beech and potatoes, and breeds cattle, pigs and hens. Susanna has previously applied for several loans and has a very good credit history with no delinquent days. The family's agribusiness needs some investments to function in an efficient way. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to buy a new lawn mower and 1.2 tons of fuel. Susanna and her family will be grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill in helping them collect the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a lawn mower and 1.2 tons of fuel

loans.name: Racky's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 16 mai  2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte actuellement des femmes qui en plus de vivre ensemble dans le même village, gagnent en expérience dans leur activité respective car comprenant de mieux en mieux le programme cela favorisé par le fait que le village habite un grand « Louma » marché hebdomadaire. La solidarité et entre aide caractérisent les relations entre membre du groupe qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Racky (debout à droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette. Mariée et mère de deux  enfants une fille et un garçon, elle est âgée de 29 ans. Malgré son jeune âge elle est l’une des plus dynamiques du groupement. Elle est vendeuse d’articles vestimentaires (sacs, chaussures), et produits cosmétiques (effets de toilette, parfums et déodorants). Elle achète sa marchandise dans la capitale pour la revente à crédit par deux remboursements aux femmes du village et au comptant durant les jours de marchés hebdomadaires.

 Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter par douzaines des chaussures pour enfants et par cartons pour les parfums et déodorants pour la revente au village.

 Avec les bénéfices, en moyenne 15 000 Frs CFA par douzaine vendue, elle pense renforcer son épargne et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on 16th May 2011 following the inauguration of their banc villageois. The group is currently made up of women who not only live in the same village but who also gain experience in their respective businesses, allowing them to better understand the lending scheme. This group has a distinct advantage, in that their village is home to the large Louma weekly market. Solidarity and inter-member support are characteristic of the members of this group, who practise small-scale retail.

Racky (the woman on the right with her hand raised) is the group's star lender. She is 29 years old and a married mother to two children, one boy and one girl. Despite her young age, she is one of the most dynamic members of the group. She sells clothing items (bags, shoes) and cosmetic products (toiletries, perfumes and deodorants). She buys her supplies from the capital and sells them in exchange for credit (to be paid in two instalments) to the women of the village. She also accepts cash when she's working at the weekly markets.

With this new loan, she is planning on buying dozens of pairs of children's shoes and boxes of perfumes and deodorants which will be resold in the village 
With the profits, around 15,000 FCFA for every dozen pairs of shoes sold, she is thinking of adding to her savings and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of pairs of children's shoes and boxes of perfumes and deodorants, which will be resold in the village

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 20-year-old university student majoring in Finance, and is now in her second year. She is a conservative lady, so she asked her father to take her place in the above picture. 

Rawan's father is a retired man who sells mobile phones, but because he is currently facing a financial crisis, he cannot pay for her upcoming semester fees. Therefore, she has applied for this loan to pay for those fees.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Siba Sambhu Shg Group

texts.en:
Prena is a 27-year-old lady. She is living in Odisha with her parents, husband and her two children, who are schooling. Her husband is a farmer. For the past four years, Prena has been engaged in the activity of selling cow's milk in her village. Her husband assists her in this activity. 

Prena is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the leader of the group, Siba Sambhu Self Help Group (SHG). There are eleven members in the group, and all are women. The members of the group are involved in different kinds of activities like agriculture, and some have grocery shops. She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 165,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed. 

Prena has a dream to provide a better living for her family. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this kind help and support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de medicamentos.

loans.name: Nidjat

texts.en: Nidjat is 27 years old, married and has a newborn child. He is living with his family in the Abseron region, but they are Internally Displaced Persons from Agdam city. Nidjat is a driver; he specializes in cargo transportation. A while ago the tire of the lorry (truck) was broken and to repair it he needs 800 AZN. He sends a big thanks to Kiva for aid. In the future Nidjat wants to change all the tires on the lorry.

loans.use: to pay to repair the truck's tire.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase shop inventory and to buy soft drinks to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Maa Saraswati Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Saraswati Self Help Group is an exemplary group. They all are engaged in different activities to earn their livelihoods. Some of them are engaged in agricultural activities, some are running a grocery shop, some sell vegetables, and some have a wood business. 

One person who deserves to be highlighted is Kalpana (the lady seated second from left), a 32-year-old married woman with one child, who is engaged in cultivating vegetables and selling them in the market. Through her job, she works to support her family, to improve her business and to continue growing. She is a very determined person who wants to continue growing. 

She is seeking part of this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and other vegetables and fruits to continue to increase her sales. 

The group is very grateful for this opportunity for growth that it is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Santoshi Self Help Group consists of nine women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves share their problems and solve their problems among themselves. Sukeshi was selected as president of  Maa Santoshi Self Help Group. The members of the group are mostly engaged in dairy businesses. The lady siting first from left in the photo is Sukeshi. 

Sukeshi is 48 years old and is staying with her husband and her four children. She hopes to see her children as officers in a big company. She has a few cows and she sells milk in the village. Her husband supports her in this activity. Sukeshi and her group members have requested a loan of 135,000 INR. Her portion will help her to purchase a cow, repair her cowshed and cover operational expenses like food and fodder for the cows.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, repair her cowshed and purchase food and fodder for the cows.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is married and supports six people in her family. She is married to Joseph who provides additional income for the family.

Pamela runs a hotel, a business she has done for the last 10 years earning a monthly income of KES 4,000. She is requesting for a loan of KES 22,500 which she will use to purchase food for cooking in the hotel.

This is Pamela's second loan with VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her previous one. Pamela desires to live a life free from financial struggle; that is, a better life.

loans.use: to buy food for cooking in the hotel

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar is 56 years old, married, and has three children. One of them is 25 years old: his son, who studies at fourth course of University; another child is his 21-year-old daughter, who is studying at third course of college; and the third is his youngest son, who is going to eleventh class. The family is living in Abseron region. 

Eldar is a master: he builds stone walls. He has been in this business for 12 years. Today Eldar needs a loan in the amount of 1000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy new materials, which will be useful in his business. He is thankful to the Komak company and Kiva organization for their help. In the future he wants to recruit an assistant for his business.

loans.use: to buy new construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows and goats for slaughtering.

loans.name: Alba Rosa

texts.es:
Alba es una mujer que cansada de su monotonía de estar en su casa sin hacer nada se le ocurrió la idea de montar un negocio para sentirse útil y productiva brindando una ayuda monetaria a su hogar, pues tiene 3 hijos por los cuales luchar y soñar en la vida. 
Necesita un crédito para realizar adecuaciones en su tienda su estantería y surtir su tienda con productos de la canasta familiar, Alba tiene la fe que este crédito será la oportunidad para mejorar sus ventas que le permitan sacar a sus hijos adelante y brindarles todas las herramientas para que sean grandes personas y profesionales
texts.en: Alba is a woman who was tired of the monotony of being at home with nothing to do.  Then, the idea of starting a business that would make her feel useful and productive, as well as provide monetary assistance to her home, occurred to her.  In addition, she has three children for whom she strives and dreams in life.  She needs a loan to make adaptations to the shelving in her shop, and stock her store with staple goods.  Alba has faith that this loan will be the opportunity to improve her sales, which will permit her to take her children forward, and provide them with all the tools so that they are great persons as well as professionals.

loans.use: to improve her shelving and purchase staple goods.

loans.name: Bholasankar Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2013, 10 women from a village in the Kalahandi district stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their family. They formed a group named Bholasankar Self Help Group. The members of Bholasankar Self Help Group are all women from the district of Kalahandi in Odisha, India. One of them is Pallabi, who was selected as their president. The lady sitting first from the right hand side in the photo is Pallabi. 

Pallabi is 34 years old and is staying with her husband. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. She got the idea of doing paddy cultivation from her husband. She gathered some other women from her neighborhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took on the leadership of the group and started to cultivate paddy and sell it in her village. Initially, she started by growing paddy, but later on she grew some vegetables. She has a very good relationship with her customers, as she supplies her products on time to her customers. Now she has a new idea of purchasing some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more paddy and vegetables on a large scale. For this, she has requested this loan along with her group. She will use her portion to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase land, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Alexander is in his late 20s and single with one small kid.  He has been running two projects, selling cooked food and running a grocery store.  He has been in this business since 2011.  He works from 6.30am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Alexander's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to buy beers, sodas, juice, water, spirits, and wines for the grocery store.  He dreams of opening a grocery store in another place.

Alexander will share this loan with his loan group "Tuamke," which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, juice, water, spirits, and wines for the grocery store.

loans.name: Maa Dumerdeo Shg Group

texts.en:
These members belong to the Maa Dumerdeo Self Help Group. One of them is Bisakha, age 48, (the lady seated first from the left in the sky blue saree). She has a spouse and two children. 

She alternates her daily activities with a business of selling rice, grams, spices, wafers, hair oil and other household consumables. She runs a small shop where she sells all these things to support her family. She has been in this business for a good amount of time, and she does well, thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business. She also sells vegetables in her shop. 

She requested with her group for the loan, of which she will use her portion to buy sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents and other household consumables for her business. She thanks those who share her dream by this means and commits to make her payments as scheduled. 

The businesses of the other group members are butcher shop, dairy farm, and a tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, edible oil, soap, detergents and other household consumables to sell.

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Shg Group

texts.en:
Banita is a 54-year-old lady living with her husband and three children. She owns and manages a dairy farm, where she has a few cows and buffaloes. She sells five litres of milk per day and earns 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. Her monthly income is very small for a family of four persons. 

She wants to purchase two Jersey cows for her farm, as demand for cow's milk is more in her village. She also has a plan to repair the shed for her cattle and make it big. 

Banita, along with her group members, has requested a loan of 180,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan for purchasing two cows and renovating the shed. 

In the future, she wants to increase her farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc. She has a dream to give a quality life to her family and save some money for her children's future. 

All the members of this group are engaged in dairy businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and repair her cattle shed.

loans.name: Mariama Dielo's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 10 Décembre 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe, elles viennent d’entamer leur quatrième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce et la transformation de produits locaux.

Madame Mariama (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette. C’est la personne morale du groupement, c’est une femme d’un engagement sans faille pour le développement de son groupement. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissu, sac à main pour femme, chaussure et divers articles vestimentaires. Agée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 filles. Elle achète sa marchandise dans les grands marchés de Dakar au près de grossistes pour la revente au comptant ou à crédit selon les clients.

Pour son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter spécialement des tissus basins et brodés par coupon de six yards, des chaussures femmes de fabrication locale pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle compte d’une part renforcer son épargne et d’autre part améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Created on December 10, 2012, the ’banc villageois’ is composed of women who wish very much to prosper from their revenue-generating businesses. There are good relationships between the members of the group. The women just started their fourth loan cycle in the ’banc villageois’ program. They all live in the same district and are active mainly in small-scale commerce and in processing local products. 

Ms. Mariama (sitting at the far right with her left hand raised) is the featured borrower. She is the group’s legal representative, a woman with unfailing dedication to the development of her group. She is active in selling fabrics, women’s handbags, shoes, and a variety of clothing items. She is 40 years old and a married mother of four girls. She purchases her merchandise from wholesalers at the big markets of Dakar. And then she resells the goods to customers for cash or on credit.

For her new loan, she is going to purchase in particular damask and embroidered fabrics in 6-yard lengths and some locally made women’s shoes for resale. 

With the profits made, she plans on bolstering her savings, as well as improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase in particular damask and embroidered fabrics in 6-yard lengths and some locally made women’s shoes for resale

loans.name: Emilse Del Carmen

texts.es: Emilse es una mujer de campo, madre de 3 hijos los cuales ha criado, alimentado y sacado a delante sola, como criadora de pollos su único anhelo es mejorar su empresa y como personas humildes pero trabajadoras se ven cortas de capital para invertir en su empresa solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos pues han pasado tiempos duros donde las ventas han disminuido pero por el mundial cree que puedan alzar y quiere tener existencias suficientes para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y poder seguir manteniendo su numerosa familia sin ayuda de un hombre pues Emilse tiene todas las facultades, ganas y disposición para seguir velando por sus hijos hasta que su salud de lo permita.
texts.en: Emilse is a country woman who has raised, fed, and provided for her 3 children on her own.  She raises chickens, and her only desire is to improve her business.  Like many humble but hardworking people, she is short on capital to invest in her business.  She is requesting a loan to buy chickens, as she has gone through some hard times when her sales have diminished, but for the world she believes that she can strive to have the inventories she needs to meet the demands of her customers so that she can continue to support her large family without the help of a man.  Emilse has the ability, desire and will to continue to look after her children, as long as her health permits.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Alicia es una persona de 44  años de edad,  es una madre de 3 hijos de los  cuales son dos niñas y un niño,  sus hijos se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad, la señora posee un negocio propio que se trata de una tienda donde vende frutas y verduras, está ubicada en el centro de su comunidad  ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que cuenta con valores y principio espirituales.

Alicia se dedicó a trabajar en una tienda cuando era joven y fue allí donde adquirió experiencia, luego comenzó con su propio negocio impulsado por su esposo y sus hijos y hasta el día de hoy se mantiene trabajando y con ayuda de su esposo le dan el sustento diario a su familia y garantizan los derechos a sus hijos.


La señora tiene una experiencia de 15 años, con un espíritu emprendedor en todo lo que hace además de sus obligaciones de madre y esposa maneja su pequeño negocio de frutas y verduras y crianza de cerdos, su esposo gana un sueldo decente trabaja como agricultor prestando sus servicios de lunes a sábado a personas de la comunidad, de esta manera cubren con las necesidades básicas de su hogar.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar frutas, verduras  y cerdos para crianza y posteriormente venderlos ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y de esta forma dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tendrá mejor ganancias económicas.


Los sueños de Alicia son los de ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad,  que sean unos profesionales de éxito, personas de bien, que le sirvan a su familia y a su comunidad, también ampliar su negocio y montar una granja de gallinas de engorde y ponedoras y vender huevos y carne de pollo, y adquirir un vehículo para el traslado de la mercadería.
texts.en:
Alicia is 44, and a mother of three children, two girls and one boy.  Her children are studying basic education at a community school.  Alicia has her own business, a store where she sells fruits and vegetables, located in the center of her community.  She is a hardworking and responsible person that has values and spiritual principles.

Alicia worked in a store when she was young, and this is where she gained experience.  Then she started her own business, propelled by her husband and children.  To this day, she is still working and, with her husband’s help, she provides her family with the daily bread and guarantees her children’s rights.

Alicia has fifteen years’ experience, and an enterprising spirit in all that she does.  In addition to her duties as a wife and mother, she manages her small fruit and vegetable business, and also raises pigs.  Her husband earns a decent wage working as a farmer, offering his services to people in the community from Monday to Saturday.  In this way, they pay for the basic household needs.

The loan she is requesting is to purchase fruit, vegetables, and pigs to raise for later sale, which   has become her main source of income.  So, in this way, she will give her customers better service and have higher income.

Alica dreams of seeing her children graduate from university, and become successful professionals as well as good people that serve their family and community.  In addition, she dreams of expanding her business and starting a chicken farm for fattening and laying, selling the eggs and chicken meat, and buying a vehicle for transporting the goods.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, and pigs to raise for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Shiva Shakti Shg Group

texts.en:
Shiva Shakti Self Help Group consists of eleven women from a village of Kalahandi district in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves. 

One of them is Gitanjali, who was selected as the president of Shiva Shakti Self Help Group. The lady standing first from the right side in the photo is Gitanjali. Gitanjali is 47 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children, who are in schooling. She hopes to see them as successful persons in their lives. 

She has a few acres of land in her village, and she is using her land in vegetable and paddy cultivation. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. She and her group have requested this loan. Her portion will help her to purchase the required resources for vegetable cultivation - vegetable plants, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

Gitanjali and her group are very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva for this kind support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable plants, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labour charges.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
Sharif is a 30-year-old married man with four children. He owns a retail shop in a rural area. He started his business to earn a living and his major clients are the general public. He gets additional income from farming.

He wants a loan to buy general merchandise such as Vaseline, drinks and soap to sell. His future hope is to construct a permanent house for his family, although he is faced with the difficulty of price fluctuations.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as Vaseline, drinks and soap to sell

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is aged 40 years. He has three children, but only two attend school.

He deals in a business selling an alcohol commonly known as "Waragi" that he sells to people within and outside his area to generate more income. He gets additional income from rentals.

His future hope is having a good home, but he faces a challenge of competition and high transport costs. Julius will use the loan to buy more alcohol to sell.

loans.use: to buy more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 46 years old. She is married to John and together they are blessed with two children. Rose sells green groceries, a business she has done for the last 12 years earning a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

Rose has requested for a loan of 10,000 KES which she will use to purchase green groceries.This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

Rose hopes and dreams of expanding her business to a degree so she can educate her children without much struggle.

loans.use: to purchase green groceries

loans.name: Arev

texts.en:
Arev lives with her husband and two teenage children. She is self-employed and from Amrakic village in the Lori region of Armenia. 

Jointly with her husband, Arev has been engaged in animal husbandry for a long time. Her husband sells their agricultural products in the local market. 

The family's agribusiness needs some investments to function more efficiently. Arev has previously applied for several loans and has an ideal credit history, with no overdue days so far. She has now applied for a loan of $1,100 US to repair a tractor and buy three calves. 

This hardworking woman and her husband have no other revenue sources. Let's help them expand their agribusiness and become better able to take care of their little children.

loans.use: to repair a tractor and purchase three calves

loans.name: Sudi

texts.en:
Sudi is aged 37 years and has 2 children. He does a motorcycle transport business and also brick laying to add to his income generation.  He wishes to have a bigger business in future.

He is faced with the challenge of bad roads that cause him constant mechanical break downs, hence reducing his income because of motorcycle repairs.

Sudi intends to use the loan to buy motorcycle tyres .

loans.use: to buy motorcycle tyres

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 26-year-old male who is married with 2 children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a textile shop where he has worked for four years, and he gets his additional income from coffee and groundnut growing.

Joseph needs the loan to buy dresses, shoes, shirts and trousers to sell. He hopes to expand the business in future, even though seasonal factors affect his business.

loans.use: to buy dresses, shoes, shirts and trousers to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 46 years old and all of her children are in school.

Evelyn has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 29 years old and married with one kid who is in school. Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sardines, beverages and other groceries. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing machines.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 30-year-old Egyptian mother who has two children, 12 and 9. She has gotten a dairy cow from the neighbors promising them that she would pay the money as soon as she got a loan from Kiva lenders. 

Esmeralda lives in a village in the district of Korca and she engages in livestock and agriculture. Her clientele are residents of the city of Korca; she sells at the farmers’ market of this city. She plants and sells garlic, animal fodder, wheat and corn. Her husband works as a musician; he plays instruments. (Many male members of the Egyptian community are talented at music, either singing or playing instruments.) The village where Esmeralda lives has very fertile soil, thus, almost any kind of plants grow easily and healthy there; however, villagers plant mostly potatoes, beans and spinach from which they make the traditional spinach pie or “lakror me spinaq” in Albanian.

loans.use: to pay for a cow

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver, 34, is the mother of two children, who both go to school. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. Her main business is dealing in secondhand clothes. 

She started her business to generate income to sustain her family. Her clients are mainly ladies. She wants this loan to buy more clothes to sell. 

Her hopes are to have a bigger business and clientele to earn more income, though competition is a problem for her.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Miraluna works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Miraluna is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Miraluna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Melliendres

texts.en:
Melliendres is 51 years old and married with two children. Melliendres works very hard to provide for them.

Melliendres runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Melliendres would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Todozia

texts.en: Todozia is a 36-year-old female, married with 7 children, living in Kasese-Uganda. Todozia has a retail shop where she works for 11 hours a day, 7days a week, and does farming for additional income. Educating her children is Todozia’s dream. Todozia has asked for a loan to buy general merchandise like curry powder, bread, and rice to sell. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inadequate capital for expansion.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like curry powder, bread, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Argie

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Argie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Argie is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more items like noodles, shampoo, spices and other groceries for her general store business.

Argie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like noodles, shampoo, spices and other groceries

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Tamara lives in Dashtadem village of the Aragatsotn region. She works at the local government. Tamara is divorced and lives with her mother and 18 year old daughter. Because of a low salary she has been forced to look for other revenue sources. In particular, she has been engaged in animal husbandry for many years. Jointly with her daughter, Tamara breeds cattle and hens. They also grow various fruits (apricot, apple). The family's agribusiness needs some investments to function in an efficient way. A loan of USD 800 will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase 220 hectares of lucerne for livestock. They will be extremely grateful to all the lenders for their support. Let's help them prove that everybody can overcome difficulties in their lives through hard and devoted work.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed (220 hectares of lucerne)

loans.name: Zhaneta

texts.en:
Zhaneta wants to buy a dairy cow; an amount of 100,000 Albanian Lek that she’s requesting from Kiva lenders will help her achieve the goal. 
Zhaneta is 54 and married with two children in their early 20s; one of them is mentally challenged. To make a living, she practices livestock and she has only a calf at the moment because the mother of the calf sadly died. She also does agriculture, planting and selling mostly corn and wheat, beans and potatoes and also animal fodder. She sells the fresh produce to wholesale/buyers that pick up the produce at her vicinity. Traditional food is beans cooked with smoked meat. During the communist era, in her village was built the concentration camp for politically sentenced people.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nelson Salvador

texts.es: Nelsosn tiene tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 14 años, 10 años y 3 meses de edad. Nelson  se dedica a la venta de chatarra desde hace 6 años y es así como logra llevar el sustento a su familia.
